2:45 MinsI'm an avid essential oil user and love diffusing different oils for their various health benefits and simply to enjoy the aroma throughout my house. This is an attractive diffuser that stands about 6.5" tall and puts out a generous enough amount of cool mist that is just about right for a bedroom (269 square feet). It reminds me of one I saw at a spa I like to go to in town and it's relaxing to me to watch the lovely lights colors change.This diffuser has a 100ml capacity and can run for about four hours before needing refilling. Just fill the included measuring cup with warm tap water, remove the top of the diffuser and pour the water into the reservoir staying below the clearly marked maximum line. Add 3 - 5 drops of your favorite essential oil, replace the lid, plug the diffuser in and then press and hold the mist button until the green light turns on and the diffuser will begin to dispense a generous amount of cool mist from the vent in the top side.The diffuser has two mist settings, and the second press of the mist button will switch the output to the higher setting which dispenses even more cool mist from the vent. I really like the fact that the mist outlet is positioned on the upper side of the diffuser rather than in the middle of the top as so many others do. That means I can direct where the mist goes to get the optimal amount of therapeutic mist where I want it. It also means you can direct it away from food items or other things you don't want the mist falling on as well.The diffuser also has a light button beside the mist button, and once pushed it starts to scroll through seven very pretty colors. You can allow it to continuously scroll through the various colors, or you can press the button again to select a color to stay on, or you can press and hold the button to turn the lights off if you wish.It's very simple to use, almost silent except for the gentle sound of water bubbling, and very relaxing too. I love that it automatically shuts off when the water level gets too low so I can set it up, start it and not worry about it. There is a green power light that remains on while the unit operates, so you may want to cover that with a piece of tape if you want total darkness.The only negative to the unit is a beep that it makes when it shuts off, so take that into consideration if you have it on a night stand and you are an extremely light sleeper. Otherwise, it's well made, puts out a generous amount of mist, runs a long time before needing a refill, and it's easy to use. Be sure to only use pure essential oils in it and clean the water tank every now & then and it should last a long time. Enjoy!Retail sample provided at no cost for my testing, evaluation, and review. I hope that my inspection and observations about the diffuser prove helpful with your decision making.

3:03 MinsThis is a versatile set of two different sized insulated lunch bags made of durable canvas with a modest amount of insulation on the inside and a Pu leather carry handle. They come flattened in plastic bags, and they have a slight odor that dissipates once allowed to air out for a few days.The small bag measures approximately 5"Lx5"Hx8"Across, and the large bag measures approximately 6"Lx6"Hx10" Across, and both appear to be well sewn with zippers that function well. The inside of each bag is fully lined in a moderate amount of that silver colored insulation material which will help keep your hot foods hot & cold foods cold for a few hours. Both are easily cleaned by wiping down with a soft damp cloth.Despite looking very small, the smaller of the two bags holds a surprising amount of stuff. I made a short video to demonstrate what it could hold, but in case you can't see videos, I'll give you a clue - it can hold a LOT.  The small bag can easily accommodate a full size sandwich in a plastic container, a drink, and snacks.  The large lunch bag fits eight standard 12 oz cans of soda, so it's actually big enough to act as a small cooler.Having two different sizes like these make it possible to use the smaller one for foods and the larger for drinks, or vice versa. You could also use the larger one as a cooler to hold water or other drinks when on an outing for the day with the kids, or use the larger one for food and the smaller one to hold medicines that need to remain chilled. As you can see, having both bags offers a lot of possibilities.  I also like the fact that when they aren't needed they can be wiped clean and stored flat until the next time you need them.  Overall, they seem useful and well made. Enjoy!Retail sample was provided for my evaluation and review. I hope that my observations prove helpful with your decision making.

When I open the door between the house and garage there's a concrete step down to the garage floor.  Unfortunately the light switch for the garage is about four feet further along the wall past the step, so I was very glad to have been offered this motion sensor light for testing and review because it's exactly what I needed to provide lighting to be able to see that step!This motion sensor light is extremely simple to set up and start using. Just twist the top open and insert 3 AAA batteries (not included) into the slots inside, then replace the cap and twist it closed again.  Peel off one side of the double sided 3M tape that's included and stick it to the back of the light. Decide where you want to place the light and peel the other side of the 3M tape off and stick the light to the wall.The motion sensor detects movement several feet out and comes on automatically casting ample light around itself to illuminate the surrounding area well enough that I could easily see the steps, the light switches and all around, making it safe for me to step down into the garage. Once you move far enough away from the light it will go off in about 10 seconds thus conserving it's battery life. Since the light itself is LED you won't need to worry about replacing bulbs either.That's it -- no wiring needed, so you can put it wherever you need to. This is wonderful for lighting around stairways or steps, in closets, pantries, basements, or literally anywhere you want some extra light.  I'm very pleased with it's quality and the amount of light it produces, and I plan to buy more of them at full price for various spots around my house. Great motion sensing light, so I'm glad to recommend it on Amazon.This motion sensor light was provided by URPOWER for evaluation and review.

3:16 MinsThis is an elegant looking Men's Quartz watch with a sleek black day date dial, stainless case, crown, stem, markers, and a stainless pilot style bracelet with hidden deployment clasp. It looks like it would cost much more than it actually does, and it has that classic style that looks so good with either casual clothes or business suits.This watch features a  Mineral Crystal which is second only to sapphire crystal, and is much more scratch resistant than the acrylic crystals more commonly found on watches at this price point. This watch also features a Japanese Miyota quartz movement which is made by Citizen, and they have an excellent reputation for reliability and accuracy.This watch features the days of the week in both Spanish and English and you can choose which language to set it to and it will hold that setting. One thing you need to know about the day date feature on these types of watches is don't set them within two or three hours of noon or midnight. If you do, you will take a chance of ruining the function.The watch features a sporty stainless steep pilot's type bracelet with hidden deployment clasp which gives it a sleek look when worn, and the company even included a link removal tool so you can adjust the bracelet to fit your wrist without having to go to a jeweler. This watch is shock and water resistant to 99 feet, so it's safe to wear while in the rain, but isn't water proof. This watch comes in a nice watch box with pillow and an elegant gift bag, so it's perfect for gifting.This watch was provided by Burei for evaluation and review. This watch's movement, crystal, and strap are remarkable in such an affordably priced watch, so if you're looking for a watch that looks great and will be reliable, I am very pleased to recommend this one very highly.

5:15 MinsTaking up only about as much space as a small can of coffee, this 300ml diffuser by URPOWER comes fully assembled and ready to use complete with measuring cup, power cord, and easy to understand manual, so I was able to have it operating within minutes of unboxing it.I know it's hard to buy something sight unseen online, so I made a short video to try and show you some of this diffuser's features and give you a real world look at  how it looks and sounds when running.  Here are some of my observations about it:Its 300 ml capacity is larger than most other diffusers and it allows this diffuser to run longer and need less frequent refills. In fact, if filled to capacity and set to "on", this diffuser can run for 8 to 10 hours and shut itself off when it detects low water volume, so I could set it up in the evening and it will run till morning without me having to worry about it.I could also set it up in the morning before leaving for work and come home to a nice smelling house and probably find the diffuser still working too. In addition to being nice to have at home, the ability to run so long also makes this diffuser an excellent choice for a beauty salon, a spa, a small office, or any sort of business as well.In fact, in addition to functioning as an aromatherapy diffuser, this diffuser is a multifunctional device that can also function as a room humidifier, an air purifier, an ionizer, or as a night light.The top of this diffuser is a little different from any I've tested before it in that you need to twist it to take it off and twist slightly to line up the dots correctly when putting it back on. This makes it slightly more difficult to accomplish than one that just lifts on and goes straight down, so you do have to be careful not to tip the diffuser when removing or replacing the lid so you don't spill anything.Other than the slightly more cumbersome twisting of the lid, the other features are straightforward and easy to operate. Use the measuring cup that's included to fill the water tank with water that doesn't go over the uppermost fill mark, add 3 - 5 drops of essential oil per 100ml - or more for stronger aroma, and less for a weaker concentration, set the time between your choice 60 mins, 180 mins, 360 mins or ON, and begin diffusing. The diffuser has a built in auto-shut off safety feature that will turn it off when it senses low water level.  I really like the fact that it diffuses from the side rather than straight up though, because that way I can aim the mist where I want it go.The diffuser also has 7 main light settings with a wide variety of shades and intensity within the colors as well, so you can choose to let the lights cycle through colors in a continual loop, or select one color to remain on and even choose the shade and intensity of that particular color by pressing the light button quickly once you see the color of your choice.  You can set one color to low intensity to function as a night light, or you can choose to turn the lights off entirely.This diffuser does have a few quirks that some people might find annoying however:1. There is a small green power light that shines whenever the diffuser is powered on, so if you want it to run without any lights you may want to tape over the power light.2.  It also beeps twice before it shuts off which may be bothersome for very light sleepers.Otherwise however, this is a beautiful and well made aromatherapy diffuser that runs quietly and puts out a generous amount of fine cool mist for up to 10 hours, and I really like it.This diffuser was provided at no cost for evaluation and review. I hope that my inspection and observations about it prove helpful with your decision making. If you have questions about the diffuser just post them in the comments section, and I'll do my best to answer based on my own experience with it.

4:11 MinsConstructed of sturdy canvas, this adorable girl's backpack has a beautiful art deco floral print on the front that goes well with the khaki colored pockets, straps, and back.  Measuring 15.75" high, this is a roomy top loading bag that features both a fold-over lid that snaps down as well as a drawstring closure option.The majority of this bag's storage space is found in its fully lined main compartment which provides plenty of usable storage space. On the front wall of the main compartment are two open pouches that could hold a cell phone and another gadget, with a small space to hold pens between them. The rear of the compartment has a zippered compartment approximately 8" long by 7" deep, and finally there is a reinforcement panel for the pack's bottom.* Unfortunately, there is no padding along the back wall of the main compartment to cushion the wearer's back from books, laptops ,or any other hard objects inside the pack. Also, the bag is wider at the base than at the top with the top opening being just 10.5" in total width, so it does make it more cumbersome to add or remove wider books or a laptop easily. Suggestion for the manufacturer - install a 3/4 length zipper along one side to allow for side access to the main compartment, and also install some padding in the back wall of the main compartment.There are three 5"x5" storage compartments on the lower front part of the bag; two with snap closure, and one with Velcro closure.  The back of the bag has another zippered compartment approximately 7" across by 6" tall, and then it has two 2" wide adjustable straps.  The stitching throughout the bag appears to be tight and well done, with reinforced stitching at all the pressure points, and canvas is very durable, so this bag should last a nice long time.I like the bag a lot, especially it's appearance, but I'm not sure it's suitable as a book bag as it is because of the narrow top opening and lack of padding to cushion the wearer's back.  It's also way too pretty to take out to the woods camping!  This is perfect for my granddaughter to wear as her carry on bag when traveling though, and it will also make a wonderful sleepover bag to carry her clothes and stuffed animals in when she sleeps over a girlfriend's houses, so that's what I plan to do with the bag.  It is beautiful and I like it, but not as a book bag. For other uses though, yes, I would gladly recommend it.This girl's canvas backpack was provided for evaluation and review. I hope that my inspection and observations about it prove helpful with your decision making. 2:20 MinsThis gaming keyboard makes my Logitech one look so boring, and it is in comparison! This is a cool looking entry level gaming keyboard with some very useful features in addition to some fun ones.I really like the black color and think it works well with the red accents, multimedia keys, and braided USB cord. It has an edgy non-slip front edge that's a bit too angled for my liking, but to my surprise I found it to be comfortable to use when the keyboard is adjusted to rest at an angle. The USB cord is long enough to easily reach the back of my computer to plug in discretely, and it seems well made.The keyboard offers seven different backlight colors that can be selected by pressing the FN+scrlk key, and there's even a pulse selection if you want flashing backlights. The lights will go off after about 3 to 5 minutes of inactivity, but you can press any key to reactivate them. They default to green, but you can cycle to get to the color you prefer and then use the FN+PaUp to make them brighter, or FN+PaDn to make them more dim.There are 8 red colored multimedia keys at the top of the board so they're easy to see and use for quick access to browser, mail and more.  I like the smooth functioning keys which you tap more like a typewriter and offer a similar click. They operated easily and without any sticking, and I believe they provide for a bit more precision than keys that are so touch sensitive that you barely brush it and it registers. Oh, and in case you press 19 keys together the instruction sheet says it won't cause any conflict. In fact, it says it will supposedly "make game more fast".If you flip the keyboard over, you'll find there are two pop up legs that allow you to set the keyboard at an angle, and there are also drain holes in case something gets spilled. I can think of a couple of times that would have come in handy for me!  If you're a seasoned hard core gamer, this probably isn't what you're looking for. If on the other hand you're looking for a cool multimedia keyboard that can handle gaming as well, then this one will probably be just right for you.I purchased this keyboard at a reduced cost in exchange for product testing and offering my honest opinion.

Although I use many essential oils on a daily basis, I had never heard of Helichrysum before being offered a bottle of it to review. Getting to try something new is always fascinating, so I was happy to get to try this.  I've spent some time studying it's uses and they are too numerous to list here, but let's just say it's very versatile!This oil is a yellowish color, thin, and has a strong scent that's hard to describe- sort of like fresh straw, but fruity and kind of sweet too. Not at all unpleasant but powerful.  This oil has strong antibiotic and antimicrobial properties that make it a great natural cure for acne that works without drying the skin or causing redness and other unwanted side effects. Since my daughter has troubles with acne  now & then I suggested that she try it out, and she has been for the past week with good results. Those several spots she had on her face have subsided, and hopefully this may help reduce the number of new ones.I also read that helichrysum oil decreases muscle pain by lowering swelling, inflammation and improving circulation. When mixed with a carrier oil and massaged into sore muscles and joints it's supposed to be an effective natural treatment for pain related symptoms of arthritis, fibromyalgia and exercise-related injuries. You can use it along with lavender oil, which is also excellent to reduce pain and emotional stress.This Helichrysum essential oil is advertised as 100% pure therapeutic grade oil, and I have no reason to doubt that claim. It comes in a 10ml size dark amber glass bottle with a built-in Euro-dropper cap which helps you measure out the number of drops you want without any waste. I'm intrigued by it's many uses, so I am pleased to recommend it on Amazon.Retail sample provided at no cost by Natural Acres for my testing, evaluation, and review.

There's something about the scent of Cedar that puts me in a serene and relaxed state of mind whenever I diffuse it, so I was very pleased to receive a bottle of Cedar Wood essential Oil from Natural Acres to review.  I've been doing some reading to learn the many ways this oil is used and am amazed to learn how versatile and useful it is.It turns out that Cedarwood Essential Oil is used to treat Seborrheic Eczema, is safe to apply on wounds as an antiseptic, reduces painful joint inflammations such as arthritis, reduces muscle spasms, strengthens the grip of gums on teeth, and as an insecticide.  When used in vaporizers, it drives away mosquitoes, flies and other insects in a large area around the house, and when spritzed onto pillows it can keep mosquitoes and flies away while you sleep.Please note: Unlike some essential oils, cedarwood oil cannot be ingested in any quantity. It is a highly potent oil, and can cause vomiting, nausea, and thirst, and extensive damage to the digestive system.This Cedarwood essential oil is advertised as 100% pure therapeutic grade oil, and I have no reason to doubt that claim. It comes in a 10ml size dark amber glass bottle with a built-in Euro-dropper cap which helps you measure out the number of drops you want without any waste. The woodsy-balsamic aroma of this Cedarwood oil is wonderful, so I will continue to use it and am pleased to recommend it on Amazon.Retail sample provided at no cost by Natural Acres for my testing, evaluation, and review.

When diffused Basil oil helps reduce anxiety and promote focus, so I'm starting to diffuse it while she does her homework.If diffusing it as she does homework seems to be helpful, then I'll get her one of those adorable diffuser necklaces so she can have some to inhale at school too. One downside about basil is the aroma makes me hungry though! It comes in a 10ml size dark amber glass bottle with a built-in Euro-dropper cap which helps you measure out the number of drops you want without any waste. The aroma of this Basil oil smells wonderful, so I will continue to use it and am pleased to recommend it on Amazon.Retail sample provided at no cost by Natural Acres for my testing, evaluation, and review

Of all the essential oils on the market, Peppermint oil is the one I use the most of around the house, so I was delighted to be given a bottle by Natural Acres to review.  Besides having a wonderful aroma that brings happy thoughts of Christmas to mind, Peppermint essential oil is my go to agent for keeping my house free of yucky spiders and mice!Yep, the creepy crawly things despise Peppermint oil so I make a spray to spritz thresholds, windowsills, and dark corners behind appliances on a weekly basis.  I also wet cotton balls with some and place them at the corners of my garage doors to help keep mice out and it really does work so, so if you have spiders or other issues give Peppermint oil a try.Every time the seasons change I seem to come down with a cold and last year it turned into bronchitis. I've learned that I could add some drops of peppermint oil to boiling water and inhale the steam to clear up congestion, clogged sinuses, and fight off a cold faster, so I'll definitely be giving that a try next time I get sick.  You can also add a few drops of it along with some drops of eucalyptus oil to a carrier oil to make a chest rub to help relieve congestion, so I plan to try that too.This Peppermint essential oil is advertised as 100% pure therapeutic grade oil, and I have no reason to doubt that claim. It comes in a 10ml size dark amber glass bottle with a built-in Euro-dropper cap which helps you measure out the number of drops you want without any waste. The aroma of this peppermint oil smells fabulous (and makes me hungry), so I will definitely continue to use it and am pleased to recommend it on Amazon.Retail sample provided at no cost by Natural Acres for my testing, evaluation, and review.

Despite the labeling on the package and the tag on the product, these cloths are not genuine Japanese Salux Cloths, and they don't feel as good.  They're close to the original, but thinner and with a looser weave so they feel more scratchy when used.  I'm adding a photo below of what the girl's picture looks like on the genuine Salux product so you can see what the genuine product package looks like.I located the counterfeit ones being sold here and passed as genuine Salux cloths on Alibaba and if you do a search there you can find them as well and will see that they match the product being sold on this page. The ones listed on Alibaba look exactly like the ones in this product listing - same packaging, same "Made in Japan" markings and same picture of the girl - but the listing says they're made by GUAGUALUO in Gua, China.These pseudo-Salux cloths do foam up nicely and they don't feel awful when using them, but they also don't feel as good as the genuine ones do either. Since the Chinese recognize that the real product is worth attempting to imitate, I'd rather spend my dollars supporting the folks who make the real product, so I'll be buying genuine Salux cloths rather than these from now on.I purchased this product at a reduced cost in exchange for product testing and offering my honest opinion.

You might wonder why anyone who has a way to boil water would need an electric egg cooker. I wouldn't blame you for the question because it's one I asked myself - before I tried this product.  Now that I've tried it, I can tell you why I think it's worthwhile - it makes perfect easy to peel hard boiled eggs every single time I use it!Actually the egg cooker can make perfectly cooked soft, medium, or hard boiled eggs depending on your preference and steams them to perfection without your having to stick around to monitor the process.  I love making deviled eggs, but hate it when I tear the egg when peeling it. That isn't a problem with this egg cooker because you pierce the eggs before starting to steam them. For some reason, piercing the egg prevents it from cracking during cooking and makes the shell super easy to peel cleanly off after they cool, leaving you with perfect looking boiled eggs.To make soft, medium, or hard boiled eggs in this egg cooker:1. Fill the measuring cup that came with the cooker to the line marked for soft, medium, or hard boiled eggs (depending on the type you want to make), then pour the water into the water holding tray.2. Place the plastic egg holder tray onto the cooker positioned above the water tray.3. Using the pin at the bottom of the plastic measuring cup pierce the bottom of an egg (THE LARGEST PART OF THE EGG) with the pin4. Place the pierced egg PIERCED SIDE UP into the egg holder tray5. repeat steps 3 & 4 until you have the number of eggs you want to cook in the tray (up to 7)6. Place the lid on the cooker7. Select soft, medium, or hard boiled and move the dial to that position (refer to manual for diagram if necessary)8. Plug cooker in and move rocker switch to "ON" position.9. Wait until cooking is finished10. Remove eggs once cooking is finished and immerse immediately in cold water to stop cooking process11. Eggs are now ready to top, peel, and eat!Easy to use, safely turns off when done, and easy clean up by wiping dry with a paper towel.  It took me a few tries to get it just right, but now that I have the eggs are coming out beautifully and they are super easy to peel this way. The first time I tried cooking the eggs I pierced the top of the eggs though and egg oozed out through the hole and I made a mess of it, so use the larger end and that won't happen to you!I also figured out that this egg cooker makes "poached eggs" but they're different than what we're accustomed to so I didn't recognize it immediately, but then it came to me - the "medium hard boiled eggs" are the same as poached eggs once you slice into them! So, to make eggs benedict set the egg cooker to medium hard boiled and then position the cooked egg over the Canadian Bacon on top of an English muffin half and slice the egg in half. Serve one half per half of the English muffin and top with Hollandaise as usual. Voila!This is a convenient way to make trouble free soft, medium, and hard boiled eggs that are cooked just right each time, and the eggs peel more easily and cleanly too so you can make beautiful presentations using this cooker. I like it and plan to continue to use it, so I am pleased to recommend it on Amazon.I purchased this egg cooker at a reduced cost in exchange for product testing and offering my honest opinion. I hope that my inspection and observations about it prove helpful with your decision making. If you have questions about it just post them in the comments section, and I'll do my best to answer based on my own experience with it.

This Frankincense essential oil from Natural Acres is nice and clear colored, and it has the typical aroma that I find so very alluring.Frankincense essential oil added to facial cream does wonders for helping to reduce wrinkles and repair the damage the environment does to our skin, and you can even add some drops to water to make a toner. I've also read that Frankincense oil also has terrific anti-inflammatory properties, so adding a few drops to a carrier like Jojoba oil or coconut oil and then massaging arthritic joints will help provide relief.This Frankincense essential oil is advertised as 100% pure therapeutic grade oil, and I have no reason to doubt that claim. I was pleased to receive a bottle of Bergamot Essential Oil to review because I find its citrusy & floral scent very pleasant and relaxing. I've read that Bergamot is used in aromatherapy to help soothe nerves and reduce tension, anxiety, and stress, so I blended several drops of it together with some drops of lavender essential oil and diffused it on my night stand at bedtime. Did it reduce my stress level? I think so because I certainly found it's aroma soothing and I slept very well.  I've also diffused it in the living room and It makes my home smell heavenly and seems to lift everyone's mood as well.In addition to aromatherapy benefits, you can add a drop or two of Bergamot to your favorite skin care product for added cleansing properties, to balance your skin tone, and to help make scars and other marks less prominent. Bergamot can also stimulate and regenerate skin cells giving life to dull complexions, and it has powerful antiseptic and antibiotic properties that help remove the bacteria that can cause acne from our skin.*** Here's a very important fact about Bergamot that I read online:  Bergamot oil must be protected from sunlight, because bergaptene, one of its components, becomes poisonous if exposed to sunlight. That is why the oil should always be stored in dark bottles in dark places. Exposure to sunlight should even be avoided after it is applied or rubbed onto the skin, at least until it absorbs into your skin- and never apply it directly to your skin unless blended with a carrier oil like Fractionated Coconut Oil, Jojoba Oil or other carrier.***This Bergamot essential oil is advertised as 100% pure therapeutic grade oil, and I have no reason to doubt that claim. It comes in a 10ml size dark amber glass bottle with a built-in Euro-dropper cap which helps you measure out the number of drops you want without any waste. The aroma of this Bergamot oil is wonderful, so I will continue to use it and am pleased to recommend it on Amazon.Retail sample provided at no cost by Natural Acres for my testing, evaluation, and review.

I bought two of these 8 years ago and they're still functioning perfectly. Back then we were living in a coyote infested area of Arizona, and the concentrated beam and distance these lights put out allowed me to scan the perimeter of the back yard and surrounding area for coyotes to protect my pet dogs when I took them out at night.We've since moved to a rural area of Texas and the lights are still my favorites because sometimes I have to go outside in the dark to turn off a septic system alarm or take the dogs out, and I'll grab one of these to take with to light my way as well as check the meadows and woods around for anything out there.With the distance the light beam penetrates I think I'll be able to spot "red eyes" of any predators, and if not at least I can blind anything that gets too close long enough to make it safely back to my door. I also feel better knowing that this flashlight is long and sturdy enough for me to use it for self defense in certain situations as well.  The 7060 isn't inexpensive, but it's proven it's worth to me time after time, and it's still going strong. 0:44 MinsThese My Busy Dog boots are adorable!  Hurricane Patricia is slated to make landfall and then head towards Texas, so they arrived just in time to get to try them out on one of my dogs before the rains hit us here, and it was hilarious watching him take his first steps in them. Like watching a dog trying to moonwalk! *lol*The important thing is that they do stay on him, but I think the size chart might be a bit off. I measured my 12# Silky Terrier's paws per the instructions and then ordered a size 4 accordingly, but they wouldn't stay on him for anything. Next I tried them on my Maltese-Westy mix who weighs about 18 - 20 pounds and they stay on him - but only if the Velcro is snugged down as tightly as possible around his foreleg. I hope those examples prove to be somewhat helpful as you try to order to correct size for your dog.I definitely like the boots. Besides being adorable looking on the dog, they're waterproof, have Velcro closures that let me fit them securely on his feet, and one of them is reflective which is always a nice safety feature. I love the rubber treaded non-slip soles best of all though because in my part of Texas we have terrible sticker burrs in the pasture grass that get stuck in my dog's paws and it's painful for them, so the soles of these boots will protect his paws from rain, mud, slipping, and sticker burrs! Hooray!I took a short video of his first experience wearing the boots so you could see how funny he looked walking in them, but it didn't take him very long at all after I shot the video for him to get used to them and go back to running around as usual.  It was funny though.  I like these boots and think they're well made. Just read people's reviews to find a pattern of which size boots work for what size dog before ordering.
