2:17 MinsThis is a very well made universal stand for cell phones and tablets of up to 10" that provides a secure way to hold the device in either portrait or landscape positions and allows for 270 degrees of rotation.Measuring a slim 4x3" when collapsed, this stand is lightweight yet made of sturdy PVC and PE material that can support up to 11 pounds of weight.  It can be folded flat for tucking into luggage or a purse, or positioned into a plethora of different angles by adjusting the kickstand on the rear of the stand. The kickstand allows 270 degrees of rotation in 1 degree increments and securely locks into position where you want it anywhere from nearly flat to upright!I can't begin to describe how badly I needed this and how much I love it!  It's exactly what I needed to read in bed, and it's what my kids need in order to use their IPads more conveniently while doing their homework at the table.  This is going to really come in handy to prop my iPad up with when I'm reading a recipe while cooking, for reading or watching a movie in bed, and for taking along when I travel.I love the attention to detail such as the soft padding along the base that protects my devices from scratches, and the feet on the bottom to protect tables and other surfaces as well. This is a very solidly made stand that's stable on a variety of surfaces, small enough to easily carry along on a trip, offers protection for both my device and the surface it's set on, has multiple adjustment angles that lock in place, and is very affordable.You get a lot of bang for the buck with this universal tablet stand, and it works like a champ, so it's an easy recommend. Enjoy!I purchased this universal portable stand at a reduced cost in exchange for product testing and offering my honest opinion. I hope that my inspection and observations about it prove helpful with your decision making. If you have questions about the stand just post them in the comments section, and I'll do my best to answer based on my own experience with it.

2:49 MinsThis is a gorgeous set of multicolored solar string lights that's 15.7' long with 20 red, gold, green, and blue raindrop shaped LED lights that put out enough bright colorful light to turn any occasion into a festive one. I love solar string lights because I can put them up virtually anywhere without worrying about outlets, and they don't cost me anything to run.This particular set comes with an attached solar panel that's pre-charged, but you should still stick it in full sun for about 6 hours to charge it fully before using it. Please be sure to peel the protective film off of the panel before placing it in the sun or it could melt onto the panel and reduce the efficiency.  The set comes with a two part plastic garden stake that you snap together and attach to the rear of the solar panel, and then you just place the panel in a location near where you want to install the lights and where you can get the most direct sunlight possible.There's a bit over 6' of cord between the solar panel and the first light which gives you a decent amount of room to place your panel and string the lights, and there's also about 5.5" between each LED bulb. The set is photo sensing so you just set the panel to the on position and the lights will be off during the daylight and come on automatically at dusk. When the solar panel is fully charged the lights can stay on brightly for about 8 hours.There's a "mode" button on the back of the solar panel right next to the power button. These lights have 2 operating modes which include steady on and blinking. The entire set is weatherproof, so you can safely use these outdoors regardless of weather conditions. You can't daily chain these solar light sets though, so each strand requires it's own solar panel.LED lights don't get hot like incandescent bulbs do, so these are safe to use indoors or outdoors. You can decorate trees and bushes out in your yard, use them on your porch railings, inside to frame a window, or anywhere you want as long as the solar panel can be placed in direct sunlight to charge. Solar string lights are easy to use and make things look festive, so they're wonderful to use when decorating for Christmas, New Year's birthdays, or any special occasion.I love fairy lights and this set is no exception. It puts out a very nice amount of bright multicolored light that looks gorgeous, so it's an easy recommend. Enjoy!This lovely set of multicolored solar string lights was provided by Goodia  for evaluation and review. I hope that my inspection and observations about it prove helpful with your decision making. If you have questions about the light set just post them in the comments section, and I'll do my best to answer based on my own experience with it.

I'm a huge believer in essential oils and am actively striving to eliminate chemical laden products from our daily life as much as possible, so I was delighted to be able to try this organic pest control spray.We moved into a new house several months ago and we've had a horrible time with big banana spiders and scorpions, so I was hoping that this could provide a safe product that would kill them as well as deter them. According to the product description and the ingredients listed on the label this is safe for indoor use and won't harm children or pets, and we have two small dogs so this sounds like the perfect solution.Unfortunately the bottle that I received hasn't been effective for actually killing the spiders I sprayed it on so far. I tested it last night and some this morning by spraying it directly on two rather large spiders I found inside and one on the back porch. I sprayed a LOT on each of them and they seemed more offended than sickly.The two inside scurried away behind furniture, and the one on the back porch moved to a different place on it's web and just kept relocating as I sprayed it. I haven't seen a scorpion to try it on yet, but if it isn't working on our spiders I don't have much confidence in it's ability to kill a scorpion. I am spraying what's left along the bottom edges of doors and around window casings in case it works better for me as a deterrent.Perhaps this kills smaller spiders or other insects better than really large spiders though. I'm not having any problem with anything except for spiders and an occasional scorpion though, so I'm afraid I'm disappointed.Retail product provided at no cost by Eco Defense for my testing, evaluation, and review.

2:58 MinsConstructed of durable cotton canvas, this very attractive retro style light brown laptop messenger bag is well complimented by brown PU leather trim and brass hardware. Measuring 12" high by 17.5" wide, this is a roomy bag that features both a zippered closure as well as a fold-over lid with straps and buckles.The majority of this bag's storage space is found in its fully lined main compartment which provides 16.5 " x 11" total usable space. The bag's main compartment can easily accommodate a laptop up to 15.6" plus books or other items. On the front wall of the main compartment there is a 7" long by 5" high zippered compartment, and the rear wall hosts a 16" x 11" padded laptop or tablet compartment with Velcro closure. The rear wall is padded down the entirety of it's length plus there is a reinforcement panel for the pack's bottom.The front of the bag also has two roomy 7" long by 5.5" high compartments that feature snap closures as well as latches to the top straps. The sides of the bag each have an approximately 6" high by 4" wide pocket that closes with PU leather flap and buckle. These compartments could be opened to store water bottles or secured by the flap and buckle to tuck away additional storage items.The top of the bag has a comfortably wide web carry handle affixed to the upper portion and well reinforced at all stress points. Finally, the bag also offers a well padded webbed shoulder strap that adjusts from approximately 33" to 55" total to accommodate all heights.It's tough to beat canvas for durability and this classic laptop messenger bag is no exception. You're likely to have this available to you for as long as you want it. All stitching is of good quality with reinforced stitching at the bag's pressure points. Straps and buckles are well made and straps are reinforced at pressure points.This retro style laptop messenger bag is really good looking, stylish, functional, and durable. It would work well for men or women as a school back pack, and could also work as well for hiking, fishing, or traveling. I absolutely love it and plan to use it on my trip to Italy next month!  It's excellent quality and usefulness make this messenger bag an easy recommend. Enjoy!This messenger bag was provided for by Observ for my evaluation and review. I hope that my inspection and observations about it prove helpful with your decision making. If you have questions about the bag just post them in the comments section, and I'll do my best to answer based on my own experience with it.

3:06 MinsWhenever I find round, chuck, sirloin, or brisket on sale I buy some extra to grind up into hamburger meat which I then vacuum seal and freeze. It doesn't always save me money, but at least I know exactly what it's made of, how fresh it is, and how it was handled.Up until now I've been using the grinding attachment for my electric mixer, but I dread having to do that because the mixer is heavy, which makes it a real chore for me to get it out and set up. On top of that, my stand mixer is only 325 watts, so it's not even able to grind as much meat per minute as this grinder can.This stainless steel meat grinder by Avan-Pacific is light enough to move around without straining myself, yet it's plenty stable and sits solidly on the counter when I use it. It operates on 400 watts, so it's powerful enough to grind 3 pounds of meat per minute which is much faster than my stand mixer could manage.It's very simple to set up, simple to use, and comes with everything I need to grind meats, make homemade sausages, and even includes an attachment for making the meat tubes for Kibbeh!  It's as easy to disassemble to clean the parts when I'm done as it was to put them together, and I just hand wash, rinse, let air dry, and then wipe down the grinding plates with vegetable oil to keep them in good shape till next time.With just four Blu-ray backlit controls, the grinder is extremely user friendly with just an on/off rocker, a grind, off, and reverse switch. The machine is made of high quality stainless steel, food grade aluminum, and ABS plastic, and meets all US safety standards. It's fire proof, has built in circuit overload protection and anti-surge protection as well, and comes with a one year manufacturer warranty.I made a brief video so you could see it being used, so I pre-cut and slightly chilled a 4 pound bottom round roast which I ground using the medium grinding plate.  You'll want to cut your meat into strips or chunks slightly more narrow than the width of the feed tube before you begin grinding. If you're using especially fatty meats it helps to chill them slightly to firm the fats up before you grind them.This meat grinder costs a lot less than my stand mixer did, and my stand mixer didn't come with the meat grinder accessory which had to be purchased separately. In fact, the sausage making accessory is also an additional purchase for my mixer, but it all comes with this Avan-Pacific grinder, making it a very good value.You get a lot of bang for the buck with this meat grinder and it works like a champ, so it's an easy recommend. Enjoy!I purchased this meat grinder at a reduced cost in exchange for product testing and offering my honest opinion. I hope that my inspection and observations about it prove helpful with your decision making. If you have questions about the grinder just post them in the comments section, and I'll do my best to answer based on my own experience with it.

5:55 MinsI own several aromatherapy diffusers, but none of them can run as long as this one can!  Unlike any other diffuser I own, this Diffuscent model by Naska holds 500 ml of water and can safely run for as long as 10 hours at a time diffusing aromatic essential oils throughout my home.In fact, in addition to functioning as an aromatherapy diffuser, the Diffuscent is a multifunctional device that can also function as a room humidifier, an air purifier, an ionizer, or as a night light. Taking up only about as much space as a half gallon ice cream container, this diffuser comes fully assembled and ready to use complete with measuring cup, power cord, and easy to understand manual, so I was able to have it operating within minutes of unboxing it.Fill the water chamber using the included 150ml measuring cup up to the amount you desire, then add 3 to 5 drops of your preferred essential oil per 100 ml. Be sure to use pure essential oils only so you don't damage the sensors or elements in the diffuser. Then set the lid on with the outlet over the vent opening and touch the Mist button to turn the diffuser on and set the time.Using the mist button you can select the running time between 60,120,180 minutes, or continuous "on" which will run until you manually stop it or the machine runs too low on water. It has a built-in auto shut off for low water so you can safely set it and forget it without worrying. In addition to setting the running time, you can also select the intensity of mist you want to dispense to increase or decrease it, and you can also select the light mode you desire.This diffuser has 8 primary light colors that operate in a total of 16 hues. You can operate the diffuser with no light on, or you can allow them to cycle from one color to the next in a continuous loop, or you can choose a color you prefer for it to remain on and press the light button to set it at that color. Once set at that color, you can then use the light button again to choose between a bright shade of the color or a dimmer version which makes an excellent nightlight.I love diffusing essential oils throughout my house, and this one will work the longest time and put out more cool mist than any other I have, so I'm going to use it on the kitchen counter to diffuse throughout the living room.  I love the volume of mist this diffuser puts out and the colorful lights in the evening. Note:  I suggest having a paper towel handy when you remove the cover after running the diffuser as condensate may have formed there and it might drip.This is a beautiful and well made aromatherapy diffuser that runs quietly and puts out a generous amount of fine cool mist for up to 10 hours, making it an easy recommend. I love it and think that you will too. Enjoy!This diffuser was provided at no cost for evaluation and review. I hope that my inspection and observations about it prove helpful with your decision making. If you have questions about the diffuser just post them in the comments section, and I'll do my best to answer based on my own experience with it.

0:44 MinsThese My Busy Dog boots are adorable!  Hurricane Patricia is slated to make landfall and then head towards Texas, so they arrived just in time to get to try them out on one of my dogs before the rains hit us here, and it was hilarious watching him take his first steps in them. Like watching a dog trying to moonwalk! *lol*The important thing is that they do stay on him, but I think the size chart might be a bit off. I measured my 12# Silky Terrier's paws per the instructions and then ordered a size 4 accordingly, but they wouldn't stay on him for anything. Next I tried them on my Maltese-Westy mix who weighs about 18 - 20 pounds and they stay on him - but only if the Velcro is snugged down as tightly as possible around his foreleg. I hope those examples prove to be somewhat helpful as you try to order to correct size for your dog.I definitely like the boots. Besides being adorable looking on the dog, they're waterproof, have Velcro closures that let me fit them securely on his feet, and one of them is reflective which is always a nice safety feature. I love the rubber treaded non-slip soles best of all though because in my part of Texas we have terrible sticker burrs in the pasture grass that get stuck in my dog's paws and it's painful for them, so the soles of these boots will protect his paws from rain, mud, slipping, and sticker burrs! Hooray!I took a short video of his first experience wearing the boots so you could see how funny he looked walking in them, but it didn't take him very long at all after I shot the video for him to get used to them and go back to running around as usual.  It was funny though.  I like these boots and think they're well made. Just read people's reviews to find a pattern of which size boots work for what size dog before ordering. Enjoy!I purchased these waterproof dog boots at a reduced cost in exchange for product testing and offering my honest opinion. I hope that my inspection and observations about it prove helpful with your decision making. If you have questions about the boots just post them in the comments section, and I'll do my best to answer based on my own experience with it.

I love essential oils, so I was pleased to see that this Moisturizing Olive and Jojoba Body Oil by Luseta contained 100% pure and natural essential and carrier oils rich in vitamins and nutrients beneficial for healthy skin and hair, and nothing else.  The product comes in a 4oz. size clear plastic bottle that's styled like an antique elixir bottle, so it would make a very nice addition to a gift basket ensemble.Safe to use on skin or hair, the oil has a distinct lavender scent that some will like, and others like myself won't care for all that much.  Although the bottle comes equipped with a reducer I still found that it dispenses liberally, so be careful how much you pour. It's best to use a small amount and gently massage it in until absorbed before applying more. In my case at least, I found that it absorbed into my skin very quickly once applied and massaged in for a moment or two, and then it left my skin feeling soft and moisturized. I like using it for my face, neck, arms, legs, and cuticles. If you use it in your hair I suggest you just moisten the fingertips and run them through the ends of your hair rather than adding the product to your hair directly. That way you can better regulate how much oil you're applying and avoid oily looking hair. The oils in this product will help nourish your hair follicles, repair dry hair, stop spilt ends, and produce a healthy looking shine.Ingredients in this product include Olea Europaea (Olive) Fruit Oil, Ethlhexyl Palmitate, Glycine Soja (Soybean) Oil, Vitis Vinifera (Grape) Seed Oil, Triticum Vulgare (Wheat) Germ Oil, Tocopheryl Acetate, Parfum, Prunus Amygdalus Dulcis (Sweet Almond) Oil, Linoleic Acid, Linolenic Acid, Lavandula Angustifolia (Lavender) Oil.Possible allergy risks: Soybean Oil, Wheat Germ Oil** Oddly enough I do not see Jojoba Oil listed among the ingredients. I called the manufacturer and they stated that this lot had a mistake in the label that omitted it, but it is included and the labels are being fixed.  This is a nice moisturizing oil blend that's loaded with beneficial ingredients good for healthy skin and hair.Product supplied at no cost by Luseta for evaluation and review.

This is a sleek looking red universal cylinder knife block that safely houses 12 knifes up to 8.9" long. Measuring approximately 4" around by 9" high, this block has a unique dual layer v-slot design in the top that allows knifes to go in and come out with ease and also protects their finish.This is so much more convenient than a standard knife block where each knife has to go in it's specific slot. With this SimPrium cylinder block I can quickly slip a knife into the opening anywhere there's a space and it will fit just fine. I fit a set of six various ceramic knives in just to test it and they inserted easily and were easy to extract for use as well. I also tried putting a stainless steel butcher knife in to see if it would fit and it does!This knife block is unique, versatile, extremely useful and it looks great in the kitchen too. It's has a soft matte finish and feels lightweight, yet it's stable on the counter, doesn't slip or slide, and doesn't tip when I withdraw knives. In fact it moves less than my large wooden knife block does. Keeping it clean is easy since I can just wipe off the top, or if I need a more thorough cleaning I can take the knives out and run water through the top to flush the block out completely.Made from Polypropylene for strength and dimensional stability with a TPR coating, this knife block looks sleek and modern and is made to last fro years to come, so it's an easy recommend. I love it and if you're looking for something to safely house your knives in I recommend it without reservations. It's beautiful!I purchased this red universal cylinder knife block at a reduced cost in exchange for product testing and offering my honest opinion. I hope that my inspection and observations about it prove helpful with your decision making. If you have questions about the knife block just post them in the comments section, and I'll do my best to answer based on my own experience with it.

I ordered this stopper in the hope that it would be a close replacement for the one the plumber installed when the house was built. The great news was that it was identical! The stopper works by "push to close - push again to open" operation, and my original didn't want to open any more.It's an easy screw-in replacement that requires (at most) a flat head screwdriver (you screw off the chrome cap by hand to expose the brass fitting with the notch for the screw driver).  Don't over-tighten it, just a snug fit is all you need.As others have cautioned - be sure of your size before ordering (or if in doubt get both, they are cheap enough!).  3/8" is about the diameter of a standard pencil or BIC pen. Take yours out and look at the screw to determine the size or measure with calipers if you are able. Otherwise hold end-to-end with a pencil - same diameter? Then you need 3/8". Smaller than the pencil? You need 5/16.

I'm giving four stars for my initial review, because I don't have enough experience with the new Griot's Cleaner Wax to say how durable it is over time.  I will update at the bottom of this review (and may modify the rating if necessary) in time.I've waited a long time for Griot's to offer a cleaner wax.  I've used Meguire's cleaner wax for decades with good results. For several years now, I have been using many Griot's products and am happy to see this added to the collection. A cleaner wax will remove some oxidation, some grime, and old wax layers - which reduces the number of steps you need to do and saves you work.  This wax seems to do a good job of that. I first used it without using a clay bar first - to test its cleaning capability. The results were very good, and it seemed to strip the micro-contaminants and wax remnants away nicely, leaving an even and very smooth coat.  Application is easy - it goes on smooth, and dries to a haze in just a few minutes. Removal is also easy if you don't over-apply.At its core is hard carnauba  wax - offering long lasting, shiny, and strong protection. Can be applied manually or with an orbital. I used the Griot's foam wax pad, and buffed with a clean microfiber towel, and my results have been very good. I'll keep this in stock in the garage for sure!

Use a lot of caution if you are considering this holster as an actual "carry" solution. For that purpose, I cannot recommend it under any circumstances! I knew it would be iffy for fitment of some pistols, and I really just wanted it as a "fits many" type of solution for range work or training. But alas, I've yet to find a pistol that fits in this holster properly. Here are just a few I have tried: Glock 17, Glock 23, S&W M&P 9, S&W M&P 45, Sig Sauer P226/P227, Walther PPQ, Walther PPX; Springfield XD...  I've probably tried more, but those are the ones that come to mind.Problem is the plastic "sleeve" inside the holster. It does a nice job of keeping the holster held open, but it creates what is essentially a plastic tube that has no elasticity at all and will not conform to the pistol. And because it's not made for any specific gun - no gun really fits it.  The other big problem is the stitching that creates the trigger guard portion of the holster.  It is shallow and poorly designed, and is really only the sandwiching of the two layers of material sewn together.  Only fairly small pistols in the range of those that should fit it (4" to 5" barrel pistols) can even be pushed in far enough that the trigger is not exposed.Trying to force pistols into the holster usually results in forcing the slide back - which would take it out of battery and is completely unacceptable of course.  And don't even get me started on the retention strap (first off, you don't need a retention strap on a IWB holster any more than you need a clutch pedal in a car with an auto tranny). The strap in inflexible and does not position well for practical use. Thankfully it can be removed! Some dedicated work and break-in might make in so-so for me for some limited range use.I have not yet found a pistol that fits it well, and I've tried a bunch. For a range holster I might still be able to use it with a gun or two. But please reconsider if you are looking at this for a concealed carry holster! That is not a place to skimp - look elsewhere!

My GSD loves these treats!  And I don't mind giving him one every day, because the ingredients are good and the texture helps keep his teeth clean.  I've used Natural Balance dog food products for years and have come to trust the brand for nutrition and quality. These treats are a nice addition to the lineup!  The texture is very firm, but not too hard.  Another thing I like about them is that they don't produce crumbs. My dog is a slob about crumbs - he leaves them on the floor (wish he would lick them up, but no). So these save me extra cleaning!

These blue rubber gloves are very good for all general purpose uses.  The only minor drawback (and reason for 4 rather than 5 stars) is that they fit me a little loose - unlike traditional rubber/surgical gloves that expand to fit your hand.  What you lose is just a little bit of fine fingertip capability - but I found that you can draw them tighter into the webs of the fingers and it really helps.The gloves are powdered just enough for easy on/off but not overly so.  I've used them for automotive work, workbench work, cleaning jobs, etc. and they are very durable. I've yet to have one tear or break.A good glove and a good value. I keep a box of these in the workshop and one in the garage!

After having to replace a dead original remote with one of the horrible Genie new style 3-button remotes, I was so frustrated with its poor function that I was considering having the entire unit replaced to get a new system.  What's worse - it was my wife that had to use it. Yep - so don't think I didn't get evil looks and nasty complaints every day.I knew this old style one-button remote was no longer made, so I was thrilled to find this one available. It cost about 3X what it should have - and the packaging was dusty and yellowed with age - and the original battery in it was dead. But it was still worth it - know why? BECAUSE IT WORKS!!! Took only a couple minutes to put in a new battery (which I had planned for) and get it programmed, and then in turn use it to program the Homelink system in the vehicle.So, if you've tried the new style remotes with similar frustration and you see one of these for sale - even at high prices - BUY IT.

You simply can't go wrong with this bundle of Apple iPhone 5/5s silicone protectors. I specifically needed this style protector/skin for the phone so that I can easily slip the phone in and out of it (I have a dock in the car that doesn't allow for any case).  These fit the bill perfectly, and offer excellent protection.  It is also a bonus that my wife an I can use different colors to avoid grabbing the wrong phone.The cases fit the phone perfectly and provide a soft cushion. It also prevents the phone from sliding around, due to the friction of the silicone shell - unlike some hard cases that are slippery.The bundle also includes two clear screen protectors - what a great deal!!

First thing you need to know is that these shorts (just like the long pants of the same brand) run SMALL. Order at least one full even or odd size up, and you should be okay. If you wear 32, get a 34, and so on.The Propper shorts are identical to the long pants, and I like them both very much. In most ways, they are nearly the same as 5.11 tactical pants/shorts - they even have the same type pockets (including the excellent cell phone pocket on the left).  But the back pockets of the Proppers are preferable to me - rather than just a huge pouch (ala 5.11) they have a pocket-inside-a-pocket.  This gives you a well fitting rear pocket for your wallet, with a larger outer pocket around it.  Very nice.The Propper brand is good, and makes well manufactured and durable clothes. Much less expensive than 5.11's and worth a look. Just remember to order a size larger!

So far - so good.  I have only used the folding wagon a couple of times so far, but it is doing exactly what I bought it for.  I think a lot of the problems some folks have with it might be due to overloading or imbalance of loads.  This is a folding device, so by definition it will not be rigid and as sturdy as a solid fixed-size device.It fits a LOT of gear - especially if you get creative about packing and stacking! I use mine to tote a lot of range bags, camera bags, folding chairs, tripods, coolers - you name it. It does a very nice job.  I have pulled it over some very uneven and rough terrain and it did well.  Sure, it would be nice to have large pneumatic wheels, but then you lose the compact size.The wagon folds and unfolds VERY EASILY - there is one center pull at the bottom of the wagon that will fold it right up - similar to modern strollers and other devices. The provided cover and adjustable straps ensure that it remains folded and makes it easy to handle.  There is also a durable handle that once folded, makes it easy to carry.This is a great solution for those of us who need something to drag all our gear around, but can't or don't want to sacrifice the space needed for a full sized fixed wagon or cart.I plan to use this wagon frequently and I don't plan to baby it. If I have any problems with wear, breaking, sturdiness in the future - you can bet I'll update this review.  As of now - highly recommended!

These brushes are a must have for the work bench or hobby room.  They are inexpensive, and I love the bulk pack of 36.  The horsehair bristles are nice and long, so they flex well and allow applications to be delicate when necessary. My expectations were surpassed. I expected a lot of shedding of the hairs in the brush, but have experience almost none of that.  Whether using for adhesive, lubricants, cleaners, or you name it - these are great to have within reach. And when I get down to just a few left - time to order more!

My house is about 12 years old now, and after the second smoke alarm started acting up, I decided it was time to replace all of them proactively.  I have replaced all the detectors/alarms in my house with this model and have not had any problems.  The ring that mounts to the ceiling is a different size than the previous model by BRK that I replaced, so I had to swap the whole thing out - but I wound up being glad because the old ones had yellowed a bit and the new ones look nicer.The problems some folks have are almost all attributed to the batteries. I have been lucky and haven't had those issues, but you basically have three choices: 1) Get a tester and test each battery, replacing those that need it; 2) Replace all the batteries before installing, just to be sure; 3) Install the alarms, cross your fingers, and replace any batteries that chirp.  I used option 3 and as I said, have been lucky.These units are economical and are an easy swap to most builder installed units - using the same wiring harness and connector.  Just about as easy an install as you can get.  Battery problems have more to do with how long they sit in various warehouses - something beyond the control of the manufacturer and the buyer... so just try to be prepared that some may be old and need immediate replacement and you should be fine.

After looking at, and thinking about these 5.11 shirts for a long time, I finally decided to spring for one and try it. I'm glad I did!  The 5.11 Covert shirt is extremely comfortable and breathes very well. It also serves its intended purpose of assisting in concealment perfectly - especially if you get the plaid or print.There are inside pockets on each breast, made of mesh and held shut with Velcro.  Not suitable for concealing a weapon, but good for tucking away other small flat items. I haven't used them yet, but they seem to be practical enough.  The sides are relieved with high slits that are held with Velcro also. These can provide easy access to a hidden sidearm.  Last but not least, are the snaps - yes, snaps not buttons. There are no buttons on this shirt, except at the very top (the one you would likely leave open) - but the snap tops look exactly like buttons, right down to the false threads in the button holes.  The shirt can be pulled open easily and one handed to access your concealed firearm quickly.These shirts are not cheap - which is why I waited so long to try one. But they are of the highest quality and very practical.  The sizes seem to run true - my medium is a good medium by my standards.  I highly recommend these shirts and will be buying more. I hope they will expand the options of colors and patterns over time.

Blade-Tech holster are possibly the best value on the market.  Good quality polymer construction, the holster is custom molded for the specific handgun listed, and it fits perfectly.  In the case of the 1911 5" holster - it fits my Kimber and Sig Sauer 5" pistols perfectly, and also fits the commander length Ruger SR1911 CMD, with a bit of expected empty space at the nose.Blade-Tech Revolution holsters are configured with a straight drop for competition and general range use. It is also configured with a paddle (which I prefer) and includes the belt attachment if you prefer that.Great product and great prices. Highly recommended.

Great hose bib splitter at a good price. Solid brass construction, with the exception of the two valve handles and tightening ring, which are a polymer material.  The brass will last many years and survive the elements - much preferred over other materials.  The polymer parts on the exterior will also have long life.

Good product. I've used Fobus holsters and mag pouches for a long time and I like them. This 1911 magazine carrier is well made, fits the magazines well, and is easy to use. The paddle design is one I prefer, especially for shooting competition use - easy on and off, and you can place it where you want it, instead of where your belt loops will allow.  I recommend the product!The seller I got it from however, was Ehud Warehouse, and left me wondering if what I got was actually new or used.  To their credit they shipped it promptly and it was received fast (from Israel).  But when I opened it, the mag pouch was heavily marred and scratched - even on the back of the paddle (the soft red rubber area was badly scratched up).  This makes me think that perhaps it is a used product.  I'm not saying I would mind that - but don't sell it as new.  Lastly, no one in their right mind is paying $75 for this product, no matter how good it is. So when you see the "wow, what a great deal" price - take that with a grain of salt.  Anything over $35 or $40 delivered would be too much for a NEW one.

"If you read just one book about gun safety..."  As the often used phrase goes, I can't think of a book that it might apply better to. Over the past few years alone, gun sales (and presumably new gun owners) have increased exponentially.  With firearm ownership comes serious responsibility - even if you live alone.  This book does a great job of introducing the new gun owner to the concepts, rules, and reasons of gun safety - in a way that is neither condescending or sugar-coated.The author (one of the most credentialed and qualified to do so) lays out the basics of gun safety and then explains each rule. Rather than just beating the "memorize this list" horse, Massad Ayoob realizes that knowledge and learning come from understanding - and he lets the reader understand where the dangers lie and how to prevent them.All the important topics are covered: Gun safety rules; Safe handling practices; Safe and secure storage; Guns and children; etc.  And yet, at just under 120 pages, the book is not some ordeal to overcome - something you will make a good effort to read and then put down for lack of time.  It can be easily read in a weekend - or a single rainy day, with no problem.  This is important, because all of the wisdom in the universe put into an unread book is meaningless. The author understands this, and has made this the perfect 'digest'.Near the end of the book, almost as a segue into a different topic, are several case studies of accidental and negligent discharges that have occurred, each with a detailed forensic evaluation of what was done wrong, what went wrong, and lessons of prevention.I've been around guns all my life, and I find it important for seasoned "gun folk" to pick up a book such as this from time to time too. Complacency is the arch-enemy of safety in any practice!  This book reminded me of several points that need to be considered and re-considered over the years if we are to keep firearms safely in the home.

I bought the touch pad back for the GoPro HERO3+ as an alternative to the Wi-Fi function.  While the Wi-Fi works great with iPhone and makes controlling the camera a snap, it sucks the battery dry in no time!  This back gives you the ability to pre-frame your shots (particularly when using a mount or tripod) and change your camera settings - with less drain on the battery.  You will still use more battery than without, due to the view screen that is added, but not as bad as broadcasting the signal for the phone connection.The screen is decent size (as big as is possible) and the touch functions work well. Resolution is very good and it is easy to read and navigate the menus.The Touch BacPac greatly enhances the options available to you to use and enjoy your HERO3 camera - highly recommended.

This little tool is handy to keep in the range bag. It will not help you load the moon clips, but makes easy work of unloaded the empty cases.  I keep one in the bag as a spare or "just in case" tool.  Loading the clips can be done by hand without much trouble - but unloading them is very difficult without a proper tool. This fits the bill nicely.

Quirky, but versatile, this ladder system is the one to have if you only want one ladder for your home.  Because it can easily serve as stepladder and extension ladder, it takes the place of two right off the bat. Add to that the versatility of the system that allows one side to be telescoped longer than the other (such as for use on stairs or sloped areas), and you have a great ladder.So, why hold back a star? Well, all that versatility comes at a cost and some compromise. "Do everything well" usually means it doesn't do anything best - and so it is with the Little Giant ladder system.  First off, it is heavy. Really, really heavy. There is a lot of length crammed into a compact package, at the price you pay is an easy to store, easy to transport 'heavy' ladder.  Secondly, unlike traditional step ladders, there is no flat surface at the top, no place to lay your hammer or paint brush - you have to buy add-ons for that. Not a big deal, just one small downside of this design.But - it was great to use this ladder right away to reach a window I've been unable to clean (inside two-story foyer) because the extension ladder I had was too short.  It is great to be able to easily store this ladder and move it around the house without fear of knocking over furniture or banging walls. All that is worth the cost of the added weight.Take a little time to read the good instructions that come with the ladder, and practice with it before first use. I took mine into the yard to practice using it, where I would have ample room if needed. Be careful about ways to pinch or slam your fingers - that is another hazard of the design.Good ladder system - replaces several ladders - versatile design allows creative uses. Recommended

Works perfectly in a standard 2" receiver. The black coating on the handle of the pin and the cotter pin help make this hitch pin disappear when installed.  It is well made and goes on in a snap. I like the pinch-style clip rather than the "through the hole" style clip (or cotter pin) because it is easier to work with and less prone to being rusted into place.

My wife swears by these satin covered padded hangers - and was very upset when she could no longer find them in stores.  Amazon to the rescue - and at a great price too.  These hangers are well made, and will protect his and hers clothes from getting hanger marks - which can be disastrous on some clothing. Highly recommended - even for guys!

This background will get the job done, but it's not the best out there.  In the price range though, it's as good as any I've seen.  The cotton weave wrinkles easily which is a downside, but the color is very even and solid.  The pockets for inserting a hanging bar are very good and are generous in size.  That will work with just about any sized rod, and also makes it easier to move the fabric along the rod.Mine came with a small tear hole in the pocket area, that does not affect its use, but still takes away from overall quality.  Fours stars instead of five due to high wrinkle tendency, and some quality issues.  Still recommended.

I purchased this paint as an experiment to try and make certain props "invisible" when filmed with a green screen and chromakey technology in post production for videos.  It works very good for that purpose and matches most chroma-green backgrounds.  The paint is a little on the thin side and make require more than one coat depending on your application and the material being painted.I've used in on vinyl covered items also with good adhesion. Recommended!

If you shoot often and go through targets, this bulk package of 100 Redfield targets is a good value.  The targets are very well printed, and high quality.  The paper is very thin though, and therefore a bit flimsy.  That is one reason they are kept affordable and it is not a big complaint. But if you are an infrequent shooter and maybe just sight in your rifles once or twice per year - you might prefer a smaller quantity of thicker paper targets.

I bought this hat just because I wanted a "Elmer Fudd" style hat - almost as a gag or prop.  I was surprised when it came that the quality was so good. I'm not saying it's fantastic quality, but this is a good useable, wearable, and warm hat.  I've worn it while shoveling snow, and having snowball fights with me dog (well, okay he doesn't throw them back) and it kept my ears and neck cozy warm and dry!  It's a keeper!

Love the paddle design, so I can slip the carrier on and off for a shooting match.  The carrier fits the magazines perfectly, and is adjustable for tension so that you can get just the feel you like.  The polymer construction is durable and will not damage your magazines.The carrier is also adjustable for cant (angle) using gear-like discs with opposing teeth.Added Bonus: This mag pouch also perfectly fits Walther PPQ magazines. Carriers for those mags can be harder to find - this one works fine.Can't beat it for the price and quality!

These kickstands by Gun Storage Solutions are good for storing the pistol on a shelf in your safe, or for displaying them in a retail case.  It holds the gun at an attractive angle that allows it to be viewed entirely without being touched (good when in a locked glass case, etc.)  Also great to use when photographing the pistols, etc.The vinyl covered wire holders are typical of the Gun Storage Solutions products (of which I am a fan) and will accept any caliber from .22 on up.  The coating will protect the barrel and muzzle from any abrasion.Highly recommended!

This little desktop mic stand is a bit on the flimsy side, but once you have the legs situated it works just fine. I wouldn't use it for an application where it will be handled and moved a lot, because it is not 'rigid' - each time you move it the legs will flop around a bit. So, best suited for set it and forget it locations. That said, it works just great, is light and small and easy to stow and carry. I recommend it!

I had a Bissell Little Green cleaner for many years, and it was a great tool to have when a spill or the dog gave me a spot on the carpet that needed cleaning.  After several years though, it finally stopped pumping water - almost certainly due to buildup of calcium or similar from our water. So I decided to replace it with a new one, and came across this "heated" version.  The price was not too much more than the non-heated so I thought I'd go for it.What a piece of junk.The water barely trickles out of the nozzle.  The old one sprayed water (similar to a steam iron) just near the cleaning nozzle and worked great. This one barely trickles - straight down - and is useless.And the water is ice cold. The heater is a joke. After 10 minutes of use, if you have very sensitive hands and feel around enough places, you can barely feel some warmth below the water tank... but it NEVER comes out even slightly warm - let alone hot.This will almost certainly be the last Bissell product I ever buy.

I bought this pistol bayonet - as I'm sure most do - as a sort of gag gift to myself. After all, there are not very many circumstances in which I can imagine a mounted blade on the front of a handgun being either useful or safe.  But that said - this is a product that takes itself seriously, and so it deserves that respect.  With a blade made by Ka Bar, a renowned knife blade maker, and a easy on / easy off mount, it truly is a mountable blade option.I found the fit to be very snug for Glock, Smith and Wesson, and Walther rails - and so snug that I gave up trying to mount in on a Sig Sauer (P226).  Perhaps wear and use might ease that some, or one could try to sand it down.It's a good quality blade - nice and sharp, with a useful saw edge too.  I see no reason not to keep this knife in my range bag!  At the price, it's a highly recommended item!

I have had some hard snap on cases that I didn't like very much but this one is different because it has 2nd part that makes it fit better that also shields the front ends of the phone with a soft edge. I really really like it. Not to mention you get a screen protector and a stylus to go with it. Great package deal! Buttons are easy to push and ports are easily accessible. All in all a great case combination and lots of fun to carry! Love it! I was able to try it at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and opinion and was in no way compensated.

Very good, solid case with kickstand for iPhone 6. I like this case a lot. Slides in and out of my pocket with ease. Not too thick and feels great in my hand. Protective of all corners and ports are all easily accessible. Buttons are all easy to push and I bought this in blue and love the color. I was able to try this case at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and opinion. I was in no way compensated.

Really loving this case. Very very protective and the belt clip is awesome for being on the go. Just as protective as some of the more expensive cases and not so hard on the wallet. Not terribly hard to get on and off and rubbery feeling so it stays in my hand well. I was able to try this case at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and opinion. I was in no way compensated.

Tempered glass is by far the best way to protect any electronic device you have With a screen. The old plastic screen protectors are a thing of the past. They scratch, they are cloudy, they bubble up and sweat and curl At the corners and are not able to be moved from one device to another. All of these things are not true with tempered glass. Also tempered glass is the ultimate protection for your iPad. I was able to try this at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased and opinion and review. I was in no way compensated.

These tweezers are CRAZY SHARP!!! I love them! I use them from everything from taking out slivers in my little guys...which is more like doing surgery...if you have kids you understand. To doing projects on guitar wiring with my husband. These are incredibly handy and work AWESOME!! You need these and they are perfect! I use them constantly and I have them handy right where I know where they are at all times. I have them at my desk in a special drawer where no one else knows where they are hidden because my husband has tried to nab them a time or two. I was able to try these at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbaised review and opinion and was in no way compensated.

Love this water bottle! Love the silicone covering for protection and keeps the bottle from sweating a lot and it also keeps it colder a little longer I think. I also love that its glass. No plastic. I use essential oils and I love to put lemon and orange and lime oil periodically in my water but it eats through plastic bottles and breaks them down so this is the only way to go! Love it and it is the perfect size! Love the carrying loop and I take it everywhere with me! Not too terrible to clean but would have been nice if it had just a slightly larger neck. I love it anyway. I was able to try this bottle at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and opinion and was in no way compensated.

Tempered glass screen protectors are by far the best way your can protect the invenstment you have made in your new phone. They are simple and easy  to put on and they don't bubble up and are sometimes reusable. They also crack before your phone's screen will upon impact. I dropped my phone on the tile floor and I thought my screen was done for...it was not. Only the protector spider webbed across and underneath was still pristine as ever!! you will 100% thank yourself for going with tempered glass protectors instead of the plastic of the past! I was able to try these at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbaised review and opinion. I was in no way compensated.

Really enjoying these headphones. They are not expensive and so far, they have done everything I have needed them to do. I mostly use them for exercising and for walking on the treadmill. I also use them periodically for when I want to listen to music in the house after the kids go to bed and my husband is still up doing homework and I don't want to disturb him. I haven't quite figured out all the remote buttons its says these are supposed to do, I just use them the way I need them and they work well for me. I was allowed to try these at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and opinion. I was in no way compensated.

I got the opportunity to purchase this product at a reduced rate in exchange for my honest opinion. I am always trying to hide or get rid of my stretch marks. I have wasted a lot of money on all these name brand scar removers that you use a hundred times a day and they don't even fade the scar or stretch marks at all. But I am so glad I found this because after just using for a few days, my stretch marks and C-section scar which are older began to fade and lighten up. Also I didn't have to apply this cream nearly as frequently as all the other ones I have tried that didn't work. I would highly recommend this product to new moms that have unwanted stretch marks or even moms that have older stretch marks that have been around for some time.

Very handy device for all of your charging needs. I always keep this in my travel bag for when I go on trips so that I am never without a charging stations for my devices. Great thing to have when you are away from home. I was able to try this at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and opinion and was in no way compensated.

Love this protective case! I got the pink and grey. Love the 3 piece design and that they leave spots along the sides so that if you choose to take the cases off, you don't have to break every nail trying to remove the case! I have been really happy with this case and its protection level! I love it! I have a 5yr old and a 6yr old. both boys and if you have boys you know how destructive they can be and they always want to play your games and well...I really love my phone. So this case has been a livesaver! I was able to try this case at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbaised review and opinion. I was in no way compensated.

Swiss Army of phone cases. My husband absolutely loves this case! He is the hiking, backpacing, pocket knife carrying guy. I love carrying a pocket knife too, but this totally cracked me up so I had to get it for him! He loves it and shows it off to his friends and classmates (he is a mechanical engineering student) any chance he gets. Its more of a conversation piece than anything but it does protect his phone as well and he loves playing with all the things in it and he uses them from time to time as well. We were able to try it at a discounted price in exchange for our honest and unbiased review and opinon. We were in no way compensated.

Beautiful case for Galaxy S6. Vibrant colors and I love feeling happy when I use it. On those grey days I love to use this case because it makes me feel like its just a little brighter out. I like that all the buttons are easy to push and that all the ports are easy to get to. I have no problem plugging my headphones in and I have no issues with the charge port. I love this case and use it a lot. I was able to try this case at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review  and opinion. I was in no way compensated.

Love this case. Looks so professional. Love that it doesn't look like a kid has this phone case. Sometimes you just can't tell!! this is a very elegant case. Kind of James Bond!! All of the ports are free and the buttons are easy to push with this case on. I get lots on compliments with this case and people often ask where I got it. I was able to try this case at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and opinion. I was in no way compensated.

Beautiful navy and gold case for galaxy s6 phone! Protective and classy! Slides on easily and protects all sides and corners and screen edges. Love this case and get lots of compliments on it! Love that it looks so elegant! I love that the camera is free. The ports are all available and buttons are easy to push. I was able to try this case at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and opinion. I was in no way compensated.

Very nice quality, clear case for Galaxy s6. Love how simple and thin this case is and easy to get on and off. Slides simply and easily in and out of my pocket and does not get caught up on my pockets. I also love that all ports area easily available and buttons are easy to push. Love that all corners are protected and still see the beauty of my phone. Simple and protected. I was able to try this case at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and opinion.I was in no way compensated.

I am not super fold of plastic screen protectors and I misread the description and I thought these were the glass ones, but thats ok. I will use these in between when I have glass and don't. These are not bad quality as far as plastic screen protectors are concerned. But once you go glass you realize how hard these are to install. All plastic protector have bubbles and they are hard to get out. Glass never bubbles and so easy to install. I was able to try these at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and opinion. I was in no way compensated.

Terrible hard plastic. Will shatter if you drop it. Not a good quality. Very cheaply made. Spend a little more for better protection. I was very disappointed. I was able to try these at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. I was in no way compensated.

I got these as a back up . I have these for in between when I do not have tempered glass on my phone. I prefer having tempered glass and these are only on my phone when I am in between tempered glass protectors. As far as plastic protectors go, these are a pretty good quality. Not too hard to install and don't have too many bubbles. They all have bubbles though and once you have tempered glass with no bubbles you realize how spoiled you are. I was able to try these in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and opinon. I was in no way compensated.

I am super excited about the quality fo this case. Its super hard and cracked trying to get on my brother's phone. Its so hard and brittle there is no give to it. I wished it had more give to it. If he had dropped it..it would have shattered the case it is such a hard plastic. I was able to try this case at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and opinion. I was in no way compensated.

I'm not sure what a  twirlin' swirlberry is but apparently they smell great. My kids love the smell of this detangling spray and I do too.As a detangler, it works just fine. Snarls brush out easily. Hopefully that means less damage. This doesn't seem to leave the hair coated or greasy (which can cause bigger snarls throughout the day). I have even used this the next day with no buildup. The hair still looks clean and fresh.

This conditioner smells great. I am not sure that I can describe it but I really like it and have gotten compliments on the smell of my hair.The conditioner rinses cleanly- so cleanly that I was a little concerned that it was not going to have any positive effect. But it did reduce tangles and my hair didn't feel overly dry. It was great for my curls.  After trying the conditioner that way several times I also tried using it as a leave in. I just shampoo my hair, dry it and then work a small amount of this through. It works fabulously. It is not greasy but keeps my hair conditioned and soft all day.Plus it smells even more fabulous.

I was a little nervous about how hard this would be to install. We needed one for the studio but I have put it off. Luckily, this was really easy to put in. I was able to install it without having to be too invasive with the wall. I was worried about damaging the dry wall.Since we prefer to use nice toilet paper, that is what is in the studio. But since it isn't cheap waxed paper tp, sometimes with the regular wall holder tp would go missing. This allows us to use and offer nice tp without having it walk off. Everyone is familiar with it and it is simple to use.

I think this stuff stinks. Literally. I feed it and then get out of the kitchen. It just smells awful to me. But I really like the ingredients and the nutritional profile.My fat dog loves this stuff. He gets happy when he sees the can. He eats it with enthusiasm. Even though he sometimes has a fussy gut, he has had no problems with tummy upset or gas. He also seems to bug less for food during the day. We are impressed.

This is a handsome, comfortable shirt. The color is a little bluer and less grey than I thought it appeared. It looks great. These days, I never am happy about a  piece of clothing until it has been washed. So many articles of clothing shrink or flat out fall apart. But I washed and dried this and it looks fabulous. I pulled it out when it was still just a tiny bit damp and hung it up. It still looks brand new. There was minimal shrinkage.

This is a really cute little carrier. It's perfect for letting little ones imitate their baby wearing parents and caregivers. It was easy to set the carrier up. It fit a wide range of dolls and stuffed animals.There are a couple of problems. First, it dips too low in the front. Most dolls and stuffed animals are top heavy so they tip the carrier forward. Our little girl was quite worried that her doll was falling. The straps also kept slipping until I put a few stitches in them.

Glucosamine, Condroitin and MSM have made a big difference in my level of joint pain. Viva Labs Triple Strength Glucosamine, Condroitin, MSM Combination is great. It saves me from taking a separate MSM pill. The dose is good in only two tablets. They aren't tiny. But the are not hard to take. I experienced no stomach upset. I also didn't experience joint pain.

These are great tags for long term identification or shipping.  I was especially happy to find the the permanent ink I used on the tags didn't smear. I pulled hard on the tags and the reinforced hole held fast. These were perfect for tagging some things that I need to stay tagged.The wire is much stiffer than suggested in the picture. But it is still easy to work with. I had to clip some shorter but it wasn't a problem. I could not get the wires to fail with repeated bending. They held up great.

I use a color coding system to manage our home, family, and business calendar. It makes things easy to see at a glance and it makes my huge wall calendar and planner look cute and fun.I thought these would be perfect.There are some great things about these pens. The shape was very helpful. It reduces fatigue. The colors are all very soft. If you try to get them any darker you either break the lead or leave a waxy residue that can't be written on. So they are fun for adding a little soft color and accent but they aren't exactly filling my purpose for them.

These are great tags for long term identification or shipping.  I was especially happy to find the the permanent ink I used on the tags didn't smear. I pulled hard on the tags and the reinforced hole held fast. These were perfect for tagging some things that I need to stay tagged.The wire is much stiffer than suggested in the picture. But it is still easy to work with. I had to clip some shorter but it wasn't a problem. I could not get the wires to fail with repeated bending. They held up great.

This shower curtain is beautiful. The fabric was surprisingly lovely and the colors are gorgeous. It looks like a vintage piece of art. The colors and artistic off centering make it a special piece to design around.However, due to the light in my bathroom, the soft lovely colors did not show up well when hung in front of a clear liner. I replaced it with a heavy white liner and the colors showed up much better. I have had occasion to wash it once and it came out beautifully. I really love this piece it is just so pretty.

I have had a couple misses with Avery products lately. So I was a little nervous about trying these.I used these to label some midsized pieces of an antique collection. These were just the right size for listed details and provenance. I was especially to find the the permanent ink I used on the tags didn't smear. I pulled hard on the tags and the reinforced hole held fast. These were perfect for tagging some things that I need to stay tagged.

I was happy with these tags when I unwrapped them.The cardstock looked nice and the tag shape is cute and classy looking. As always, I find using Avery tools to design to be a pain. I am not sure why I struggle with their design suite so much but I really wish it were more intuitive. I did manage to put together a cute design and  print it. But the cardstock was apparently too slick so they smeared a little coming out of the printer. They were mostly right on but the right side was off just a tiny bit.

These labels are ok. For the cost, I was expecting them to be a little nicer. These are as thin as contact paper. They are peel and stick. but I did have one label that curls on the corner. The labels work with a chalk marker. They don't work well with actual chalk. They have to be cleaned with water. This is problematic due to the one canister label that is curling up on the edge.I feel like there are a lot better options.

I was hoping this would keep the neighbors old barn cat from savaging my irises. I have no idea why he bears such malice towards the only flowers I can successfully grow but he likes to swing by smash them.I applied this around the perimeter of the garden and then more thoroughly around the irses. For a few days I thought it was very effective. Then he showed up and slept in my irises again. He has kept them on a regular rotation ever since.

There are some really great things about this setup.For a neophyte like me, it was easy to get the speakers set up to get the most powerful sound performance. It was actually pretty impressive. The room I installed it in is a closed room rather than a big open plan space- I am not sure if that makes a difference.  It wasn't as thunderous for deep sounds as some systems I have heard but it is very clear and gives a nice depth.The bluray player is nice. It works nicely. I have not noticed any defect or complaints other than it seems a little loud when you are watching at a low volume.My frustration is that the player has all these fabulous capabilities but it needs to be wires to access those features. I don't want to run wires down the hall and into a room to access features that I could get wirelessly with another unit.

The waists on kids clothes seem to just keep getting bigger and bigger. My daughter is pretty skinny and it is hard to find things that fit. This skirt is very cute. The belt is really adorable. The skirt fabric is a nice weight and looks good.But the waist was big enough that when cinched up to fit, it is really bulk in the waist. I generally like the adjustable button waistbands. But this just  left too much fabric Bunched up.It is a very cute skirt. It washed nicely without much shrinkage. It will be great for the right sized kid.

I had an early Slendertone unit. It worked well but it didn't last very long. I was interested in seeing how the product evolved.I have tried both the Abs3 and the Abs6 Slendertone Abdominal Muscle toner units.Both expanded far enough to fit me (I wondered). They are both easy to set up. It took some adjustment to get it working most effectively. But I was able to adjust both until I got a good enough workout to cause some muscle fatigue. I didn't feel and difference in the power. I had expected that the Abs3 unit would be less powerful due to it's use of batteries but both were great. It is a very odd sensation but you can put your hands on your stomach and feel the muscles tighten.Definitely order some more pads and gel. You need them rather quickly. If I was considering this purchase, I would suggest the Abs6. The Abs3 is great. But if you use it as directed you are are going to use a ton of batteries. It takes a lot of juice to move those muscles.
