It actually looks like something out of a sci-fi movie or a spy movie.  Unfortunately, it's not really quiet enough to actually spy on anything...but that's not that big of a deal to me.It's tank tread style treads allow it to get along well on any kind of flooring you'll have in your house, save for maybe REALLY long pile carpet.  It also does well outdoors on concrete or other hard surfaces.Overall, I really enjoy the Rover 2.0.  It's a fun gadget to pay around with in the house, and it's fun to use outdoors too.

Knifehead is awesome.  Plain and simple.This figure is GIANT.  I can't really describe how big he is.  Dimensions don't do him justice, he's just massive.  On the desk I have him fighting Gipsy and Cherno on, he takes up roughly half of it...and it's not a small desk, it's a typical home office sized desk.His lights are perfect for the figure...they work well and light up in a really eerie way that looks fantastic.  The articulation points are great.  You can even move his individual claws...awesome.The detailing and paint on his body are superb as well.  He just LOOKS like some kind of monster that dragged himself out of the sea.The only downside to this figure is that he needs a stand in order to stay upright.  Without it, he just topples over.I really can't say how much I love this thing.  Once I get my media room finished, and I have my shelf dedicated to "Pacific Rim" stuff, Knifehead is going to tower over everything else on that shelf...heck, he'll tower over almost every other prop and figure I'll have on display!!!

I've never had a Kyosho RC.  I've had tons of other stuff, but this is my first Kyosho.I can tell you this much...it will not be my last.The Mad Bug VE is well made, looks great, and has a great amount of power for just kind of bashing around the yard.  It's not the fastest thing in the world, but it's definitely not the slowest, either.  It has just the right amount of oomph to be a great offroad basher.The body looks amazing.  The graphics and the overall look are top notch.  I was pleasantly surprised by how well the controller felt in my hand.  The electronics all seem to be very good.For the price, this is a really good value in the RC world.  There's a bit of slop in the front end, but nothing that ever made me think it needed to be addressed...in fact, it almost seems as if it's deliberate to help keep the truck more durable.This is a great RC, and if you're on the fence, I think you'll like it.  4x4, brushless, 2.4ghz??  All in a great looking package??  It's a winner.

I was an early adopter of Orbotix "robots."  I had a Sphero almost immediately after they came out, and a Sphero 2.0 the day they came out.  My wife has a regular Sphero as well.I've had an Ollie since about a week after it came out, and I'm just now getting around to reviewing it.I've used the Ollie extensively.  Fun is an understatement.  This thing FLIES.  It's fast, precise, and works very well.  I like how it almost magically turns on just by me holding my phone up to it.Many of the options you find in Sphero you find here...such as the ability to change the color of the lights and things like that.  You can adjust the speeds for indoor use or for outdoor use.Outdoor use is one of the big advantages to Ollie to me.  I've used the Sphero outside, and it just doesn't seem to be as fun as it is indoors.  It's simply a bit too slow.  Ollie, on the other hand, has plenty of wheels to get himself going on pavement and cement.  He's a blast to drive around outside.The only negative to Ollie??  I kind of wish I had gotten the Darkside version...the black looks killer...but, there's nothing wrong with being the good guy, I guess!!!This is a fun toy...I highly recommend it!!!

I was looking for a keyboard to use with my iPad Mini, in order to get a bit closer to having it work as a "tiny laptop."This BT keyboard works great.  It's small and lightweight, easy to pair, and works fantastically.  It takes a bit to get used to typing on it, but not any more time than any other smaller keyboard.Overall, I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a good BT keyboard for their iPad.

Robinson Pinions are some of the best in the business.I got this set because I needed some pinions for a Vaterra Twin Hammers I was building.As usual, they were top notch all the way around.  You really can't miss with these.

I got my Echo right before they became available to the general public.  I'd been waiting for an invite for a while, and when I finally got it I was really excited.  That wore off a bit when I found out, two days later, that anyone would be able to get one on about the same day that mine would be arriving, but hey, at least I got it at the lower price with the remote.My wife didn't understand why I needed something like this.  Yes, I said needed.  I didn't tell her I wanted an Echo, I told her I needed one.I needed an AI companion to give me answers to things that I find clunky and annoying to look at otherwise.  Why get out my phone to look at the weather forecast for the next day when I can just politely ask Alexa what it is?  Why get on the computer to check the score of the Detroit Tigers game (hint, they're losing) when I can just ask Alexa.Within a few days, even my wife was sold...I think.  I find her interacting with the device about as often as I do, even if it's just for things like jokes and the Easter Egg type functions.Personally, I have found many of the basic functions of Alexa to be really useful.  I love being able to tell her to just play a radio station and having my favorite type of music instantly delivered to my ears.  I've found her to be really helpful when cooking...I'm the type of person that tends to forget to set timers or look at clocks when cooking, but with Alexa I can just ask for a timer...this is really helpful when cooking things on the grill that require constant flipping/turning...two minutes per side on a hotdog??  Just have Alexa set a two minute timer...repeat on the next side.  I've also found her to be very helpful with adding things to my shopping list.  I used to get to stores and always make it home and realize I forgot something because I forgot to write it down on my list in the first place.  Now I just tell Alexa to add it to my list, and then I don't have to worry about it.As a speaker, I think the Echo does a really good job.  I was surprised at the volume that was attainable through such a small device, and across the spectrum the sound is really clear.  Sure, there's some distortion at the highest volumes, but I don't know an awful lot of speakers that don't have some distortion when you crank it to 11.I'm giving the Echo a five, but obviously there are things I would like to see integrated in the future.For starters, it would be nice if the shopping lists and such were more tied directly to my phone.  I use an iPhone, so I wish there was some way that Alexa could have my shopping list be in the "Notes" app, instead of in the Echo app.  I know that's wishful thinking, but hey, it's what I'd like to see.Second, I'd like to be able to have the ability to control my Xbox ONE, or my cable box.  Being able to just ask "Alexa, are there any good movies on right now?" and having her show me a list of movies on my TV screen would be amazing.Finally, I really want to be able to change her name.  Although Alexa is fine, I'd prefer to be able to name the speaker something of my own choosing.  What do I want to name the speaker???  Jarvis, of course.  This, however, would probably mean I'd like it to have a male sounding voice as well.Overall, I think the Echo is great.  I can't wait to start getting some home automation stuff to work with the speaker.  I want to be able to tell her to turn the lights on in the bedroom when I'm getting ready for bed...no more using my phone as a flashlight to see if there are any cats laying in the hallway!!!

I've been using this headlamp when working on my RC models in my hobby room.  RC vehicles have lots of little nooks and crannies that light sometimes seems to not want to find it's way into.This light has been perfect for that.  It has four modes, bright white, dim white, red, and flashing (which has both red and white lights on).The two white modes work great for working on my RC vehicles.  I typically can just leave it on dim and get all the light I need, but I can turn the higher brightness on if I need some more lumens.For working outside in the dark, I believe the light would work well if you already knew your way around or there was a good bit of ambient light from other sources (the moon, street lights, etc.).  It would work to help you look at a map, or to help you read some instructions, but it's not putting out as much light as some of the bigger lights...but that's not to be expected based on size and price.For instance, I have other headlamps that I don't hesitate to use when riding my bike in the rural area I live in at night.  I don't think this light puts out enough light for me to feel comfortable doing that...however, it does put out enough light for me to feel comfortable using it on a lighted street or bike path.The other thing that I really like about this light is how lightweight it is.  My other headlamps are all brighter, but that comes at the price of being heavy and having a battery pack mounted on the side or back of the headband.  They can sometimes be a bit of a pain to wear, but this one goes on and feels like it's not even there.  Good stuff.Overall, for use indoors to help you see something in a dark area, or in a campground that has some ambient light you're going to find this light to be really solid.  As mentioned, I wouldn't use it for going hiking in the middle of the night when there's no moon, but I don't think that lights in this price range are meant for that in the first place.Recommended.

If you're a fan of "Pacific Rim," then you need to get this graphic novel.It takes place before the events of the film, and goes a bit more in depth with some of the characters that you see in the movie.  It introduces us to some Jaegers that we don't see in the film, and some Kaiju that we don't see in the film.The illustrations are great, the story is solid, and the writing is good.  I found myself really enjoying the story, and the drawings really kept me engaged with the whole thing.I'm a big "Pacific Rim" fan, and I feel that this graphic novel really fleshes the universe out quite a bit.Overall, I really liked the book, and I think you will too.  Recommended.
I'm using these with some Chicago screws in a utility belt build that I'm working on.  They work great.If you need this size washer, then you won't be disappointed with this purchase.
I'm using these Chicago screws to build a utility belt for a costume.  They arrived quickly, are well made, and have worked perfectly.They'll suit you well, as long as the 1/2" size is what you need.

I've been collecting props and prop replicas from the Marvel Cinematic Universe to display in my basement with my DVD and figure collection.This license plate is an AWESOME addition to the collection.  It's a spot on replica of the plate on the Audi RS8 at the end of "Age of Ultron."I'll be just hanging this on my wall, but it's built to be able to be put on the front of your car...it's really just a real license plate, with mounting holes and everything.Overall, I really like this Stark plate.  It's great.

This is a great Pop! figure.  It's detail is really good, and the "action" pose that it's in makes it a bit unique among some of the other Pop! figures in my collection.If you like Pop! figures, or Iron Man, then you should add this to your collection.

This camping "lantern" by BYBlight is really great.It uses three AA batteries, and easily lights up more than enough area around you for you to get around in the dark.  I've been using it to take my dogs out at night, and I'm pretty impressed by the amount of light it throws.  It's actually so bright that I can't look directly at it...it hurts my eyes.The lantern is very lightweight, has a unique "pop up to turn it on" mechanism, and the handles on top definitely come in handy.If you don't open the light all the way, it will still shine but since much of the area of the LEDs is blocked, it won't end up being quite as bright, which is nice for some uses.  When I'm not taking my dogs out with it, I'm keeping it on my nightstand in my bedroom.  If I need to get up in the middle of the night for anything, it's easy to just slide the light up a little bit and get enough light to easily see in the bedroom, without throwing so much light that it wakes my wife up.I am currently just using standard AA batteries in it.  I have some rechargeable batteries, but I haven't felt a need to put them in the light yet.I would highly recommend this camping lantern to anyone looking for a good, low cost, bright lamp.

I bought these gloves for working out with my heavy bag and my speed bag in my basement.  I will come right out and say that I bought them because I liked the way that they looked.However, when I got them, they actually are pretty nice gloves for working out with your bags.  They fit me well, are nicely padded, and end up staying comfortable throughout my entire workout.I really like them...they're much better than the gloves I had been using (which came with my heavy bag) and I am having a better experience working out with them.Highly recommended.

I have an older dog who is getting close to "that time."I wanted to remember some of our adventures during his golden years so that I can go back and watch things that he and I liked to do.I decided to get this harness to use with my GoPro, and it works flawlessly.  The harness fits him well (he's about a 55 pound dog), doesn't seem to irritate him, pinch him, or cause him and discomfort.  It stays in place and holds the GoPro really solidly.The few videos I've made with it have come out exactly as I had hoped.  I haven't had a chance to get out and really record any of our adventures due to adverse weather in the time I've owned it, however, I've tested it several times just around the house and the yard and have come away impressed each time.Highly recommended.

I needed a heat gun for some hobby type use.  I ordered this one and haven't been let down.  It works great, and both settings work for different types of things.It's easy to use, works well, and comes in at a great price point.Recommended.
I got this mannequin head to work on making helmets for costumes.It works great for that purpose.It also looks kind of creepy just sitting around, and to me that's a huge plus!!!!

I ordered this costume to work on putting together a more detailed Captain America costume to wear for Halloween and to conventions.As other reviewers have stated, the quality of the "extras" in the package is basically just okay...the boot covers, mask, belt, and gauntlets are all fairly cheaply made and really don't work for the level of detail that I wanted to achieve when I was making my costume.  I figured that would be the case when I ordered it, though, and had planned all along on building or making the parts that I wanted to replace.The body suit itself, though, is really nice.  It's well put together, looks great, and seems to have pretty good quality materials.  It fit me well, although I am trying to lose some weight so that it fits me even better.  The zipper on it functions perfectly, and nothing is ripped or broken.  My mother is a fairly good seamstress, and I took it to her to have her check it out and she found nothing that needed to be reworked or changed right off the bat.Overall, I'm really happy with the purchase.  The other parts that I've been working on are coming out really well, too.  I feel that when I'm done the whole thing will look amazing!!!

These syringe applicators work great for applying CA glue in very tight spaces.  I've used several of them with no issues.  I have been just throwing them away when I'm done with them, as the few I tried to clean out tended to not work as well the next time I tried to use them...however, when working with hobbies, there are things that are always considered "consumable."  I feel that these fall into that category.Recommended.
This engagement cable worked perfectly on a Craftsmen 42" deck mower.It was cheaper than the parts at the store, and I haven't had any issues with it at all.Recommended.

I had one of these hanging from my ceiling lamp in my bedroom when I was young.I was browsing Amazon the other day and stumbled upon this, and knew I had to have it.  The price was spectacular, and the product itself is just as I remember it.It was fun to build, looks great, and stays together really well.  I'll definitely be looking for more of them to add to my hobby room.Recommended!!!

I am working on a Captain America costume, if that wasn't obvious...:)Anyways, I ended up buying a full suit because I wasn't sure that I'd be able to tackle putting one together completely from scratch.  It came with a mask, a utility belt, gauntlets, and boot covers...however, none of them were very nice.  The mask looked okay, but it was much too big.I ended up ordering this mask to go with the costume, and I am extremely impressed.  This one fits amazingly well, looks great, is easy to put on, and was a really good price.This mask fits me well, and I wear about a size 7 3/4 hat in a typical 5950 New Era baseball cap.  So, it's possible that it may be a bit large on you if you wear a significantly smaller hat size than that.Overall, I like this mask quite a bit.It fits me very well, and for reference I wear a size 7 3/4 hat in a New Era ball cap style.If you're looking for a Cap mask, give this one a shot!!!

This is a really nice shield for your Captain America costume.  It's plastic, so obviously it's not going to be as spectacular as some of the spun metal ones you'll see out there, but at this price point I don't think you should be expecting that type of awesomeness.What you get here is a good sized shield that looks good enough to go with your costume, doesn't weigh a lot, is nice and sturdy, and with a bit of work can be made a bit better.I think with a lot of costumes and accessories that adding and modifying are part of the fun.  On this shield, I have added an actual handle piece to the back instead of just the two elastic straps.  This gives me something to hold onto with one hand while the strap is around my forearm.I like this shield, and think that it looks really good, especially considering the low price point that it comes in at.Recommended!!!

This chest harness works really well with my GoPro.  It fits well, seems to be made really well, and gives another option for mounting the GoPro to your body for a different vantage point.The price is really good, as well.If you're looking for a good, inexpensive, chest mount for your camera, give this one a go, you'll probably be happy with it.

This servo works well for my application.  It's in a truck that is basically used for trail running, so it doesn't have to be super fast or super torquey.  It works well for this purpose, and hasn't caused me any issues at all.I'd recommend it for a good basic servo for an inexpensive price.

Great hat.I like it because at first glance, it looks almost like it could be a sports team logo, so you can basically be a geek in stealth mode!!!The hat is put together well, fits as expected, and looks great.  The design under the bill is really cool, and really adds to the overall design of the product.I really like this hat, if you're a fan of Captain America, you'll love it too.

I have a speaker system in my hobby room in my basement that requires my iPhone to be plugged into it for it to work.  It's a basic PC speaker system with two satellite speakers and one subwoofer.I had really wanted to upgrade to a Bluetooth speaker of some type for down there so that I can have the iPhone closer to me than the speaker system allows it to be.  I ended up giving this Bluetooth receiver a try, and I'm really glad that I did.The unit charges via USB and doesn't take long at all to charge.  It was easy to pair to my iPhone, with no problems at all.  Once I had it paired, I plugged the wire from the speaker system into the receiver, and as simple as that, it was done.  I launched the music player on the phone and I immediately had good quality music coming through the speakers!!!Every function on the phone works perfectly, and I can now have my speakers on one side of the room and my phone with me on the other so that I can control it and still listen to the music.  Awesome.The receiver has buttons on it that can be used to control the music, if that was something that you were interested in.  It doesn't really do much for me, as I'm using the phone to control all of the music...the receiver is just there to send the music to the speaker system.Overall, I really like this receiver.  It works really well, and does exactly what I had hoped it would do.  Now I can keep my 2+1 speaker system and use it wirelessly, instead of having to buy an entire new speaker.Highly recommended!!

This is a really cool coffe/drink mug.  It's well built, looks very good, and functions well.I really like the aesthetics of the mug.  As a gift for a photographer, it would be top notch!!  It really does look like it's made from a camera lens.  It's got all of the markings of a typical SLR style lens, the bottom looks like a lens cover, and the top even resembles a lens hood in a way.The inside of it is metal and keeps drinks cool or warm as well as any other insulated mug that I have, and it also keeps drinks cool very well.  It's easy to clean the inside, which is nice.The top has a nice closing feature so even if you're on a bumpy ride you don't have to worry about any of your beverage spilling out of the cup.  It's easy to get open, though, which is good.Overall, I really like the mug and would recommend it to anyone interested in a unique drinking cup.  Where I work there are a lot of drink cups that get put into the cabinet on the floor...with this one, I don't have to worry about anyone mistaking my drink for their own!!!

I grabbed a copy of Formula D having no idea what to really expect.I won't go into a great amount of detail about how the game is played, as that's been done numerous times in numerous reviews here and elsewhere.What I will say is that I chose it for Game Night with my wife one night, and she was reluctant to try it.  She didn't want to play a "racing game" at all.  I told her we can give it a shot for one game, and if she doesn't like it we can switch to something different.Several hours and several games later, we finally put the game away.  We loved it.  From start to finish it's just a FUN game.  There's enough strategy involved to give it some depth, but also enough chance that even with the best strategy something might go wrong...which to me is very realistic when compared to "real" racing...you can have the best car, the best driver, and the best crew...but none of that matters when an engine blows.We really enjoyed our time with the game, and look forward to many more sessions...also, we look forward to moving to the advanced rule set.I highly recommend the game.  It's great.

I recently got a bass guitar.  It was a cheap beginner package, and the included amp cable caused a lot of feedback.  I grabbed this Fender cable and MOST of the feedback was eliminated.  I then replaced the amplifier, and with the included cable with the package I was still getting a lot of feedback.  However, with the replacement amplifier and the Fender cable, the feedback was completely gone.I would say that the cable is a very good quality piece, especially compared with the stuff that comes with "all inclusive" beginner sets.It also looks cool, which may or may not be important to you!!Highly recommended.

I'd say the wire is closer to 10 gauge than 8 gauge, but for a small, non power hungry amp, it's going to do the job really well.It comes with EVERYTHING you need in one low priced package to get an amp up and running, so that's great.  No need to buy a separate set of interconnects or anything like that, just grab this one box and get to installing.It powers a small subwoofer amp just fine, and that's all I really need it to do.Good product for the price.

I love this amplifier.I bought it knowing darn well that it wasn't going to put out 1100 watts as it's "advertised" as doing.  However, I didn't need 1100 watts of power.  I had two Rockford Fosgate 10s laying around the garage and hadn't had any bass in my car for a while.  I finally decided that I'd grab something to just mildly power them so that I could fill out my sound a bit.I installed the setup and was impressed.  From my "old" glory days in car stereo, I'm going to GUESS that the amp is putting out around 150 watts of power (into 2 ohms).  It moves my two low end RF 10s just fine, and provides enough oomph for me to feel it in the car.The external "gain" works really well.  I have the amp set up in "low pass" mode, which I have read is necessary for the external control to work, and I haven't had any issues with it not working.  My wife doesn't like much bass when she's driving, so she can just crank it all the way down and basically have the amp almost "off."  I can then get in and match it to the type of music I'm listening to and have my low end fix.For the price, if you go in with realistic expectations, this amp is literally going to blow you away.  Is it going to compete with stuff that costs 5 times as much and ACTUALLY puts out 1100 watts of power??  Not at all...but it's going to power some subwoofers to fill out the sound in your vehicle, and will be plenty enough for you to hear.  You might not be waking up the whole neighborhood...but, maybe, that's a good thing!!I recommend it, and will be looking into some of the other options for four channel amps to power some new component speakers I'm looking at for my old car.

Like many others, I ended up getting one of these to use my FitBit One at night when sleeping.  My included FitBit band had stopped holding the FitBit in well, so I figured something with a zipper would be perfect.The wrist band fits my large wrist well, the zipper works great, and I haven't had to spend any time in the morning trying to locate my FitBit on the bed since I got it, so I'd say it's working for what I got it for.  Good stuff.

These Mixels are apparently some new cartoon show on Cartoon Network. The LEGO sets are very small, sold in just a single bag. Luckily, they aren't "blind packs" so you know what character you're getting.I ended up buying all of the Series One Mixels when I came across them in a local store. I decided to get them all at once so I didn't end up having to spend an arm and a leg to get that one last one a few months from now when they are no longer to be found in local stores.After having so much fun putting together all of the Series One characters, I did the same thing as soon as I saw the Series Two characters at that same local store. Oddly enough, I was able to get them all about two weeks before they were supposed to release.What I have come to notice about these characters in Series Two is that every single one of them seems to have one "distinguishing" feature that differentiates them from all of the other characters in the collection.Mesmo is a very cool Mixel figure.  He's got cool colors, some neat translucent pieces, and I really like his overall feature set.  He's got small but movable legs, and his wings can be posed in many ways.I think Mesmo has two distinguishing features.  First are going to be his wings.  There are other Mixels that have wings, but Mesmo's just seem to be a bit more "movable" and full of character to me.  His other distinguishing feature is his eyes.  Those "hats" that he has for eyebrows are really cool looking, and give him a really unique look.These are fun small sets that will only take an adult a few minutes to build, a child maybe a few more, but ultimately I think that they will provide a good amount of play time for kids due to the way that they move and the funny look that they have. I will be putting mine on my mantle to display them.Recommended.

These Mixels are apparently some new cartoon show on Cartoon Network. The LEGO sets are very small, sold in just a single bag. Luckily, they aren't "blind packs" so you know what character you're getting.I ended up buying all of the Series One Mixels when I came across them in a local store. I decided to get them all at once so I didn't end up having to spend an arm and a leg to get that one last one a few months from now when they are no longer to be found in local stores.After having so much fun putting together all of the Series One characters, I did the same thing as soon as I saw the Series Two characters at that same local store. Oddly enough, I was able to get them all about two weeks before they were supposed to release.What I have come to notice about these characters in Series Two is that every single one of them seems to have one "distinguishing" feature that differentiates them from all of the other characters in the collection.Glomp is a cool character for sure.  He's taller than MOST of the other Mixels, and has some really interesting features.  I like his jaw and the way that his eye is mostly covered by what would be maybe his nose?  His legs are very posable, and his arms move with fingers that also move.Glomp's distinguishing feature would probably be his strange tentacle like things that act almost like a mustache.  I've never seen these pieces in any LEGO set before, and they definitely differentiate this character from the other Mixels.These are fun small sets that will only take an adult a few minutes to build, a child maybe a few more, but ultimately I think that they will provide a good amount of play time for kids due to the way that they move and the funny look that they have. I will be putting mine on my mantle to display them.Recommended.

These are good quality screws.  I bought them to replace some screws on a project that I was working on that just weren't quite long enough.If you are looking for this size, these will serve you well, they are good quality and seem to be priced competitively.  I recommend them.

These are good quality button head screws.  I got them to replace some stripped ones in another project that I was working on, and these seem like they are well made.If you are looking for this size, these will do you well.  I recommend them.

I bought this differential oil to go in the front differential of a Twin Hammers rock buggy.It arrived quickly, was easy to put in...well, as easy as 500k weight oil is...and seems to work really well.  I wouldn't think twice about buying this product again, it's a good value.If you're looking for some heavier weight diff oil, this will serve you well.  There's enough in the bottle to do several diffs, too, so that's always a good thing.

I have used another set of TunePhonik headphones extensively, the iXR5 ear buds, and when I found out that TunePhonik was offering an over the ear headphone set, I figured it would be a winner.  My experience with the iXR5 ear buds has caused me to actually put all of my other headphones away, they were so comfortable and sounded so good that I didn't need anything else.The iZX5 set comes in a nice box...it's got an outer sleeve and a nice inner box that stays closed with two small magnets.  When you open that inner box you are treated to the headphones, folded up, and held nicely in place in a molded plastic insert.  The whole packaging just seems top notch, and was not at all what I was expecting for a set of headphones that come in at this price point.After taking the headphones out, they snap into the listening position nicely, and quickly adjust to the size that you need them.  The ratcheting mechanism for adjusting feels nice and strong, and I had no problems with them coming loose or anything like that while using them.The ear cups are very nicely padded, and feel comfortable when wearing them.  The headband is also nice and comfortable...and honestly, it almost feels as if it's filled with air.  I'm going to guess it's some kind of foam under the outer covering, but it really does feel like it's slightly inflated to provide comfortable support when wearing them.The cord is a very nice feeling cord, that is designed to resist tangles.  In my use, I have found that it is very good at doing just that...I never found the cord to be tangled up to the point where just a quick second of flipping it around wouldn't untangle it automatically.The iZX5 headphones, in my opinion, are a bit of an odd size for my ears.  Don't mistake this for me saying that they are uncomfortable, because they are very comfortable.  What I mean is that they are almost like a cross between an on ear headphone and an over the ear headphone.  They seem larger than most other on ear headphones that I've tried, but they definitely don't completely surround your ear.  I feel that the size contributes to how well they isolate sound.  When I'm listening to music in them, even at lower volumes, it's very difficult for me to get distracted by ambient noise going on around me.  That's a very good thing.  I did find, though, that it seems that they allow a little bit more sound OUT of the headphones than a typical pair of over the ear headphones...but this is to be expected seeing as they aren't completely surrounding your ear.The sound quality, in my opinion, was top notch.  There is plenty of volume, clean crisp highs, and sufficient low end bass.  I found the bass to be a very good level, as it wasn't overpowering, but it was enough to get a bit of "thump" going in your ears when you were listening to something very bass heavy.  Other headphones that I've used seem to have overpowering bass that ends up kind of making the rest of the aspects of the music just kind of disappear.  The entire range of frequency response seems very solid with the headphones, and I have found all of the genres of music that I listen to sound superb through the iZX5s...from jazz to classic rock, pop to hip-hop, the iZX5 didn't disappoint me in any of the playlists that I used them for.Using the headphones for watching videos or playing games was also enjoyable.  I found them particularly nice for watching videos...the amount of bass that they can produce when they need to really makes you feel parts of the movies/shows more than I have noticed with other headphones.Overall, I am truly impressed with the TunePhonik iZX5 headphones.  They pick up right where the iXR5's left off, and take it another step up.  I now have the best of both worlds, as the ear buds can be used on the go, and the on ear headphones can be used when I'm going to be sitting for a while.I highly recommend these headphones, they are truly a good value.  I look forward to seeing a version of these that run on Bluetooth, so that I can cut the cords!!!***FULL DISCLOSURE***I was provided a set of these by the manufacturer to review, however, I was not compensated for the review and my feelings about these headphones are honest and accurate.

I stumbled across the Dino Pet on another website.  Of course, it was sold out there, so I hit Amazon and found that it was being sold on Amazon.A quick note about shipping on this item...it comes from the actual manufacturer of the product, not Amazon or even the external seller (in my case it was Brookstone).  So, I basically paid Amazon, for a product from Brookstone, that ws then shipped to me from BioPop directly.  It took it a bit longer to actually ship, but once it did it arrived in two days.  Be sure to open your package immediately, as if you get one from here it's going to come with the living dinoflagellates in the box that should be put into the dinosaur right away.Anyways...on to the product.On a recent trip to the Cayman Islands, we went on a kayaking tour of a bioluminescent bay.  This bay was home to millions and millions of these tiny living beings called dinoflagellates.  They would light up when agitated in the sea.  Very cool.  You could see them light up as the kayak paddle passed through the water, or as you dangled your feet in the water.  Unfortunately, our kayaking trip was cut a bit short because of pretty terrible weather.  My parents were with my wife and I on this trip, and they had been really looking forward to this kayaking trip, so they were a bit bummed out by having it cut short.Shortly after the trip, I found the Dino Pet online and thought that it would make a GREAT gift for my parents, something to let them have a bit of that bioluminescent bay with them all the time.  I ordered it from Amazon, and found out about the shipping when it didn't ship by the expected date and I sent a message to the seller.When it did arrive, I thought that I had purchased the set that came with the gift certificate for the living creatures, so I just set the shipping box in the pile of gifts that I would need to end up wrapping.I opened it about six days later to find, to my terror, that the dinoflagellates had been in the box the whole time.  A quick read of the instructions had me worried that they may have died, as it says to put them into the acrylic dinosaur immediately after receiving them, because they need light to survive.  In the box, they of course hadn't been getting any light at all.  So, I put them in the dinosaur and hoped for the best.I did this in the early afternoon, so they had a few hours of light left before it was dark.  When it got dark, I gently shook the dinosaur, and noticed a few small flashes.  I didn't know if this was a good sign or a bad one...it was good because there were flashes, but bad because there weren't very many.The next day they had the whole day to be in the light...and that night, the light show was on!!!  They were all alive and well, and the results in the little dinosaur were absolutely stunning.  I left only a little bit of air in the dinosaur, which made it so that when you shake it you get a subtle glow throughout almost the entire inside of the dinosaur.I left it to do it's thing for the next few days before putting it back in it's box to be given to my parents as a Christmas gift.They absolutely loved it.  My mother has told me that when they wake up in the early morning (it's still dark) the dinoflagellates are always very bright.  They keep it right in the main living area of their house, so it's getting a good 10 hours of daylight or so every day, which is a pretty good amount of light.As another reviewer mentioned, these are living creatures, so they will need food from time to time.  The initial package comes with enough food to give you the initial feeding and a second feeding.  You can buy more from the manufacturer when you need it.  From what I understand, if you feed them when they need it, the colony will sustain for a very long time.I also wanted to note that the light that I perceive from these creatures is different than the light that shows up in the photos of them.  The light in the photos is a very aqua or teal blue type color, but the light that I see from them is more white or light blue.  I believe this to be a function of the way that cameras capture these creatures, as the images from the kayaking trip that we took shows the exact same color, but down there I noticed more white type light than the blue-ish in the images.Overall, I think this is a really cool product.  The gift went over amazingly well, and I couldn't have asked for a better thing to give my parents.If you're at all interested, give this product a go...it's a really neat thing.

This is an absolutely fantastic accessory for "Selfie" pictures, but it's more than that as well.The stick itself is superbly made.  It feels very robust, and the way it collapses and extends works flawlessly.  I also like how it locks itself into the extended positions.  I feel like the stick could survive quite a bit of abuse and live to tell about it.The remote that comes with it works great with my phone, and it allows me to take pictures of myself as the selfie stick is designed to do.  It also includes a nifty little tripod that you can use to set your phone on and then use the remote to take pictures of yourself without having it need the angles and sometimes odd body positioning that "selfie" type photos end up requiring, even with the use of a stick like this.The tripod also fits into the bottom of the stick, so that you can use it to support the camera up higher off of an object than with just the tripod, which allows you so many more options for photos.The thing that I like about this setup more than most of the other selfie sticks that I've had experience with is the mount.  The mount on the end is a perfect fit for a GoPro.  That means you can mount your GoPro to the end of this and get yourself a higher vantage point for your action films, or even just for regular video recording.  VERY cool.  This was a five star product to begin with, but the ability to use it for a GoPro makes it even better than a five star product.It's packaged well, looks nice, and comes with everything you need to use it...including a battery in the remote, an extra battery for the remote, and a keychain to use to make it easier to keep the remote from getting lost.If you're looking for something more than just a budget selfie kit, this is the one you need to take a serious look at.Highly recommended.

The DE Selfie Stick is an interesting gadget to have for when you want to take pictures of yourself.The device basically is a long pole that has an adjustable grip on the end that holds your camera.  You adjust the length and the angle, then you use the built in BlueTooth on the Selfie Stick to trigger the phone's shutter button, allowing you to take a "selfie" from much farther away than you would typically be able to with just your hand.The BlueTooth on the device connected to my phone with no hassles, and my iPhone 5 fit into the holder with no problems also.  It comes with easy to understand instructions and a small adapter to put on one of the adjustable arms on the phone holder to allow the arm to hold phones of different sizes.  I didn't need that for my phone, but some other phones might require it.The only thing I noticed about mine was that it had a tendency to not lock itself at the angle I wanted it very well.  What I mean is that no matter how much I tightened the bolt securing the phone at the proper angle, I was always able to move the phone maybe 5-10 degrees...so I had to compensate for that when setting up the stick for the photo.  I'm not sure if maybe mine has a defect or if this is just inherent in the design.  Either way, it's not really enough to worry about...it's just something I wanted to point out.The stick has a battery inside it, and it comes with a charging cable that plugs into a USB outlet.  It charges well and seems to last quite a while.Overall, I think this is a pretty cool gadget.  I've had times when I wish I had an extra foot or two of arm length in order to get a good picture of my wife and I with my phone, and now with this device I will have that extra foot or two.

This BT 4.0 adapter by Inateck added Bluetooth to a desktop computer that was previously lacking it.The packaging was nondescript, basically just a plastic bag.  This was okay by me, though, as it meant I didn't have to worry about disposing of an overly large box (such as what normally comes with these types of things in them) or worse yet, a plastic clamshell package.The device plugged into the USB slot on the back of my PC with no issues, and the drivers were easily installed with the included disc.  For what it's worth, the computer SEEMED to recognize it as a device, but I installed the drivers that were specifically included for the dongle just to make sure that it was using the best drivers for the best functionality.After installing the driver, I've been able to reliably use the device on this desktop with no issues.  I've tested BT headphones and a BT keyboard.  The keyboard is actually for my iPad, and I didn't remember I had it until I had done several connection tests with the headphones.  The device works flawlessly with both of these items, and I feel that anything else that I would try it with would work perfectly.For the price, I think this is a great way to add BT to a device that doesn't have it.  My desktop isn't exactly top of the line, but it's not bottom of the barrel, either...I was honestly surprised to find out that it did NOT have Bluetooth on it.  Now, I don't have to worry about that...this device works, very well, for a really great price.Recommended.

For a very long time I was tossing my change into a glass jar on a shelf.  I would let it fill about halfway up, then take it to one of those CoinStar type places to have it turned into "real" money.  I was too lazy to count it out myself, and the price of using the CoinStar was worth it in my opinion.Well, recently a mischievous little cat jumped onto the shelf and decided the best idea was to push my trusty change jar off, causing it to crash to the floor.  I'm not sure what there was more of...broken pieces of glass, or actual change.  Either way, I was in need of a new coin jar.The DE Digital Counting Coin Bank works great for me.  The plastic (seems like polycarbonate) is very sturdy and should withstand numerous adventures from the shelf to the ground if that cat gets frisky again.  The top screws on securely, but is also incredibly easy to remove and put on.  The whole thing feels very sturdy, which is good.The coin counting mechanism works great.  I have tried it a bunch of times...from a single coin, to a whole handful of change put in one after another, and each time it has counted them exactly.  It does take a specific method to get the coins in, but once you figure it out it's easy to do it every time.  It took me about two coins to figure out that I needed to push the coin down while also making sure that there was pressure going in the direction of the counting mechanism.I like that you can adjust the amount in the bank with the buttons on the top.  This allows you to toss in a couple of dollars worth of quarters without worrying about putting each one in through the top of the bank.  I also like that there's a reset button on the bottom to set it back to $0.00.I will probably use the bank to count most of my change, but every now and then toss a handful in without counting it.  Why??  Because even when I know how much is in there, I'll probably still be too lazy to worry about taking it to the bank or wrapping it, so I'll still use the CoinStar.  By tossing a handful of coins in every now and then, I'll probably negate the cost of using the CoinStar, and then I'll end up getting "real" money back that is equal to what the bank is showing.  That's not really important, though...what is important is that the bank works, works well, and seems to be well made...all at a good price.Recommended.

I have the two larger Circuit Board sets...the halfpipe and the skatepark.I've put everything together, and ended up needing another quarterpipe for the park that I was building.  I got mine at a local store, as at the time of this review Amazon only offers these blindly...they send you one of the four, but you get no say in which one you get.The product is the same great quality that the other ramps with the other sets are, and it comes with a full fingerboard that can be used with the Power Axle.This set is meant as an add-on for one of the larger sets, however, don't be discouraged if you don't have the larger sets.  These ramps can be used with other fingerboards, the included board, or the powered Circuit Boards if you have one of them.I really recommend these Circuit Board sets.  They're very cool, well made, and not too terribly expensive.

I stumbled on the Tony Hawk Circuit Boards products while browsing through a local department store.  I thought they looked pretty cool, and noticed that they were by Hexbugs, so I figured what the heck, I'll give them a shot.  I'm a big fan of RC stuff, and something as off the wall as a tiny RC skateboard seemed right up my alley, especially one that you could build an entire skate park for.  Very cool.I got the package home and opened it right up.  The first thing I noticed was how nice the parts all feel.  The ramps feel very solidly built, which shouldn't come as a surprise at all with the reputation that Hexbugs has.  I have several other Hexbugs products, and all of them are very nice quality items.  The Circuit Boards are no different.  I like the translucent ramps, it really gives it a cool feel...in a kind of geeky way, it kind of puts the "Circuit" into the name...it looks futuristic and slick.The board itself is really cool looking as well.  The graphics on it are really nicely done, and the top of the deck features actual skateboard grip tape as best as I can tell.  It comes with a small tool for attaching the Power Axle and tightening the wheels.  A quick note, when attaching the Power Axle, be very careful with the screws that you use to attach it to the deck, as they are VERY small and could easily be lost.Once you get the board all set to run, a quick "roll" forward with your hand will turn it on.  You are then off and running with your tiny RC skateboard!!The remote is a bit small for my giant hands (I'm an adult, though, so I'm not really the demographic that the remote is designed for), but it's still easy to hold onto and use.  There are two speed settings, one normal one and one "Turbo" one.  The turbo one I found to be a bit too fast for me to easily control the board right now, however, it does help get the board up to the top of ramps where the regular speed might not have quite enough oomph.  With the regular speed, the board is more easy to control.  You use it with the two buttons on the remote.  Pushing up on both of them at the same time makes the board go forward.  Pushing down makes it go backwards.  Pushing up on the RIGHT button makes the board turn left, and pushing up on the LEFT button makes the board turn right.  Pushing up on one and down on the other makes the board kind of spin right in place.  It takes a bit of getting used to the fact that the steering is opposite, but if you kind of tell yourself that to turn you are effectively making only ONE wheel go forward, then it will make more sense...what I mean is that if the right wheel is moving forward, but not the left, the board will naturally turn to the left.The ramps included with the Skatepark set are all really cool.  It's got a full halfpipe, some rounded ramps that look almost as if they would be part of a "pool" style to ride, a roll in ramp, and a set of stairs and rails.  I set mine up so that the halfpipe had the "pool" style ends hooked to the side of it, and spend most of my time "skating" on the halfpipe and around the end of the curves where the "pool" piece go.  I've used the other ramps quite a bit, too, but I'm not skilled enough yet to do anything really with the stairs and rails in particular.The ramps can be attached to each other with some "pegs" that are included in the box, and they hold the ramps together very well.  I've basically got my entire skatepark set up as three separate pieces...each consisting of several parts from the actual set.  They hold together well enough to be picked up and transported as a group, instead of having to take them apart to move them.I figured that I would like this product, but I didn't think that I would like it quite as much as I do.  I find myself going into my hobby room just to do a quick run, but then using the board for 10-15 minutes before realizing how long I've been playing with it.The decks that are sold as "extras" come with two sets of normal axles, so that even with the Power Axle not installed you can use them as normal fingerboards or just display them as tiny little skateboards.  I have no idea how to do any normal fingerboard tricks, but I've watched a few videos and guys and girls that CAN do the tricks with their hands seem to have no problem doing them with the Circuit Boards, so I would say that they are serviceable as a normal fingerboard as well.A few things to note:1.  Make sure you periodically check the nuts that hold the wheels on.  They can come loose, and if left too loose they can come off.  I would NOT want to spend time looking for one of these tiny things on the floor.  I haven't worried about it, but I'm guessing that a TINY dab of medium thread locker would take care of this issue.2.  If you are buying more than one, there are two channels available so you could have two of them running at the same time.  I have noticed, however, that different stores have different channels with different boards.  What I mean is this...at one store, the gray deck with one design will be Channel 1, and the red deck with the other design will be channel 2.  HOWEVER, at another store those channels can be reversed...what this means is that if you buy a set at one store, then buy the other deck at another store, you may inadvertently end up with the same channel, and thus you won't be able to run them at the same time.  This may have just been a coincidence that I ran into, but keep it in mind and make sure you check the channels.3.  When you attach the Power Axle to the board, it does a good job of blocking most of the graphics on the bottom of the deck.  So, if you have a deck that you really admire and want to look at, the Power Axle will make it difficult to see.4.  The wheels can get some dust on them, and if the rear wheels of the Power Axle get dust on them, they won't "stick" to the track quite as well.  I find that a quick wipe with anything slightly damp will get them nice and clean again...honestly, I just lick my finger and wipe the wheels off...but I'm sure a lightly damp piece of paper towel would work as well.  After that, they'll get better grip and be back to running like new.Overall, I'm really happy with this product.  It's fun to use, works well, is unique, and has survived quite a few falls off of my desk to the floor...so I'd say it's durable.  I liked it enough to buy a whole bunch of the ramps and stuff just a few days after getting my first set.Recommended.**Portions of this review are shared across multiple products in this Circuit Board line.  I have used many of the same paragraphs in several Circuit Board reviews, as I figure that many people will be looking at several of the sets as "starter" sets.  I apologize if you read the same basic review from me several times, but each one has been changed to reflect the actual product that is being reviewed...however, so many of the things from each review are the same, that I feel there's nothing wrong with using the same basic review for the things that are the same...such as how the boards work, and the quality of the parts.  Thank you for understanding.**
