I have been using the DE Powerbank charger to charge my iPhone 5 for the last week or so.  I've been primarily charging the phone with this device, and when it gets low I charge it back up to continue testing on the phone.What I have come away with is a feeling that the product works well, provides good power and charging, and will definitely come in handy in those instances when I don't have access to an actual wall outlet.  For instance, at work I often would have to leave my phone in the break room area if I wanted to charge it, and I'm not comfortable doing this, so instead I can just bring the Powerbank out and charge the phone at my work station.  It will also come in handy in cases of emergency, as it will provide a good amount of backup power for the phone.  The iPhone 5 has a 1900mah-ish battery, so with the Powerbank I can get one full charge, and then another 1/3rd of a charge (roughly) if need be.  This would be enough for an overnight camping trip or a long day hike, easily.The added benefit in the emergency situation is the flashlight.  I found it to be very bright at the highest setting, bright enough to see at the low setting, and the strobe would be great for getting someone's attention if you needed to do so.  The light has functioned perfectly fine for me.Overall, I'm happy with the product and will be keeping it around my phone, to grab at times when I may be gone from home for longer than a few hours.

I bought an iPad Mini shortly after they came out.  I had been looking into getting a regular iPad, but felt that the size was just a bit more than what I wanted.  When the Mini came out, I went to look at them and was instantly hooked by the size of the device...it was exactly what I had been looking for.Over the year that I had it, I really enjoyed using it.  However, I found myself every once in a while wishing that it was a bit more snappy.  I thought that maybe I would just need to upgrade to the full sized iPad if I wanted the quicker responses and such that I was kind of hoping for.I had resisted upgrading to the Mini with Retina because I didn't think that it would really be much of an upgrade.  Sure, it had higher pixel density, and a faster processor...but it couldn't be THAT much of an upgrade, could it??Well, I ended up getting to a point where I was a bit tired of dragging my big heavy laptop around with me, and was planning on using my iPad as a bit of a replacement for the computer.  I started looking at articles and reviews about the Mini with Retina, and found out that I couldn't have been more wrong on the idea that it wasn't much of an upgrade.  Benchmark tests showed the Mini with Retina to be a MUCH faster and more powerful device than the original Mini.I didn't hesitate to make the purchase after finding out the information about the upgrades in performance.When the device arrived, I was pleasantly impressed by how much it felt the same. Form factor and weight were nearly identical, and it was a very natural transition going from the original Mini to the Mini with Retina.  I was then, of course, wowed by the speed and snappiness of the new Mini with Retina.  It was SO much more responsive than the Mini, and I wasn't really aware of what I was missing.The other thing that truly stunned me was how much of a difference the display actually DID make.  Even after making the purchase, I still figured that the display couldn't be THAT much better than the original Mini...however, with the Retina display things are so much more crisp, in particular text.  I can't see the pixels that I was able to see on the original Mini, and it just looks better overall.I've been really impressed with the iPad Mini with Retina.  It took everything that I liked about the original iPad Mini and made it better.  If you're looking for a small tablet, the iPad Mini with Retina should be on your list.

I bought two of these lights for my father and myself for a trip we were taking together to Grand Cayman.  We are not SCUBA divers...well, he's certified but hasn't done it in a long time, and I'm not even certified.  However, the place we were staying at in Bodden Town has a really nice reef protecting it, and my parents had been there before and said that the snorkeling was great.  Last time they were there, my parents had watched some people do some night snorkeling, and my dad seemed really interested in it.I bought these lights so that we could do just that.  We only ended up getting to use them once because of rough water, wind, and rain the whole time we were there, but that one time turned out to be the absolute highlight of the trip for me.The lights arrived from Amazon quickly, as is always the case.  The boxes they come in are nice, and the instructions are easy enough to follow (it's a flashlight, though, I think any instructions at all would be easy to follow).  I took them out and inspected them, and was happy to find that they shipped with not just batteries, but actual Duracell brand batteries...so that was a good start!!I liked the wrist strap that is included with the light, it's a good way to make sure that you don't drop the thing.  It's a bit heavy when you're just holding it, but in the water that's not an issue at all.  As others have noted, it's a bit odd to get the light adjusted between the Low and High settings.  However, as soon as I figured out how to do it, it works very well and easily for me.  The problem I had was that I was trying to slide the switch, when you just need to press it.  Once I figured out how to do it, I never had another issue.We took the lights into the water for a good 30 minutes of snorkeling, and it was stupendous.  Nearly everywhere I shined the light on the reef, I could see reflections of little eyes looking out at me.  The beam was focused and bright, with enough light spilling out into a larger area to make large areas illuminated well enough to see.  We found a bunch of lobsters, some rays, and a Caribbean Reef Squid...all things that you wouldn't see out in the daylight at all.This light is now part of one of the more memorable things I've done on any vacation, and I wouldn't trade it for the world.I made sure to rinse the light off in fresh tap water to get all of the salt off of it, and then I let it air dry before putting it back together.  I wanted to go again really badly, but the weather simply didn't cooperate for the rest of the trip.I can attest to the hardiness of the light as well, unfortunately.  On the way home, our airline managed to pretty much destroy our gear bag.  It was ripped, smashed, and the wheels were broken off of it.  It was pretty well mangled.  My light didn't have it's box, as I had thrown it away to make room in the bag.  The light not only managed to make it through our bag getting destroyed, but it made it through it with flying colors...in fact, it was on when we go home.  The bag was NOT smashed like this when we arrived in the United States and picked the bag up for Customs, so it happened in the United States.  That doesn't really matter, but what it means is that for, at least, the 2.5 hour flight, along with the two hour drive home, then the hour of just sitting around before unpacking...the light didn't kill it's batteries.  It was warm...but the batteries were still going strong.  In fact, I've been using it every night when I take my dog for a walk on those initial batteries, and it's still going nice and throwing good light.I've been really happy with this light.  It makes me want to plan more and more trips to places where snorkeling is actually worth doing.  I won't get much use out of it here in Michigan, but hopefully I'll make it back to the Caribbean or Hawai'i sometime in the next two years or so.Overall, I recommend this light for snorkeling.  I can't really comment on it for SCUBA diving, but if you're going snorkeling and don't get to do it on a very regular basis and want a light that works for a price that won't break the bank, I think you'd be hard pressed to find something much better than this.I'm not sure if Amazon will allow this link, but here is a video I made of the night snorkeling with a GoPro Hero 3 Black showing how the light worked.  The camera picked up more reflections than my eyes, so some of the images are a bit more washed out than they appeared in real time.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Nr_ctnKk4ck

I have been using the Aleratec Universal Tablet Hand Strap on my iPad Mini for a while now, and really like the product.I used to get cramps in my hand from holding the iPad with one hand while playing games for long sessions.  However, with this strap system that is no longer an issue.The strap is very easy to use.  You just select the right sized rubber pieces for your tablet (there are two sizes) and then stretch them over the edges of the tablet.  You then adjust the Velcro strap on the device to the size of your hand, and then you hold the tablet by simply holding your hand in front of you!!The device swivels to allow different orientations of the tablet.I really like the ease of holding the tablet that this strap gives me.  I can basically hold onto it without holding it at all...I just slip my hand through the strap and it's good to go.  It makes marathon gaming sessions on the tablet much more comfortable, and I recently used it to watch a movie while on an airplane.  It was a LOT nicer on the plane than trying to hold the tablet in my hand.If you're looking for a strap system to get a better way to hold onto your tablet, then this one will work for you very well.Recommended.

The kickstand pad is solidly made, works well, and is easy to transport in your jacket pocket, your tank bag, or inside a panel on the bike.The plastic is solid, and it keeps the bike on it's stand on grass just fine...which means that it should work on just about any surface you can imagine, other than MAYBE the sand on a beach.I've tested it out several times, and each time I've had zero issues with it at all.  I'm comfortable to leave my bike on this without worrying too much about the possibility of the bike falling over.If I had to change one thing on it, I wish it were orange with black writing, instead of the other way around.  I have a tendency to lose these things after a few months, and I think if it were a brighter color I'd be more apt to notice it on the ground when I'm getting the bike set to leave a parking lot or whatever.Overall, five stars.

I have a Capture Pro Clip that I recently started using a lot more often because I finally got a bag that has good enough support on the shoulder straps for it to work correctly.  On my other backpacks, the Capture ended up sliding off to the side of my body as the straps didn't stay in place very well.  On belts it worked fine, but I typically don't wear belts very often.Anyways, I got a new backpack that has a much better chest support, so the Capture was getting a lot more use...and that is a really nice system.My fear, though, was dropping my camera.  The Capture holds the camera perfectly secure, so no worries there, but I was finding myself very tempted to use the system with no strap in place, and after almost dropping it recently at an Art Festival, I decided to start using my old strap as a "safety" if you will.  Basically, I was using the Capture, then having my neck strap around my neck anyways, so if I dropped the camera it would fall and hit me in the stomach, instead of hitting the ground.  The problem with that??  Most camera neck straps aren't really designed to be worn in a way that allows them to be "slack" or loose around your neck, which is what happens when you are using the Capture.  It's also uncomfortable, and to be honest it looks terrible.I had remembered seeing a strap on the Peak Design's site when I was looking into the Capture system.  I decided to go and take a look at it.One quick look had me sold, as they actually advertise and show you how to use the "Leash" as a safety for your camera when using Capture.  I then started looking at some of the other features of the Leash, and decided that this was something I had to have.I ordered from Amazon with Prime shipping and had the product in just one business day, despite not spending the money for overnight shipping which is nice.I quickly set about setting up the Leash on my backpack with Capture.  The one Anchor mounted to a D-Ring on my backpack that was right near the Capture Clip.  The other Anchor I mounted to the left strap mount on my DSLR.  I then adjusted the length of the Leash so that it was as short as possible, and then tested it out.  With the system in place, if I were to drop my camera, it would end up hitting me right in my thigh, which is perfect for me.  It gives me enough room to actually use the camera with ease, while also giving me the peace of mind of knowing that if I manage to somehow drop this camera, I'm not going to be in the market for a new one.I then set about looking at some of the other ways that you can use the Leash.  As a standard camera strap, I actually found it to be more comfortable than my normal camera strap.  I will give you that I was just using the strap that came with my T3i, but the Leash is a lot more comfortable to wear.What I really liked though, was mounting one Anchor to the left side of the camera, and the other to the bottom of the camera on the Capture Plate, and using it as a sling.  With the Leash set up like this, the camera hangs with it's lens facing down, and is quickly and easily able to be pulled up to your eye to be used instantly.I had never really thought about WHY seatbelts in cars are made out of what they are made out of, but having the Leash really illustrates the reason...they don't get caught on your clothes at all.  You slide around in a seatbelt without worrying about your clothes getting caught or rubbing or anything.  The same can be said about the Leash.  The seatbelt material allows you to easily swing the camera round your body while it's in the sling position without worrying about it getting caught up in or on your clothes.  It's really a simple concept, but it works to perfection.I've used the system with it as a safety on my backpack several times now, and I will say that it makes me more willing to take some shots holding the camera at odd angles and such, as I am now not worried about dropping the darn thing.Overall, this is an awesome product.  It's the perfect complement to the Capture Clip, but it's also great as a stand alone camera strap.  I wouldn't hesitate to buy another one if anything ever happened to this one.Highly recommended.

These high speed powerline adapters are easy to set up and work well. Plug in one adapter to router and the wall outlet; the other to the outlet in the room where you want to extend the connection to. And Voila! You have extended the network. Then you can plug a switch or a bridge or an Access Point or a network device and you have extended the network.I have used this adapter for only 2 days but in the past I have had problem of disconnection with other Trendnet adapters and then you have to unplug the adapter and plug it back in and it usually works.

This kind of clear view toaster has been needed for a long time! You can see clearly from outside how much your bread has been toasted. The slot is wide enough  for half bagel and it even has bagel toasting function. Usual toaster functions and settings are all there. Crumb tray slides out easily for cleaning.It is a little slower than my other toasters but other than that I have no complaints. And I love the clear window!

This 46 mm watch is big and looks very fancy, like more for formal occasions than a day to day watch. Double tone color and roman numerals give it a very ornate look. Wrist band is also wide - 22 mm - and very sturdy. Date and day are in a circular dial, and somewhat difficult to read. The watch also has chronograph.It is kind of inbetween gaudy and elegant, and if you like those kind of big formal watches, then this is for you.

Canon Dr-M140 is work horse of scanning in our office. Great for high volume scanning. The Canon user guide states that the rollers should last 200,000 pages but we started getting a message to replace the rollers around 143000 pages. Replacing the rollers was easy, just follow the directions in users guide. No other company makes the rollers, only Canon, and at Canon website they are for $69 compared to $53 at Amazon, as of now. And if you have Prime, you do not have to pay shipping.

As they are priced right about $15 these headphones with microphones are great value for money. Now don't accept the sound quality of Bose, but the sound is good for music, podcasts, audiobooks and phone conversations - both ways. My wife uses them when walking the dog, and she loves them. They are lightweight and comfortable.

Supposedly extracted from Moringa seeds, this soap and colorant free gel is supposed to clean pollutants from your skin. A variety of claims have been made for health benefits of Moringa seeds but I am not really sure how much proof there is behind that.With that skepticism, I found this gel pleasant to use with a nice fragrance. And unless I see some science behind the benefits of Moringa seeds on skin, I am not sure I will pay this much money for a facial cleanser. But lot of European hygiene products and cosmetics are expensive.

This is a well made heavy duty can opener with sharp carbon blade. Big handles and grip provide good leverage. In short term use, I have not seen any problems. The major downside is that it is not dishwasher safe, so you have to wash and clean it by hand. Compared to other can openers, it is relatively expensive, but is cheaper than Oxo can opener.

Most people who buy Apple's basic model of iPhone or iPad with 16 Gb of memory are going to fill their storage up sooner or later. This Lexar JumpDrive will be very useful when you run out of storage space on the iOS device, and far cheaper way to buy storage than paying Apple $100 more to buy the next higher model. And you can use it to transfer files between computer and iOS device.SanDisk Connect Wireless Stick 32GB (SDWS4-032G-G46) is less expensive and wireless as of now, but comes with the hassles of wireless connections periodically disconnecting. With Lexar JumpDrive you do not have to deal with finicky wireless connections and the data transfer speed is faster.

Lot of times in hotels the charger is farther away from the bed and if my battery is dying and I need to use the iPhone or iPad in bed, it can be a problem and this long cable solves that problem. So wherever the wall charger is farther away from the place of use for iOS device, this cable can be very useful. As of now, at $19.99, it is much more reasonable priced than Apple's lightning cable.I see from the reviews that lot of people received fake Belkin cables, but what I received appears to be real.

This is a reasonably priced powerful 2.1 amp charger. It charged iPhone 6s without  any problems but I see a lot reviews stating Belkin cable does not work with iPhone 5. So either Belkin has changed the lightning cable or the charger works with iPhone 6s.

This system requires cable for powering cameras and that is the most difficult part of installation. The steps are to install cameras at desired locations (they do need power outlet); then connect the monitor to the router with an ethernet cable and to the power outlet; and finish the setup on screen. After that you can download Android and iOS apps and connect the receiver to the app by scanning the QR code on the back of the receiver or manually enter UID and then setup the password.We use two way audio cameras to care for our elderly relatives - mother and mother-in-law - but this setup with two way audio can have a wide variety of uses.They call camera weather resistant but at the same time state ""not intended for direct exposure to rain or snow". So I guess it has to be under soffit or sunshade or some overhang like that if you use outdoors. "Wireless" is also a partial misnomer because the camera power adapter has to be connected to the power outlet. And the cameras are not subtle, they are quite prominent but most microphone cameras are like that. It comes with 8Gb SD card which that can get filled up quickly depending upon your recording settings but it does accept up to 64 Gb card. The iOS app is kind of glitchy. You can add two more cameras, which cost $129.99 on Lorex website but as of now I don't see on Amazon.If you look for security cameras with microphone on amazon, there are a whole lot of choices, some like Funlux, Zosi etc. Much less expensive. I have used this Lorex system for only a day and except for the cons mentioned above, it is not a bad setup.

This is a well made, sturdy, and at the same time light in weight, case for DSLR camera. Hammock suspension for camera protects from impact and shock. There are 3 pockets to store accessories but I am not sure if a big power brick charger will fit in any of the pockets, except the main compartment. Depending upon which and how big your zoom lenses are, it won't  accommodate more than 3.  In addition to the lens attached to the camera, there are are two other slots for lenses in the main compartment. Access to camera storage is quick from the top. Strap is comfortable.As it is priced now, at $51.52, it is relatively expensive case, especially for Case Logic.

I could not get this shredder to work. As soon as I plugged in the power cord, the red door open light turned on, indicating the waste basket was not in place. The waste basket was snuggly in place. So I called the technical support and spoke to a rep called Stan. After trying different things for an hour, he could not get it to work and told us to return to Amazon. He said he does not have the authority to issue RMA, because  he does not work for Sentinel, their company just contracts with Sentinel to provide technical support.

Otterbox cases are known for the protection they provide to your device but not style and with this case they want to change that. You can show the original iPhone color or swap the inserts of different colors, at an extra cost of course.Thick bumper should provide adequate protection and the controls are easy to reach. The protection comes at the cost of hefty bulk.But this case does not feel sturdy and industrial like other Otterbox case, it comes across as looking cheap, especially the back clear plastic part. And the insert does not fit snugly inside either.This case is very expensive compared to other clear cases for iPhone, which you can purchase for one third the price of this one. My wife and son drop their phones a lot and so she is a big fan of otterbox cases. Once she even broke the Otterbox case, but the company stands behind their product and they replaced it free of cost.

This cable is really short, only 6 inches long, so it is basically meant to be used to charge your iPhone/iPad from a computer USB port or to sync with the computer. And you can probably also use it with a USB car charger depending upon where you're charging port is  and if you are not going to be using the iPhone/iPad when it is charging.As it is priced now, at $17.99, it costs more than double the price of 4 inch Amazon Basics  lightning cable, which is available only in black or white.

Ordered for my basketball son, I was under the impression this basketball was larger. Targeted for those wishing to improve their dribbling skills,  this light version can help with this I suppose.  It is intended for indoor use, based on the ball that I received, so I would not recommend using it outdoors-- I dont believe it will hold up as well on cement.As ample time goes by, we will be able to determine how much it really does improve on his dribbling techniques and skills.

This is very handy when you are replacing your regular hard drives with SSD drives. Recently we replaced all our office computer workstation hard drives with SSD drives, and this tool was very useful. Cloning works without  computer - that is the best part about this drive.But there are lot of downsides and problems too. Frequently it disconnects from the computer and the drive(s) are not recognized, s you have to restart the computer. Does not have a fan, so it gets very warm and make sure to turn it off after use. It is very cheaply constructed, but then is cheap in price too.

They have a very cheap, imitation appearance, like you would expect $29 earring to look like. I would not pay $99 the list price, they are not worth that. But even for $29 you can buy lot better looking earrings.

This case is well made, fits the iPhone 6s snugly, is easy to take off and put on and controls are accessible. But it does increase the bulk. Bezel is big enough to protect from face down drops, and that's where the phone really needs protection, because it won't break from back down drop.It does increase the volume and thickness and is relatively expensive.

This is a light weight, easy to use and reasonably priced recorder that I use  primarily to dictate for speech recognition by Dragon Naturally Speaking. The built in USB port is very handy to transfer the files to the computer. The speech recognition accuracy using Dragon Medical 2.0 is almost 98%. 8 Gb memory with option to add micro SD card, so you will never run out of memory. If you transfer files to Dragon autotranscribe folder, out will pop the transcribed text files!However the speech quality was not that great when I used it to record the lecture at a conference.  User interface can also use some improvement, for example, you cannot set a default folder for dictation or recording.But overall, excellent voice/sound recorder. WS-853 sibling is 8Gb sibling of this recorder, but for most people 4 Gb should be enough.
Very well constructed, comfortable to hold, non stick functions is good but not perfect and glass cover fits snugly.Overall, good frying pan.

My HP Pavilion with i7 and 12 Gb RAM was never fast enough for my liking until its graphics adapter died and I had to replace with this EVGA GeForce 8400. What a change in speed!And it was easy to set up, basically plug and play. Lots of settings that you can manipulate, although I have not played with them.

This printer has everything a small business needs: speed, automatic duplex, reasonable cost to print color brochures/documents, easy setup, very few paper jams, and easy printer management from the web page. Third party toners like LD Compatible & Linkyo are lot less expensive than Brother brand toners.I wish there was a little more control over printing, because the prints come out darker than what I like, so it also uses more toner. After having tried Dell, HP, Samsung, Canon, Okidata, Ricoh, and Canon printers over the years, my first preference is Brother followed by Canon.  As of now, this is probably the best deal for small office/home laser printing.

This printer has everything a small business needs: speed, automatic duplex, reasonable cost to print color brochures/documents, easy setup, very few paper jams, decent print quality and easy printer management from the web page. Third party toners like LD Compatible are lot less expensive than Brother brand toners. For photo printing, I would probably go for Canon inkjet printers, but this is good for most other color print jobs.As of now, this is probably the best deal for small office/home color printing.

You don't really know if a surge protector is good until your equipment comes unscathed after a surge. So, believing the claims for this surge protector, this is just a very basic surge protector. One transformer outlet for big transformer power block transformers is nice, there is an indicator light and all 6 outlets are three pronged.My personal preference is for something like Belkin Pivot where all outlets can accommodate big adapters or surge protectors with built in USB chargers, and they much more expensive than this one.

My 16 Gb iphone 6 is always running out of storage space. When you are out and about, away from your computer, and quickly need to transfer files from your mobile device to create more storage space, this wireless stick from SanDisk comes very handy.I used it with iPhone but it is supposed to work with Android tooIt is simple to setup, just download the app, turn on this stick and connect wirelessly within minutes. It works both ways: you can store files - like music and video- and transfer or stream on your device; or transfer files like pictures, videos, music from your device. And of course your other option is to store or transfer files in cloud like Dropbox, OneDrive, iDrive etc. which will eat into your data plan if you are not in WiFi.

These headphones are well constructed, attractive in looks and comfortable to wear and sound quality is good enough. Most of external noise is blocked, but not all. 1/4 inch adapter for 3.5mm jack is included and makes it versatile. But the cable is coiled, and I find it gets too much in the way. I prefer straight non tangling cords.Sound quality is average, range is limited, good enough for preliminary rehearsals. They are very reasonably priced.

Staplers, at least the ones I have used like Swingline and Bostitch,  have always been one of those necessary but dull accessories on your desk. This bright looking, and stylish well designed stapler will certainly cheer your desk space. It works and is easy to use and load.But you pay dearly to brighten up your workspace; as of now, it costs more than 3 times or double the comparable Swingline or Bostitch staplers. For that price, they could have included some staples!  Not to say of poor packaging, which was open by the time I got it.

These headphones are well constructed, attractive in looks and comfortable to wear and sound quality is good. 90 degree earcup degree rotation helps take one headphone off when you have to. Built in microphone makes it convenient to use with phone.The disadvantages are that they do not completely block exterior noise, the cord is relatively short, and remote controls do not always work well in pausing music.For the price point they are available as of now, about 80 bucks, they are not bad. I would probably spend 10 bucks more and get  the Bluetooth version, which frees you from the cord.

Opening this box is a bit like opening a Christmas present!  With flavors like Wakey Wakey, Choconut, Vanilla Dream,Da Bomb, Dark and Handsome, and smooth Caffeinator, you are sure to find something for everyones taste buds.Overall, this is fun way to select your coffee everyday. For me, Choconut is much like a dessert, combining chocolate and coconut.  Be prepared, Da Bomb is sure to get your blood moving, after all it is is double caffeinated.  Wakey Wakey is light tasting, not too bold or bitter.  Vanilla is self explanatory and Smooth is a medium roast.With these 6 flavors to chose from, you wont be disappointed.  The average cost per pod is 66 cents. I normally buy San Francisco coffee, which is considerably less expensive but does not offer this kind of variety and they also offer a variety pack, which is under 50 cents each.Try it, you wont be disappointed.

If you measure your own blood pressure, which you should if you have high BP, the wrist blood pressure units are a lot easier to use. With the wrist unit, the technique of measurement is very crucial: the monitor should be at the level of the heart and cuff should be half an inch above the wrist. As the studies by Consumer Reports, and Mount Sinai Medical School have shown, with proper technique, the readings from wrist blood pressure units are accurate and comparable to upper arm cuff units. For last 4 years, I have used Omron 7 Series Wrist Blood Pressure Monitor almost every day and it has given fairly accurate readings.Blood pressure readings, and for that matter all other health readings like weight, pulse, activity level etc. are most useful when they are tracked and you can visualize the progress or change over time and see the impact that interventions, like taking a blood pressure medicine, make. And it is lot easier, if you can monitor all those measurements in the same app on your mobile device and same website on the Internet.However, as of now, there are a variety of measurement devices for blood pressure, weight, activity, and they all have their own apps and websites. Not all of them send the information to a unifying app like Apple Health or Microsoft HealthVault or Argus etc. Some companies like iHealth, Withings, FitBit, Homedic are beginning to make multiple tracking devices, but still track it on their proprietary apps and web sites.Over the last 3 years, I have used 2 other Bluetooth wireless wrist BP monitors, one from Homedics and other iHealth. Both had bad connection problems and tracked BP on their proprietary apps. On ihealth, you cannot easily measure BP without  their app.Omron is the leader in BP measuring sphygmomanometers, both upper arm and wrist. This is their WIRELESS wrist BP measuring unit.The readings are accurate, unit is easy to use, BP measuring instructions are in the storage box. Instruction manual is several pages long and first few pages full of legal verbiage. But if you download the Omron Wellness app from Apple store, it has self explanatory pairing and transfer instructions. Your BP readings are transferred to the App, and from there to "the cloud" after you press the transfer button on the unit. You can measure BP without  the app.Overall, it is the best wireless wrist unit available on the market as of now (of the three that I tried - Homedics and iHealth). But it is not perfect. Here are the problems/uncertainties about this unit:1. It stores measurements for only as one user.2. So far I have not seen BP readings appear in other unifying Health apps, like Apple Health, Microsoft HealthVault, Argus etc.3. I have used this unit for a short time and I am not sure how the Bluetooth connection holds up. Major problem with other wrist BP units (and other health measuring devices like weighing machine, pedometers etc.) has been that Bluetooth connection does stay connected over time.So if you are looking for a just simple wrist blood pressure unit, then I would recommend Omron series 7 wrist blood pressure unit, which is very accurate (even confirmed by Consumer Reports). But if tracking and wireless connectivity is important to you, then buy this one, although it does not connect to other health tracking data apps and longer use will tell whether Bluetooth connection works well over time.

Almost everyone with a WiFi network can use this device. Super easy to use, just plug and play, but you have to write down the passcode initially. Later you can go to the web page of this access point and customize user name and password.1. If you have one of the newer 802.11ac devices but an old n or g or a standard routers, just plug it into the router and instantly turn it into 802.11ac standard fast router.2. Same for an old computer with an ethernet port; it turns into and 802.11ac standard receiver. I have not tried with other devices, like TiVo, TV's, receivers etc.3. You can plug this into one of the powerline adapters and extend the distance your wireless network.4. Even if you do not have a 802.11ac device, plugging this into your router will extend the distance of your WiFi network.I am sure more uses can be found. Only relative downside: it works on 5 Ghz frequency so the distance of WiFi network is relatively small.
For me it did not work at all on Asus Windows tablet computer.

On paper and description, it sounds great; in practice not so. As far looks, it is fairly attractive, comfortable size, and works great as a watch.It took a couple of attempts to connect to iPhone 6 Plus via Bluetooth. For 1 day it tracked activity and steps and then every time I had to go to settings and manually connect again - and that is a pain. After doing that a few times, you will stop using it. As it is now, the support page on web is just FAQ, no technical and connection problem solving.The two major problems with this tracker are that wireless connection keeps breaking; and it syncs only to their proprietary App and website (and iOS Health app) , and not to other multiple health data tracking apps like Argus, HealthVault etc.

Apple cables are always white others are mostly black. And when you have all black cables plugged into the wall outlet it is hard to make which one is which,without looking at the end. If you have different charging cables in dilightninglors, you can tell from distance which is a lightning cable.This cable is well constructed and tangles less. Sometimes even with Apple certified cables, I have had a problem charging from car USB ports but this one worked on one charger at least.

There was no problem installing this power supply and it comes well supplied with cables. I have used it only for a day, but it is fairly quiet and so far no problems as far as the functioning of power supply is concerned, on an i7 16 GB motherboard. It seems to be well constructed and I have just a few minor quibbles.The cables are somewhat longer than needed, at least for my case, but they supply you with all the ties. And I guess if you have to err on the length of the cables, then longer is probably better than shorter. The cables are also somewhat stiff, and a have sleeves so manipulating them is also not that easy. And this is not a small power supply, so you need a good decent size case.

By giving you an estimate of the distance and helping you select the appropriate club, these rangefinders help improve your golf. My 15 year old nephew, who has become a national level player, won't practice without the rangefinder.It is easy to aim and  focus and the accuracy is within a yard as claimed, perhaps even less. On a different elevation and terrain, perhaps not as good. Display is decent. The combination of laser and higher magnification makes it easy to lock on the pin. Unit is very simple to use with just two buttons: one is power button and other changes between normal, scan and pin modes.Everything you'll need is in the box:carrying case, belt loop, wrist strap and even cleaning cloth. It is compact, light  and easy to carry.

This set of grill tools: a tong, spatula and fork live up to Cuisinart standards. They are well fabricated, sturdy, ergonomic and look good. Grip on the handles is good.I have always used Weber grill tools with wooden handles and they have held up well over time but I am not sure how these metal covered with rubber handles will do. In a few days of use, they feel better in the hands, but will they last? There is nothing on the label about their dishwasher worthiness, and my only concern would be the rubber handle. That is probably my biggest concern with these tools.Compared to other grill tool sets, this set is a little expensive, but it is good quality and I think worth the extra price. In the past, I have never had a bad experience with Cuisinart products.

If your kids use iPhone or iPad and they have hard time brushing their teeth or do not have the proper brushing technique, then this is the toothbrush for them.Whether you use electric or manual toothbrush, the most important factor to preserve gums and teeth is to brush for 2 minutes twice daily with soft bristles at 45 degrees to the gum line.With its Bluetooth connection to an app on your iOS device, this toothbrush is fun for kids, teaches the proper brushing technique and in the process helps them make good lifelong brushing habits.The setup process is pretty simple and Philips web site has downloadable manuals, FAQ and other useful information. Here are few other remarks:1. My experience with other wireless health products is that connection breaks periodically and you have to reconnect.2. Oral B toothbrushes are usually  more expensive and brush heads cheaper; Philips Sonicare toothbrushes are less expensive but brush heads are exhorbitant.  With every brush I tried so far, it appears the brush heads between Oral B and Philips are interchangeable.3. As of now Oral B has a Bluetooth brush and children's brush but no equivalent Bluetooth children's brush.4. Go for a soft standard brush and I am not sure there is any evidence to back up the claims on other toothbrush heads.As of now, this is a good brush to teach and develop tooth brushing habits for a growing children.

Even with everything wirelessly connected, sometimes wired connections work better - for example to stream movies on Netflix, play games on Xbox and doing large data backup transfers. These adapters are easy to use, plug one end to the router and other to the distant wall outlet in the house where you need fast ethernet connection. Sometimes neighbors can tap into your network using same powerline adapters; you can make it more secure by pressing the security button on both adapters.In a short 1 week use I have not had any problem with this adapter but my last TP-LINK adapter stopped working after three months. Theoretically, by buying more adapters you should be able to connect more ethernet devices to your network and adapter. As of now, my search on Amazon for TL-PA4026 adapters has failed to show extra adapters, just the the kit. So I do not know where you find those extra adapters. And as of now, there is no online manual available for this adapter, which you need mostly for security settings.

We received Peach and White Tea towelettes and my wife loved them. Fragrance is nice and mostly it did the job by removing the makeup, Peach & White Tea fragrance is pleasant, I am not sure about the other ones. As they are priced now, at about  15c a towelette, they are a little more expensive than other brands.

For years i have tried a variety of products to control the frizz, and this is probably one of the best products I have come across. It does not make your hair look shiny or slick or heavy. Normally, I prefer the fragrance free personal grooming products, this one has a pleasant fragrance.The only downside: the effect does not last as long as would like it to, about 6 hours.

My wife tried the three items that arrived in the mail.  Of the three, she is only interested in using one: Rosy #10.  That is the only color that will work with her fair skin tone.  The bronzer and the illuminating powders are too dark.Worth noting: there is no brush with this set and the case that the blush is in, is very difficult to open.  In general, pretty uneventful blush.

The grill is not robustly constructed, feels flimsy and cheap but is easy to assemble. It cooks reasonably well. Flexibility to use it indoors and outdoors makes it a good grill for an apartment balcony.  There is no mess of cleaning coals and you do not have to worry about replenishing the gas cylinder.  The ceramic plate does not come off and cannot be washed in a dishwasher, although it is not difficult to wipe it clean.

This fluorescent desk lamp is well made, the light quality is good: daylight like. It is stable on the table, but will not work well as a bedside lamp due to the location of the on and off switch. Goose neck is very adjustable. It does not look that great.You can find equally good and even better LED desk lamps on Amazon, which can be less expensive to buy and consume far less electricity. So cheaper in the long run too.

This is a robust and full bodied coffee, at medium and even large cup setting on the Keurig. My personal preference is black, medium roast coffee and it is stronger than medium roast coffees that I am used to. Compared to my other favorite coffee, San Francisco Bay (0.42c/cup) this one is more expensive at 0.67c/cup, as of now.It is a very good coffee but not a great coffee.

This shredder works as claimed, for both paper and plastic like credit cards and CD's. Auto reverse functions stops it from jamming and in one week of use I have not had a single jam. Output bin is decent sized. Although it is not very noisy, it is definitely not "ultra-quiet".Overall, this a good shredder.

These headphones are comfortable, sound is good but not great, remote button is nice and they are very reasonably priced. My boys keep breaking their headphones often, so these are good for kids. They come with multiple size ear buds.Yes, the sound can be better and they can be tangle free with some storage clip or box; But what can you expect for 15 dollars?
The scent is nice, but it is really a mild cleaner. On our fiberglass and plastic boats, it cleaned the surface but required lot of rinsing and effort. So it is an average product.

This Styling Paste works fairly well, it is not greasy and the hair do not look slick or shiny or flat. Only two problems I saw were that 1 finger jab, as they suggest, is not easy to apply and spread into the hair and takes a while and after about 6 to 8 hours hair do not stay styled.

The speaker paired easily with iPhone: hold the power button for a few seconds and viola! It shows up on iPhone. Sound is impressive and distortion free. Microphone is an added benefit.It is a medium size Bluetooth speaker that looks good. Charges with standard micro-USB cable. Battery life is decent.I have not used it long enough to see how the Bluetooth connection holds in the long run and It comes without  a bag to store or carry the speaker. Otherwise, it is a decent speaker and reasonably priced.

The best part about these earphones is that cord does not tangle and there is a storage clip. The sound quality is good but not exceptional. Earbuds are comfortable. Remote volume control is very helpful. They are light weight. So these earphones are a good buy.

As a part of Amazon Vine program, I received Symmetry Folio case for iPad Air 2 but clicking on review button takes me to the Defender series iPad Air 2 case!So this review is really of Symmetry Folio case. The case and stand look nice and give reasonable good protection. Multiple viewing angles and screen protection are good. Case and stand can be separated. Touch works fairly well. Ports and buttons can be reached without problem.Taking the iPad out of this case is not easy, you have to be careful and it takes time. For indoor protection of iPad AIr 2, Symmetry Folio case is good.

This 20 ounce container is so cute.  Probably used mostly by girls, the floral design with the pink background is just right for the on-the-go girl or woman.  Having said that,  a child would have to use both hands to hold the cup due to its circumference size.I like the easy to use flip straw-- no fuss keeping up with a straw. It is dishwasher safe, BPA free and leak and spill proof.  Another bonus: It has a small handle on top, making it easy to carry or attach to a backpack for hiking or a stroller.The only negative is that the top of the bottle is heavier than the rest, making it a little more likely to tip if one is not careful.Overall, this is a good, spill proof bottle.  Its cheery colors and sturdiness make this a perfect bottle for on the go kids or adults.

This insulated cup looks nice, works really well and does not sweat. Feel on the lips is a little thick and warm. As of now, I can see availability only in red color, but if it is a party cup then it ought to come in multiple  colors and particularly in natural metallic stainless steel finish.

This is a soft and plush mattress topper.  Made with bamboo, you know it has to be soft.  This mattress cover will add about two inches of lusciousness to your existing mattress.Although I have not washed it yet, I am a little concerned that this will not work for my washing machine, as we do not have the front loading styles.The bamboo polyester combination makes this a fairly breathable material.  I gave it 4 stars only because of doubts about  washing.

Everyone has their personal preferences when it comes to pillows.  I like foam, my wife likes feathers/down. This pillow is foam, so I will be the one to use it.First of all, the outer covering is made of bamboo, which feels great.  Soft and silky! It is nice but cannot be removed for washing.  That will not present a problem if you put a zip case on it, then use the outer pillow case.This is a heavy pillow.  It is packed with foam pieces, which in my opinion, are more desirable than one giant piece of foam.  However, it is so overstuffed that I hardly get any benefit of the memory foam.When you first unwrap it had an odor but the instructions mention that it will and the pillow can be aired out to eradicate the smell.  We put the pillow outside for a day in the sun and the smell was gone.Overall, I could only give this pillow a 3.  It is too firm and heavy for me.

The earrings came in packaging that was nice and in tact.  However, these earrings are much smaller than what you see in the picture .  When you buy these, make sure that you know how small they are- even on sale, at the price point of $124.00-you are paying too much. The design is nice but diamonds are hard to see. The metal is sterling silver, not white gold, but I love the combination of silver and blue diamonds.

This switch comes with versatile mounting hardware which is nice, switches on tables and shelves do not look good The cable retaining  straps keep the cables together and out of the way. It comes with Windows software, which I have not used so far. Looks like USB ports are only for charging and you cannot attach a storage drive.But this switch is very expensive. You can get  TP-LINK TL-SG1008D 10 for less than one third the cost of this Netgear. Are the the mounting gear and USB ports worth that much paying extra?

This is a soft foam applicator that my wife used with her smashbox foundation.  (No concealer actually comes with the tool, so it could not be tested with any of the Scott Vincent Borba products.)First, negatives out of the way:1-Way too expensive at $40, as of now. The price needs to be lowered for this product.2-There are no cleaning instructions with the tool, so one is left to their own vices as to what cleaning product to use. She finds warm water and facial cleansing soap work just fine.On the positive side, this tool helps blend really well and the smoothness of the stem makes it easy on the hands--ergonomically friendly. The angle is perfect for reaching otherwise difficult areas, which she would normally do with my finger.She is giving it 4 stars solely on the basis that this item is overpriced. Had it been about $20, I would have given it 5.  Because it is so new,  she does not know how long the foam part will hold up. However, it appears to be well made.

In my opinion, there are few other candies that can match Werther's taste. In its sugar free version, each toffee still has 8 calories, but is less rich than the original version. So diabetics can enjoy it in limited amounts.

This combo stopper/pourer works, seal is tight and it pours wine without  spilling. One click, one hand operation is easy and convenient.The Metrokane pourer I uses in the past was well constructed but was not a combo product. This one is flimsy and appears cheaply constructed.

The "Cream" in the name is misleading, this a black tea without  any cream. Cream, according the manufacturer, refers to the texture of the tea. And it does not taste well with added milk.As a black tea, it tastes good and K-cup makes it convenient to make. Neither on the packaging, nor on Amazon product description, does it mention whether the K-cup packaging is recyclable. So I assume it is not, and that is generally my biggest guilt about using the K-cups. If things like that do not concern you, and you like black tea, then this a flavorful tea.

The claim "Every bag clicks closed so you know it's closed" is erroneous. Every time I tried to get a click, the slider came off the bag! I could not get to work, so the claim is unsbstantiated.If I tried not to get a click, then I am not sure if the bag is closed securely. So the zipper mechanism on this bag is really defective.

With more than a thousand pages, this book has enough  information about France. Usual French destinations like Paris, Riviera, Burgundy, Normandy, Lyon etc. are well covered. And so are restaurants, hotels, transportation, tipping, Wi-Fi hotspots and so on. The book can be used to plan the trip and on the trip to find restaurants, hot spots etc.Some of the things are not well covered - like whether you need to get cell phone SIM card before reaching there or can you get on the airport. In some countries, getting a SIM card for non residents can be very difficult. Which cell carriers are less expensive and which ones have the coverage in areas you want to visit. What is the data coverage of different mobile companies. Translation modalities and apps are also not covered. For me all these are crucial before International travel.The pages are not glossy and relatively waterproof like Frommer's travel books. It is a huge and unwieldy book, so other books can make better travel companions.I would use this book to plan the trip and then carry small pocketable books with me or get inexpensive data plan and have info on the cell phone as apps or books.

This attractive chaise cover looks and feels very robust. Handles at both ends help putting the cover on and off easy. There are no ties, straps help snug fit and elastic cord at the bottom should prevent it from being blown away by the wind. Vents should protect against mildew. It comes with lifetime warranty but I have not tested it through a Michigan winter, and the usual problem with other covers that I have used is that they become brittle and lose the softness.

Relationships, even under the best of circumstances, can be very complicated. What makes them click and tick is still largely a mystery. Biology, psychology and sociology can can only help you very little, if you you are looking for one or trying to make one work.Ellen McCarthy is Washington Post wedding reporter and in this book she tries to demystify some of the relationship chemistry by reporting on what brought all those couples to altar. And she mixes it up with her relationship adventures with Aaron.She is a good writer. Overall the book, filled with insights and wisdom from couples getting married and Ellen, makes a good read.

It is really nice to wake up and find coffee ready in this programmable coffee maker. But depending upon the beans you use, most of them become stale after being exposed all night.  So I have mixed feeling about programmable coffee makers.This coffee maker has most of the features that make it very convenient to use. Brew n' serve feature is really handy when you are in a hurry and cannot wait for whole pot to finish brewing. Water level can be easily seen from the transparent window. When not in use the cords be tucked in. Auto shut off feature turns it off after 2 hours.Only problem I have it had with this coffee maker is that it spills while pouring coffee into a cup, particularly when it is full. Otherwise, it is a decent programmable coffee maker.

Kimberly Yorios book is resourceful, giving the cookbook author wanna- be excellent tips and  strategies on how to write your book and either self publish or find a publishing company.From taking photos yourself or hiring a professional, to testing recipes repeatedly, the author gives you a straightforward no- nonsense approach from start to finish, which is exactly what a novice would need to successfully write and publish a cookbook.  Without telling you exactly what to do, she gives you lots of options for you to decide, which I like a lot.

Brew n' serve feature is really useful when you are in a hurry and cannot wait for whole pot to finish brewing. Water level can be easily seen from the transparent window. When not in use the cords be tucked in. Auto shut off feature turns it off after 2 hours.Only problem I have it had with this coffee maker is that it spills while pouring coffee into a cup, particularly when it is full. Otherwise, it is a decent basic coffee maker.

This review is for the NAK Fitness Graduated Compression Socks (Men and Women 1 pair).Love these comfortable and well-designed compression socks. I am a busy nursing student and work 12 hour shifts at the oncology unit. Some days I go home and basically fall flat on my face on the carpet when I am off work because my feet and legs hurt SO BAD! I got these socks because I know the importance of a good compression sock for wellness of the lower extremities!These socks go on smooth, dont bunch, gather or pull. They look very sleek on too. I love the fun colors they come in. I got the green because I needed a size large. I would recommend the large if you have a larger calf. The top doesnt cut into my leg or become uncomfortable into my shift. They stay up and dont fall or cause problems.The socks provide the exact compression I need to encourage venous return and circulation and keep my legs feeling fresh and non-tired all day/night. The sock part supports my arch and the fabric of the whole sock if very breathable. I would give these 5/5 stars!If you have any questions please post below and I would be happy to answer! I received a discounted promotional sample of this item for my honest and unbiased review.

This review is for the Shin Splint Compression Sleeves By Run Forever Sports - Health & Fitness Accessories for Men & Women - Ideal for Running, Cycling, Nurses.I got the large size in these. I am a size 16-18 woman and my calfs are larger. The sizing was perfect and these fit good. I am a busy nurse and sometimes travel as much as 6 miles per shift on my feet. I was used to coming home at night with swollen ankles and burning legs and feet. I got these calf compression sleeves and the other ones the company makes and I have to say, I love both!These sleeves are a different material then their other style. This is more cotton-soft. The other are more nylon-smooth. I think both are special in their own way. The fabric on these are moisture wicking. I can pull these off my legs after being on shift for almost 12.5 hours and it is not sweaty or damp underneath. I simply throw these in the machine to wash them on cold, and hang dry them. I guess technically you could dry them  but I am scared they may shrink!These go on easy and dont bunch or snag. I also have taller legs and they fit the whole length of my calf. Which is nice, because I have a few other pairs from other companies that cut off half way up my calf. Not very comfortable  but these are super comfortable! Also the top banding stays up strong and doesnt curl or start to fall down half way through my shift. Thats good because I dont want to have to take time away from my patients pulling this stuff up all day.Overall, if you are looking for good quality compression  these are it! 5/5 stars!If you have any questions please post below and I would be happy to answer! I received a discounted promotional sample of this item for my honest and unbiased review.

This review is for the Running Socks for Women and Men - Soft and Smooth Copper Infused No Show Athletic Socks that Kills 99.9% Bacteria with Antimicrobial Fabric.I am a busy nurse and pull 12 hour shifts as my regular work schedule. I need great foot support and protection. Thats where these socks come in.I normally wear compression sleeves on the calves of my legs, and then need a superior sock for the foot bed. I thought I would try these socks to pair up with my compression and see how my feet and legs ended up at the end of my shift. I love these socks because they feature a comfortable copper infused bottom of foot cover, soft material to conform to my foot shape, the non-slip tabs help keep these in place and dont move around and cause irritation, and the sole support doesnt start to wear and become thin.My feet at the end of my shift were fresh and dry. They felt great in my shoes, providing a nice softness but still a hardy support. The shoes didnt shift, bunch or move in my shoes and at the end of the night, I took them off and washed them in cold water and machine dried and they were as good as new. 5/5 stars!If you have any questions please post below and I would be happy to answer! 2:09 MinsThis review is for the Coofit Elegant Vintage PU Leather Bowknot Bow Handbag Shoulder Bag.This is a crisp white bag that is made with beautiful PU leather. The leather is very similar to regular leather. The surface is smooth and can wipe down easily with a warm cloth and air dry. The bag looks as good as new when I purchased it.I love this bag because it is very girlie and has a nice bow on the front. It matches all my dresses and outfits to wear to church. It also looks cute with some outfits I wear out to dinner. I get a lot of compliments on this bag because of the bow and it is a great size that compliments all my clothing.This bag has a lot of storage. Not only does it have a nice middle compartment that can hold a lot of stuff, such as: iPad Mini, iPhone, makeup, wallet, water bottle, lotion, feminine products, candy and whatever else you need to carry, it also has several zippered pockets. The back has a handy outer zippered pocket that fits my iPhone perfect for easy access. Inside, there is a middle divider pocket with zipper for carrying other stuff more securely. There is also an inside zippered pocket on the wall. There are also non-zippered side pockets to hold Chapstick, coupons, nail files, ect.This bag has a nice brown lining  it is made of something similar to nylon What I love about it is, if I need to shake out my bag to clean it, the inside looks fresh and new it doesnt stain or wear out.This bag also has an adjustable shoulder strap to make carrying easy, although I carry it in my hands or move it up my wrist/arm. Overall, a beautiful bag: 5/5 stars!If you have any questions please post below and I would be happy to answer! I received a free promotional sample of this item for my honest and unbiased review.

This review is for the BTArtbox Large Sheet Halloween Stickers 3D Water Transfer Nail Decals - Pumpkin, Skull, Black Cat, Bat, Spider, Ghost, Witch - Over 180+ Halloween Designs.These are fun nail stickers that come in a TON of designs. You pay very little for like a YEARS worth of stuff to put on your nails. I got these at a non-Halloween time as they have a ton of stuff that can be used year round. I use the skulls, candles, fire and spiders all the time. They add a fun touch to a manicure or pedicure.These stickers have a learning curve to apply. This is the easiest way I found to use them Get a pair of VERY small stainless steel sharp mini scissors  cut your design. Be sure to basically cut it as close to the design as possible so you dont have a ton of paper all over your nail to make positioning hard. I then at this point use a pair of tweezers and a drop of water on top of my nail polish. I set the design down into the water and position exactly how I want it. Then I drop water on the top and it starts to stick, wait a while, peel the paper and then let it dry completely. It will be there until you remove the polish with acetone.The colors are vibrant and fun. I want to get the Christmas set next! Once you figure out how to effectively and efficiently apply these, they are easier to use then nail polish for nail art, and smoother then stickers for designs. 5/5 stars.If you have any questions please post below and I would be happy to answer! I received a discounted promotional sample of this item for my honest and unbiased review.

3:19 MinsThis review is for the Yahoho Women's Small Compact Wax Genuine Leather Tri-Fold Wallet with Zipper Pocket Orange.This is a stunning, well-made wallet from Yahoho. I needed a nice leather wallet to hold my cards. I didnt want something massive or large that would be bulky to carry around or take up half my purse. This slim line wallet is great and holds a lot but doesnt get in the way.The leather is super soft and pliable, the grain is beautiful and shiny. I can tell this wallet only gets better with each use. Inside, there are a lot of card compartments. There is the ID holder which has a window for your most important cards or photograph identification. Then about size other slots for regular cards. Ill admit in the United States this doesnt hold all my cards. I have like 40 cards. But I keep the rest separate and only keep my most important in the wallet: Starbucks, Target, Debit, Credit, Costco and Grocery!The money compartment is unique. It holds your cash perfectly and keeps it crisp  but then has a zippered pocket in the back for other stuff. You could keep checks in there or change! It has a nice golden zipper pull. It keeps everything secure. The top has a snap to hold it all together and closes easily and doesnt fall open. Overall, I give this wallet 5/5 stars!If you have any questions please post below and I would be happy to answer! I received a free promotional sample of this item for my honest and unbiased review.

This review is for the DareTang P2p Wifi Spy Camera Adapter H.264 Format Hd 720p Ip Network DVR Hidden Adapter Camera 90 Degree View Angle Mini Camcorder Video Recorder Cam.This is a unique little camera. I was thankful for the document the company emailed me clearly stating in step by step directions how to connect this thing. It was a little complicated  but once I got it working  it was great.You simply turn on your cell phones Wi-Fi window. (I am using an iPad Mini) I connected to the one titled: CM482374374384734  it connects without asking for a password. Once you are connected  open the P2plivecam app and hit Search(LAN) the camera should just automatically show up under there. I actually had to close the app and reopen it to see the camera in the searchLAN option. But once it was there  I connected and it asked me to change my password.I also configured the camera to run on my own private network instead of the open CM one. Once I had the password changed and my private network installed, it felt safe and secure to me.The picture is actually surprisingly clear for a mini spy camera. The camera does not have night support so it is totally dark at night. But during the daytime, if you can plug in the camera to an outlet that shows the area you want to watch, it is a great security camera. I have it facing on my living room and I can actually see it quite clearly.Also, the documentation stated several times to install a TF card in the back. I didnt have money for one  so I tried to run this without a TF card and it works just fine. I realized that the TF is if you want to RECORD stuff from it. I just am happy using it in the app and watching stuff when I want  so I dont need to install the TF card.Also I read some other reviews on this and they stated theres a flashing light. Mine doesnt have a flashing light  so Im not sure what they are talking about. Maybe if its RECORDING it flashes? Not sure, but its fine just with the camera mode. The unit is very inconspicuous and no one will notice it because its just a black plug thing. Its great for the purpose it is being purchased for and I am enjoying using it to feel safe at home and watch my house when I am away to make sure everything is OK. 5/5 stars!If you have any questions please post below and I would be happy to answer! I received a free promotional sample of this item for my honest and unbiased review.

This review is for the Elegant Amber/antique Style Magnifying Glass Necklace/pendant- 3x Magnification with 30" Matching Chain.The reason I wanted this magnifying glass is rather unique. I need readers when I am reading my text book for class. But honestly, I never need glasses most of the other time. When I am at a restaurant and reading the menu  dont need readers. Just when I am reading text for longer periods of time. However, I am a nurse there is ONE time in the hospital when I am with my patients I need magnifying  and its when I am administering 1 unit of insulin to diabetic patients!The insulin syringe cap is orange and bulky and covers the very top two units of lines. I am CONSTANTLY squinting trying to be sure I have EXACTLY one unit. I always have another nurse double check me to be SURE I am EXACTLY on the ONE UNIT line This magnifying glass has finally allowed me to be able to just throw it on my neck before I leave for work, keep it on under my scrub top  and pull it out like the ONE TIME A DAY when I need extra eye site power! I AM ABSOLUTELY IN LOVE WITH THIS HANDY LITTLE TOOL!The magnifying glass has a really pretty amber turtle shell frame that looks cute. The chain is easy to wear and doesnt cause skin irritation. I can also clean the chain with hospital grade cleaners and its good to go. This is ULTRA light and you can barely tell you have it on. You could also throw it in your pocket if you didnt want to wear it on the chain! VERY nice piece! 5/5 stars!If you have any questions please post below and I would be happy to answer! I received a discounted promotional sample of this item for my honest and unbiased review.

This review is for the Pipik-Ring Holder.I got this silly little ring holder because I couldnt resist its charm. When I got it in the mail  it was a LOT smaller than I expected! I dont know if its because in the photographs his member is so HUGE it makes this thing look massive  but its actually rather petite which makes perfect sense, because it holds rings, lol.This would be a hecka funny white elephant gift or a gift for a bachelor party. It holds about six of my rings. Its fun to just set on the table and see who notices this ring holder with a giant you know what. (Amazon censored, Lol).The holder is made from good quality materials. I dont know what this stuff is called, maybe hand painted fiber glass? You can put a lot of stuff on it and it won't fall over. I have a lot of thicker rings on the arms, and a few earrings and its still good. Also, it has a ton of details  but I think you probably noticed that from the Amazon photographs haha.A fun, unique, kitschy gift for yourself or someone else. 5/5 stars!If you have any questions please post below and I would be happy to answer! This review is for the VMATE 18x18 Inch Black Skull Halloween Present Linen Cushion Covers Pillow Cases Trick or Treating Custom Zippered.I love this edgy skull pillow case. This case covers any basic pillow that is 18x18 or smaller. I love updating the look of my rooms without having to buy ALL new stuff. This just slips over any existing pillow and brings new life and dcor into the house!This pillow is stitched well and it is very sturdy. This will not unravel or start to fray. This product was offered free of charge in return for an honest review of the product. It just so happens I found it to be amazing. If you look at my other reviews, you can see I do not say that about everything I review. Let's get started:Initial packaging and set up:The product comes neatly packaged in a 2"x7"x10" box. Inside, one can find everything they need securely and properly packaged. The professional display of this products components and accessories instantly made me have more faith in a product that would touch my beloved dog.Included was:1 Handset2 Collars (plastic)2 Receiver units (vibrate/shock/light/sound functions)1 Charger1 Tester1 Instruction guide2 sets of additional prongs for the receiversUpon reading the included instructions, the 10 or so parts are very simple to put together. I very quickly was able to connect the charger to both the handset and one receiver unit at the same time.After charged, it only took a few moments to set the receiver unit up inside one of the two collars (black/orange) and begin to test on myself.Functionality:Before even considering touching my dog, I tried all functions of the unit out on myself first (since my baby cant tell my if there is a problem or not).The sound and light functions were very self explanatory and worked as expected, so I did not spend much time working with them. My main concern was the vibrate and shock features. While I am not planning on using the shock feature, since it has the capacity, and mistakes can happen, I needed to make sure I understood its potential. (I have no personal views about the ethics of shock, I just don't think my dog would respond to it as well as vibrate)The vibrate function feels as if it uses the same offset motor that cell phones use (its a motor with weight on one side of the spindle, which causes shaking/vibrating when powered up). With levels of 1 to 100, I started at 1 and worked my way up. Level 1 was hardly noticeable, while 100 was about 3-5x the vibration of a cell phone. I wouldn't expect it to hurt an animal, as I could freely hold it in my hands (with a low pain tolerance mind you). However, there is a zero chance any dog wouldn't be aware of it past about level 50.The shock function was similar to what I would expect a stun gun to feel like. Here is the level feeling I got:Level 1 - Could hardly feel it - it also felt like the tips were a little warmLevel 3 - Felt like a slight shock, about half the intensity of a 9v on your tongue (for those of us with questionable childhoods :) )Level 5 - This was now a good shock in my opinion, probably a solid 9v type feeling, enough to notice it for sureLevel 10 - This made me jump. It was enough to tense my muscles in my arm and cause twitching.Level 20 - Remarkably painful. Zero percent chance any living animal would be able to ignore thisThen I went completely all the way up to 100.I will admit, turning the dial up to 100 was daunting, as I looked at the easy to read blue LED screen. At the last moment, I asked my husband if he would hold it for me. Without him knowing what was in store for him, and a minimal background on my experience from the first 20 levels, he freely laughed and took the challenge.After I pressed that button, a slew of profanity emerged from a man that for will ever make me blush. After regaining his composure, and looking at me with a questionable look of disbelief, he conveyed the following message "That would stop a horse right in its tracks".One should reserve the top level for their animal until they try it on themselves first, to fully understand the power of it. While my husband did not think it was dangerous, it was clearly uncomfortable as possible.Overall UsageWe have been using this for our dog and daughters dog (who lives with us) between the beep and vibrate functions. It had been doing a good job. We got to level 45-50 on the vibrate for both dogs, which seems to be the sweetspot to not cause discomfort, but enough to get them interested in avoiding it. We have coined the term "buzz", for when they are heading too far away or towards the busy street by our house.Final WordsThis was a fantastic solution to a problem we had; keeping the dogs away from the street. Our landlord will not allow us to put a fence up, so we had to think of a way to ensure they stopped. We would rather discomfort them a slight bit, to allow them some off the leash time as well as ensure they don't get hit by a car. It seemed like the best solution, as this collar has done just that.If you have made it to the end of this review, you are clearly invested in your dog's well being and want to make the right choice.  This collar does allow you many choices for training the dog and is not simply a "discipline collar". Our dog and my daughters dog are part of the family and we would never want to hurt them. The functionality of this collar allows us to give them a little poke when we are not close enough to grab them.A little trick we picked up it to use the beep function before the other functions. That quickly became enough to get them to slow down and reconsider what they are doing.Good luck and my your dog's live a long and healthy life!To the makers of the Petrainer, I would like to thank you for the chance to review your product and the generous offer of gifting it to me in exchange for my review. I am flattered for the offer and most sincerely appreciative of this fantastic tool!
Best show I've seen lately

I am writing this review to hopefully help with your decision in purchasing these gloves.Fitment:The gloves fit pretty much as expected. Its hard to judge hands since there are no measurements, but basically if you are a medium in other gloves, then you will be a medium in these, and so on.Style:Overall I really like how these look. They are much nicer in person. They look very expensive and are very similar to my N face gloves.Warmth:These are super duper warm! These appeared to be like every other glove out there, but we have ben shoveling non stop this winter and these have become my new best friend. Water does eventually seep through the top over time, so I would not recommend these for skiing/snowboarding, but perfectly great for a cold day, shoveling and so forth.Touchscreen:These work like a charm. Both the index finger and thumb have the required additive to ensure your capacitive touch phones and devices will work. The basics of this is imagine the top of a stylus made very thing and then added to the fingers of the gloves. The phone can not tell if you have the gloves on or off, so you will not notice any difference, delay or change in your electronics.Value:These are as good or better than any gloves I have owned, short of very high end gloves for skiing. If you can get these for under $50, I think you are getting a great deal. Plus you get the amazon satisfaction and returns policy. How can you go wrong!Construction:These are made extremely well. There is a strap around the wrist to pull it tight and prevent snow from coming into the gloves, or just cold air. There has not been a stich out of place. After 6 times through the wash, and about 15-20 uses (including 3 times shoveling), they still look brand new. In addition, they have a non slip rubber coating on the palms, which is great if you are going to shovel, or work on the house.Cleaning:I washed these on cold wash and let them hang dry. You will want to be careful with the rubber and additive for allowing your phone to work with these on. I suspect one or two times through the dryer and you will probably have lost a lot of the use of these gloves.I hope this review was helpful!
