By that I mean:...It is very simple to assemble, charges quickly and pairs almost instantly with my iPhone 6...It is well-designed and constructed, in that even when extended the tubes stay in place without spinning around due to the weight of the phone. In addition, its holder  keeps the phone very firmly in place at all times...Its silicone-based handle fits comfortably in the hand and makes it easy to grasp without concern about slipping; and...Its bluetooth shutter (and pairing) button is built directly into the stick's handle and strategically placed, making it very easy to use even when the tubes are extended.Oh, and if these benefits don't convince you to strongly consider this Kootek Selfie Stick -- especially if you were thinking about buying The Original Selfie Stick -- you should know that it is reasonably priced and currently less expensive on Amazon than The Original (i.e, $15.99 vs $18.99)Highly recommended!

If you are in the market for a waterproof bluetooth speaker to use in the shower, bathroom, beach or, basically anywhere where it where it would be at risk of getting very wet, the Aqua Audio Cubo speaker is the best of the three brands of waterproof Bluetooth wireless speakers I've used. The main reason the Aqua Audio Cubo is my preferred waterproof speaker is due to a combination of the following three factors -- sound, controls and design....SOUND: This speaker produces very crisp, rich and clear sound, and the highest sound quality of the waterproof speakers I have experienced -- keeping in mind that the sound quality of the other two brands is also very good....CONTROLS: The speaker pairs and connects with my devices super fast and its buttons are located in the center of the speaker's FACE, making it very simple to control your music, adjust the volume (which can be loud enough to hear from over 30' away) and to answer calls remotely and speak handsfree through its built-in microphone. Plus, it enables you connect to Siri (if you have an iPhone). Comparatively, while one of the other brand's sound quality was a close second to the Aqua Audio Cubo, I found the location of its controls -- which were placed around the SIDES of the speaker -- to be less user-friendly....DESIGN: I find the Aqua Audio speaker to be not only attractive but to have the most sleek design of the waterproof speakers I've used. Further, I like this speaker  because it is waterproof, enabling me to be able to listen to music whenever I want when in the shower without concern about it getting wet or falling down; although both of the other speakers I've used are comparable to the Aqua Audio Cubo on this feature. I should mention that a minor limitation about all three suction-based speakers is that I am unable to adhere the speakers to my textured shower wall tiles because they only stick well on smooth/flat tiles/surfaces. This, however, is really not a big deal as the speakers adhere very well on my shower door.Highly recommended.I received this speaker from the distributor in return for an honest and unbiased review.

If you are in the market for a waterproof bluetooth speaker to use in the shower, bathroom, beach or, basically anywhere where it where it would be in risk of getting very wet, the BLUBOON speaker is one that deserves serious consideration. The main reason I like it is because it is waterproof and can be kept suctioned to my shower door, enabling me to be able to listen to music whenever I want when in the shower without concern about it getting wet or falling down. The other primary reason why I like this speaker is that it has an easy-to-use handsfree microphone built in so that I can receive telephone calls in the shower if I choose. While I would have preferred to keep the speaker on a shower wall instead of the shower door, I was unable to do so because the suction cup only adheres well to smooth/flat tiles/surfaces; but my tiles have a slight texture to them. This is not a big issue for me but it is a factor you should be aware of if you consider this product (or, it seems, other suction-based speakers as well, as I've experienced this same issue with another brand of waterproof speaker).The speaker paired very easily with my iPhone and Ipad and connects quickly once paired. Further, its sound quality is very good, sounding crisp and true for a speaker in this price range.While all of its control buttons work well, I would have preferred that they were located in the MIDDLE of the speaker, allowing easy access to whatever you want to control (e.g., on/off, volume up/down, answer/disconnect calls. etc.).  rather around the SIDES of the speaker so that they were easier to get to. Nonehtheless, the BLUBOON Waterproof Bluetooth Speaker is is worthy of your consideration.I received this speaker from the manufacturer in return for an honest and unbiased review.

The BLUBOON Tempered Glass Screen Protectors I've used have convinced me to never go back to using the plastic film type of screen protector ever again. And, while I don't have experience using any other brand of glass screen protector against which to compare the BLUBOON protector, I can't imagine any other brand performing more satisfactorily than BLUBOON.My high degree of satisfaction with this protector is due to the following reasons: It is very easy to apply and enables you to do so without having to worry about air bubbles, it has protected my iPhone 6 against scratches and dust, it does a very good job in resisting finger prints and smudges, and, perhaps most important to me, it provides a sensitive touch function to assure touchscreen accuracy.The above being said, I prefer the BLUBOON 0.3mm thick protector I've also used to this 0.18mm thick protector simply because of its being almost twice as thick, and thus being potentially almost twice as likely to protect the screen from breakage.I received a sample of this product (as well as the 0.3mm glass protector) from the vendor in return for an honest, unbiased review.

As a speaker positioned for the shower, the IBSound IPX7 Waterproof Speaker is a pretty good product. The main reason I like it is because it is waterproof and can be kept suctioned to my shower door, enabling me to be able to listen to music whenever I want when in the shower without concern about it getting wet or falling down. The other primary reason why I like this speaker is that it has an easy-to-use handsfree microphone built in so that I can receive telephone calls in the shower if I choose. While I would have preferred to keep the speaker on a shower wall instead of the shower door, I was unable to do so because the suction cup only adheres well to smooth/flat tiles/surfaces; but my tiles have a slight texture to them. This is not big issue for me but it is a factor you should be aware of if you consider this product.The speaker paired very easily with my iPhone and Ipad and always connects quickly once paired. Further, its volume controls are easy to use and work well; allowing me to listen to music as loud as I want while in the shower -- and even when I might be out of the room. The speaker's sound quality is also good for the purpose I'm using the product; but, in all honesty, not as good as a number of other personal speakers I use  on occasions when I'm not concerned about the speaker getting wet.If you are in the market for a waterproof speaker principally to use when in the shower or at the pool or beach, I think the IBSound IPX7 speaker is worthy of your consideration.I received this speaker from the manufacturer in return for an honest and unbiased review.

If you are in the market for good quality, lightweight wireless in-ear headphones without having to break the bank, i recommend the Mpow Swift Bluetooth 4.0  Headphone. The reasons for my recommendation are as follows:...They provide a rich, crisp sound quality -- even when running or exercising...They pair easily and quickly with your device...They fit snugly, yet comfortably in the ear/ear canal...They provide a speakerphone mode so that you can answer phone calls, and...They provide up to 6 hours of use on a single charge.While I don't have any major complaints about these headphones, I do have a few minor Issues. One is that the buttons on the headphones are a bit hard to push and to figure out by feel which button is which; and so, I found myself fumbling around a bit to pause them or to adjust the volume when I needed to. Also, it would be nice if the headphones came with a pouch to store them and the charging cable when not using them.I received a sample of this product from the manufacturer in return for an honest, unbiased review.

I had been very much looking forward to reading The Whites, as I have been a big fan of Richard Price's books for many years. I considered his books -- such as Clockers, Freedomland and Lush Life -- to be  symphonies in words. This is because I found that they masterfully captured the sounds, sights and smells of NYC in such a way that I always felt I was right there alongside the victims, perpetrators and police detectives investigating whatever crimes that were committed as the plots unfolded. Further, I always found his books to be filled with very well-developed, complex, real-world characters. While I typically prefer books that move at a fast pace, Price's books have been an exception to that general rule, as I tended to savor his very rich, well-written narratives and dialogue,  even though they often tended to come at the expense of lots of action scenes.I won't describe the plot of The Whites as this can be found in the Amazon Book Description above.  I'll just say that after reading The Whites I think I understand why Price used the pen name Harry Brandt.Unlike my past experiences with Price's books, I found so many of Brandt's sentences in The Whites to be so lengthy/ wordy/ complex that I often had to repeat reading them in order to be able to comprehend what what I was reading. This happened enough times that my head at times felt like it was spinning. Further, there are so many characters in The Whites -- each with their own sub-stories -- that I felt I needed a scoreboard to keep track of who they are and what they are doing. The combination of these factors resulted in The Whites being such a slow-paced, convoluted  book that it became a chore for me to finish it; and, thus, a book in which I was quite disappointed.

The Friendship Of Criminals marks Robert Glinski's debut as a novelist. Without going into detail about the book, it, in short strokes, is positioned by the publisher as a crime thriller that explores the various criminal factions of Philadelphia when the Italian mob threatens Port Richmond's crime boss. This positioning motivated me to put this debut crime thriller at the top of my mountain of books waiting to be read. As it turned out, my overall opinion of The Friendship Of Criminals is that its strengths are offset (if not outweighed) by some weaknesses that prevent me from considering the book to be anything more than just a "fair read."On the plus side, Glinski demonstrates a very strong ability to convey the seamy side of Philadelphia, as well as for developing rich, full, interesting back stories for all of the primary characters and many of the secondary characters. However, while not a major factor, I felt that Glinski portrays two of his major characters (i.e. Polish crime boss Anton Bielakowski and long-time associate Sonny Pitts) in such a way that I tended to think of them as being a lot older men than they actually are (i.e., Anton being aged 60 and Sonny a little younger).On the other hand, I strongly felt that Glinski spent such a large portion of his pretty short novel (i.e. 265 pages in the ARC I read) in developing the back stories of so many characters that they often got in the way of his ability to create a fast-paced, attention-holding, thrilling plot. After all, the book is billed as a crime THRILLER; yet, for me, The Friendship Of Criminals was virtually devoid of what I consider to be thrills and "in the moment" excitement. It isn't until the last few pages of the book that any real action occurs; and, even here I felt that the action that occurs is, for the most part, unsuspenseful and predictable.I hesitate to recommend The Friendship Of Criminals because of my mixed reactions to it. Although, Glinski shows enough potential as a writer that I would be likely to consider reading his next book.

I purchased this from Amazon back in Nov. 2014 and it still looks brand new.  I use it almost daily for both my Irish Draught warmblood(17.1 hands) and my Saddlebred(16.1 hands).  Something isn't quite right about the proportions and the crank noseband(yes, this has a crank but I do not use it to the point of leverage).The leather is decent quality in that it has held up very well but it hasn't *softened* up as much as some of my more expensive bridles would have with a year of regular cleaning(the old fashioned way- with a bar of glycerin soap and conditioning with neatsfoot oil- not the all-in-one or spray on stuff)(NOT that there is anything wrong with those- whatever works for you!  I spent alot of time in a barn when I was a kid where we got smacked with a crop if we didn't clean our tack to our trainer's liking, LOL).  Anyhow, usually lots of glycerin soap and oiling softens almost anything up eventually so we'll see.  I love some of my other HDR tack immensely.  I like that this bridle is so adjustable.Overall- if value is a concern, I think this is a decent buy, esp. if you can get it on sale like I did!

So I just recently reviewed the iHealth and now the Up2 and I have to say I LOVE the Up2.  I like the interface on the phone and I find it tracks my actual sleep as opposed to just lying in bed alot better than the iHealth does.  I have no idea how or why but it does and since I have sleep issues, this is an important feature to me.It, like iHealth, integrates with Apple Health but does not offer so many features as the iHealth.I do like that you can set reminders through the phone app- or alarms- that cause the band to go off and vibrate.A big 'pro' is the sleek look but while my iHealth is bulkier and needs charging more often, it does have a face that gives you info like time, date and your info so far for the day without having to go onto your phone.The UP2 only requires charging every 10 days or so while I'd say my iHealth only lasts about half that time.Both do a far better job of tracking EVERYTHING than the Misfit which I liked while using it until I got the iHealth.Also, I like that the iHealth is compatible with a scale, pulse ox monitor and bp cuff- but not everyone is looking to track their health to that degree on a regular basis.I really like the sleek design of the UP2 and if I had to pick, it would be my present choice of fitness trackers.

I was totally skeptical when I read that this little thing could heat a whole room.  I've had space heaters for the bathroom before or to keep my feet warm when at work in an over-air-conditioned building.  THIS LITTLE THING IS TOTALLY AMAZING!  I homeschool my daughters in our family room and while 'school is in session' I pull a set of curtains closed over the open, step-down into the room.  The other morning was pretty chilly so we had the "Dr." running.  I guess I didn't realize how effective it was until I slipped out to the rest of the house to find it still chilly (chilly enough for me to throw on a fleece while doing laundry in what is usually the hottest room in the house).  When I went back into the family room, it was warm and toasty!  And the family room is probably close to 300-something square feet with 8 foot ceilings and wall-to-wall windows that don't get the morning sun.I am the family 'lizard'- always freezing.  I sleep with an electric throw, even through most of the summer and cashmere is my best friend.  I eventually had to turn the heater off because it was getting TOO toasty.  I'm going to be using it to take the chill off the master bedroom this winter because it is the room that is least efficiently heated by our furnace for some reason. (Yes, I know, we should have the ductwork checked but we just had a new furnace and ducts installed and they said it is because the vent is the one furthest from the furnace).I am impressed!  This does have a safety switch that shuts it off if it gets knocked over but it does get hot on the front and I wouldn't run it near anything that could catch fire or melt(like cords).  I also wouldn't leave it unattended AT ALL- if I use it in my room, I will use it to heat the room up before bed then turn off before going to sleep.From a heating perspective, I am blown away by how much this can warm a room in a short time!

Yum! for my hair!  I rotate products and this shampoo and conditioner leaves my hair soft, frizz-free and super shiny.I have thin, relatively limp hair and I feel like this shampoo and conditioner def. add body and shine.  My daughter, who is half Japanese, loves it also and leaves her hair feeling much softer and less coarse feeling.The nice thing is it adds softness and shine without adding weight.  Just to give you an idea I use the Enjoy line, John Frieda's volumizing line and Unite products, as well.The tea tree component makes my hair feel exceptionally clean but it does have a slightly medicinal smell to it.  If you haven't tried it before, make sure you know what it smells like or you may hate this shampoo.  I don't mind the scent at all and think these are really quite decent products!

I have gotten excellent results from these products- so much so that I bought larger sizes of the peels I really liked and worked for me and passed this along to a friend and coworker.  We work at a ranch and often spend hours out in the broiling sun.  I've had huge discoloration, lots of spots already but these products have completely changed the quality of my skin.I have dark brown hair and eyes and a very fair olive complexion.  For me, the TCA peel has worked absolute wonders!  When I first put it on before bed, I woke the next morning with massive discoloration and darkening of my face.  I almost freaked out and then went on to apply PREMIUM Argireline Botox Alternative Anti-Aging Serum  The BEST Anti-Wrinkle Cream On Amazon For Results  With Vegan Hyaluronic Acid + Vitamin A  Perfect For Eyes + Face  Acetyl Hexapeptide 3  Made In The USA  Try Risk Free NOW!, my Perricone MD Face Finishing Moisturizer, 2 fl. oz. and a heavy duty sunblock- Christian Dior Diorsnow White Reveal Uv Shield Spf 50 and decided to wait to freak out.  By the end of the week all the discoloration had sloughed off(I peeled like I had a bad sunburn) leaving my skin far more even-toned, softer and many of my spots were gone or lightened.  I ordered this in a large size and intend to do again.I've had laser work done and not only was it far, far more expensive- it was less effective.  I do recommend following the instructions and doing a spot test as this is clearly strong stuff and you don't want to damage your skin if your skin is not compatible with the product.Working at a ranch and instructing lessons and riding in an outdoor arena, I have had a huge amount of sun exposure and only recently have gotten serious about protecting my skin.  A peel def. encourages me to slather on the sunblock and wear a hat.  :)  I do follow the instructions to a 't' and recommend anyone who uses these products do the same as they are SERIOUS.  I imagine if they can work miracles on my skin they can also be dangerous to your skin- so be good and follow the directions!!!

Beautiful!  I hardly ever take this bracelet off!  The gemstones in my bracelet are very much the same color as shown on the website but I'm not a jeweler so I can't really speak to color and quality.  I do clean it periodically to maintain a 'brand new' look.  I highly recommend.I have about a 7" wrist- maybe slightly smaller and this fits me well with a little room to spare.  There is not a clasp such that you can vary the size so if you have a larger or smaller wrist, this may not be for you.Another piece I get lots of compliments on.  I purchased a London Blue Topaz bracelet from one of the larger sellers on AMAZON (ahem) and though it was pretty, the stones are extremely lighter than the stones in my bracelet and are noticeably not 'real'- despite the higher price point.  I think the stone color and quality of bracelet(I am a horseback riding instructor and horse trainer and I wear this to the ranch constantly and it has never fallen off or been damaged in any way, despite how rough I am on my jewelry) are well worth the price point!  It sounds cheesy, but I consider it a steal of a deal!

Absolutely gorgeous!  Not weighty and don't hurt my sensitive ears.  I love how they change color in different light!  I love that Peora packages their products in such nice little boxes.  With a good cleaning now and then, these look like brand new.  I can't even remember how many compliments I've received on these.  I highly recommend!

Beautiful earrings!  The stone color is slightly more brown, in my opinion, than those shown on the website but to me they look like authentic garnets.  I get compliments all the time on these and other Peora gemstone jewelry.  I am starting to amass quite the collection because they are so reasonably priced.  I don't feel bad wearing them to my job as a horse training and riding instructor, either!  It adds a nice touch as I usually wear my hair up for riding!I have worn these for days in a row and they do not hurt my ears, even though I tend to have sensitive ears.  Some reviewers have complaine about Peora gems losing their sparkle but I just give them a good cleaning and they look like brand new.  Def. recommend.

Fantastic product!  I recently had a TCA peel and I used this twice daily under my moisturizer and I felt like it made a huge difference in my healing time.  It only takes a few drops and I could feel my skin just soak up the moisture.  Even while my skin was PEELING I got compliments on how soft my skin looked and one of my coworkers said I was 'glowing'.  Normally, I try to hide and not look like a giant snake person shedding my skin- It's been a long time since I've received that sort of compliment.  I will be continuing to use this as part of my daily regimen.  Compared to the other 'anti-aging serums' out there, I think this is a fantastic deal and I would highly recommend giving it a try before spending a ton of money on something that will give you lesser results.I did receive a free sample of this product but I plan to continue to purchase and I am going to take some before & after pics.  I will update this review in a few months and hopefully can display what I feel certain will be excellent results!  I'm not a big make-up wearer and am a bit spotty when it comes to remembering to do all those things I should for my skin- but I look forward to putting this on morning and night and it helps me remember to follow through on skin care regimen!

Love it.  Can't believe that I can get something at this price point that gets me more compliments than something I spent twenty times as much money on.  I will be sticking with Peora.  They've had some great products and no problems like I've had from Amazon Collection pieces (like fingers turning green or plating coming off with a week of light wear?!?!)Everything I've gotten from Peora has been shipped quickly, packaged in very nice blue boxes- not just tossed in a plastic baggie and thrown in a box with a bunch of other stuff.  A+This particular piece looks just like it does on the website.  Some people have complained about color fading but I find if I wear something regularly, I polish it and it returns to looking like new.This is probably horrible advice so proceed with caution, but I use an old toothbrush and a tiny bit of toothpaste to polish the gemstones and they sparkle and shine afterward.I've had this for several months now and so far not a single problem.Absolutely recommend.

I'm in heaven!  I love to make strawberry jam every year and everyone loves my strawberry jam so I make 30-40 pints of it.  I get the strawberries fresh from a fruit stand in Watsonville, rush them home and start making multiple small batches, over and over again.  The most time consuming aspect of all this has been hulling the strawberries in the past.  Then I found this little gizmo and voila!It's actually cute, too!Most importantly, it makes the hardest part of going through and hulling flats of strawberries about a bazillion times easier and faster.  I am ordering more as some of my girlfriends want to 'jam' with me and I thought this would be a sweet little gift for them to help them on their way to making their own strawberry jam.I might even jam more often now that it isn't such a pain in the rear!5 stars.  I love my strawberry huller.  If you try to take it away from me I will pinch you with it.

One week.  That's about the amount of wear you'll get out of this.  I thought these were super cute and ordered one in each color. I thought they would be a sweet little surprise for my two daughter's and then one for me and we would all have matching rings! I got them on a deal and now I know why.  The 'silver color'  which clearly states "925 silver" in the description, literally RUSTED on my daughter's finger.  My 'rose gold' color ring, within a week has lost all the "rhodium" plating around the ring and turned silver color.  Even better was the green color it turned my finger!My oldest daughter is still away at camp but I'm not holding out hope that her yellow gold plated ring will be any better.The old adage proves true once more: you get what you pay for!!Stay away from these unless you just want to throw away money.I recommend looking for jewelry under the brand name peora- so far I haven't been able to go wrong!!  They have some beautiful lab created pieces and everything has been high quality for the price.

Super cute and homey looking.  These make great jam jar labels and my daughter also uses them to label her homemade bath and beauty products she stores in mason jars.Goes through the laser printer fine but I think it adds an extra special touch to use a nice pen and handwrite on these labels.The labels are very true to the picture.  You do have to adjust your printer settings.  My labels did not come on a full, regular sized sheet of paper- but Avery provides the specs.  Fairly small, so don't expect to get much more than a title on these labels, i.e. Strawberry Jam.
Super soft.  Super absorbent.  Great towel to have along in case you stop by the beach or lake with the pups.

These are essentially vinyl clings.  My package came with several which was perfect becase we have several bird feeders lined up along the windows of our family room.  While we have only had one bird strike and in that case the poor thing came in at an angle and was able to get up and fly off after a moment, I hate the idea that we could have a worse incident on our hands.These are quite attractive and unobtrusive from the inside.  From the outside, the reflect light holographically from all angles, letting te bird knw something is there.  It has not decreased our visitors, at all.I will update immediately if these turn out to fail to do the job.  I have high hopes, however, and think they are quite nifty!

Fairly well-made shower curtain.  It has a waffle texture to it- meaning it has raised and lowered squares (stitched diamonds actually) in an alternating pattern.The grommets are 'metal' but desn't state on the actual package what kind so don't expect them to last forever.100% polyester and made in China.  The bottom is *very* slightly weighted with magnets.A curtain like this, I usually treat and then use as the inner liner to a two-part liner.  I like this so you don't get get a big, nasty plastic shower curtain hug from a breeze or someone opening the door.I wish I could provide you more info but there just isn't all that much to tell about a shower curtain.  3 stars because if you look, you can find cotton, made in the USA ones in the same price point.  I found very little 'Luxurious' about this- seemed like just a regular shower curtain.

ACADEMIC YEAR-  July 2015-July 2016 (Just in case anyone expected this to run through the end of 2015 and the entirety of 2016.)Simple, basic- not meant to be a detail-oriented calendar.  Meant to be a month-at-a-glance calendar... er... duh.Pretty basic.  Handy for basic scheduling but not on an hour-to-hour basis.

Roughly, 3 out of 4 of our Gro-ables survived and were 'fruitful' so technically I would give this product, eh, 3.5 stars here but am upgrading to 4.  Here's why:I would have down-graded to 2 stars because, come on, it is Miracle-Gro, and they are like the Mattel of the backyard gardening world: they want you to buy their plants which I SWEAR are genetically modified to DIE if they aren't fed and watered with their special GM plant food and plant-water-additive-gunk.But I am almost inherently intrigued with these cute little gro-able, self-contained, practically-jumps-on-your-plate-for-you-straight-from-the-garden-its-so-easy veggie and herb growing pods.  You can literally pick a spot in your garden or a spot in your pot or even just a cute little pot and dump in some soil prep or some potting soil and voila! stick in your gro-ables and insta-garden!!  IT is so CUTE!  Add a star for cute!!!I did it with my kids and they had so much fun they actually put down their hardware to which they will soon via will-to-power be bio-connected and we did this totally amazing thing:  we opened our mouths and these weird garbled noises came out which are apparently words which we strung together into sentences.  I think we might have had a REAL LIFE, IN PERSON, CONVERSATION while planting our gro-ables.  This could be a fun family thing to do together!  Add another star!!The cherry tomatoes popped out like they were really trying to live up to their name and grow into a tree.  Kids eating fresh vegetables they planted and grew themselves.  Well, holy mackerel.  Who knew my kids actually liked tomatoes?  Nobody because they never tasted a real, honest to goodness tomato that THEY GREW before.  Even the organic ones at a stand don't quite compare!  They didn't grow where our very own cat fertilized them!!!  Add another star!Grrr... Lettuce is not happy drought riddled California with temps in the 80's and 90's and no relief in sight.  Maybe they will pop up later when it cools off but I'm guessing not. *sigh*  You can make all the veggies and herbs grow some of the time, and some of the herbs and veggies grow all the time, but you can't make all the herbs and veggies grow all the time... remove one star.BTW- I did get one set off Amazon from Vine to review but I also purchased two sets locally, one for each of my daughters to set up and our results were pretty even across the board.  We did get some lettuce but not much, some of the cilantro started bolting but we caught it in time and set up some shade and gave it more water.  The sweet peppers haven't come close to maturing but the cukes and zukes are going nuts and as always the zucchini we will be sick of by the end of summer.  I love growing tomatoes here versus back in Washington where we had to baby them through the end of July(course that was 15-20 years ago) until it got hot enough- they go crazy here.All in all, if you are looking for an easy way of gardening from seed, I recommend these little guys but remember you are probably getting a highly genetically modified product if that bothers you.  It doesn't bother me as I'd rather have GMOs- which, btw, have been around forever, than a bunch of toxic pesticides and fertilizers used instead because the plants are not resistant.

I can't really tell if the whole odor protection thing actually works but I LOVE how this smells- it reminds me of fresh laundry, which is how laundry should smell (I guess...).I do notice the scent stays with the clothes longer than other in-wash fabric softeners when I don't use dryer sheets.

These supplements were like a little miracle for me!  I have a problem absorbing certain vitamins and minerals, especially calcium, magnesium and vitamin D(this company also makes a Vit D supplement).  My doctor advised me over time and several trials that I would need about 2.5 grams of calcium supplements a day.  This provides 1 gram per serving(which is 4 caplets).  It still means swallowing a handful of pills but before I had to swallow 4 pills to get 350mg or 500mg of JUST calcium and this also provides the much needed magnesium.Citrate versions are also much easier to absorb.  The proof is in my lab work - my calcium and magnesium levels are getting on track and my PTH is going down!A word of caution: when you start taking any kind of calcium/magnesium supplement, work your way up slowly.  I find they are about as effective as Immodium, if you know what I mean.  Increase your fiber intake- seriously.  :)

It's okay is a good way to describe it.  I was pretty happy with it in the beginning!Things to like:  **solid state drive!  Awesome, fast start up, autosave actually results in recoverable documents with minimal losses.  I'd take solid state and less memory over a great big drive with lots of memory that gets hot and usually ends up with a noisy or malfunctioning fan.  **touch screen!  Maybe not as useful for some, but makes it much easier for iOs users to move around(I am klutzy going between operating systems with the whole track pad click-vs-double-click stuff).  The touch screen is just cool and gives it that whole tablet feeling.  **portability!  Small and lightweight, this seemed like the optimal compromise between a full-blown laptop and a tablet.  It doesn't have much battery life, but enough to get through most kids after-school activities.  Also, with a smaller drive it kind of forces you to get out there and use the cloud resources you have available to you.  They are many!Not thrilled about:  **battery life is short and what worries me is that it isn't clear whether the battery is easily changed out or not.  It would require opening the entire back of the computer.  I think at this price point, the idea is that as battery life shortens, use your cord more and when the battery is kaput, so is the machine.  I am not a fan of throw-away stuff.  I'd prefer something a little higher quality that will last longer- especially given that it is mainly designed for getting on the internet and lightweight applications- it seems more like a terminal than anything else and as such, it should last a while since it is mostly just for interfacing with things that will be changing and upgrading out on the internet.  Just my .02.  **It's pretty wimpy.  A 3 foot fall onto carpet resulted in a big crack in the screen and one corner of the screen spiderwebbed.  It still functions fine but basically, my daughter nudged this off the edge of her very short bed onto the rug and the screen really got messed up.I did not find the hinges flimsy but I also did not find myself wanting to use this as a tablet.  I used it for a bit then went back to my regular computer while it got passed on to my 12 year old.  She can type like the wind on the keyboard that fits her small hands well.  I do think this would be a decent choice for a less expensive computer for schoolwork, etc. for a kid IF you install a really good screen protector and put a good case around it, which I failed to do quickly enough to avoid a snap*crackle*pop incident.  *sigh*

To die for, my lovelies!  This makes the best fruit-infused tea ever!  Great for mixing up a little lemon and mint in the ice water, too.  I have next to try a little fruit puree in the water but am waiting on the local fruit to sweeten up a bit.It is glass and fairly heavy but still has a delicate feel to it.  This is NOT a French Press as you cannot depress the plunger, it just has the french-press looking disc at the top to act as a very effective strainer.Quite tall, so you might need a special shelf for storage.  Handles hot and cold water with no problems and honestly, I so prefer my drinks made in a glass pitcher rather than knowing they came from a plastic bottle or pitcher somehow.  Maybe it's just me, but it seems fresher somehow.  Great for brewing iced tea.  I'll def. use it to make sun tea this summer.This item more than earns it's five stars in my house!

Love it!  These are practically a necessity to have around.  My husband is not the 'handiest' of persons around the house so alot of the little fix-its at home and the ranch fall to me.  My Tacwise staple gun sees quite a bit of use- I guess some people are tape-it people, but I'm a staple-it person!The 1/4 staples are great for temporary things like tacking up a sign or plastic sheeting, etc. while the 9/16 staples I used for reinforcing wire mesh covering some of the vents inside the attic(don't need any critters skittering around up there, *shudder*).  A couple of the medium-larger sized ones and some weather stripping worked great to tidy up some wire(I used the weather stripping over the wire so the staple wasn't rubbing against the wire- and yes, I know they MAKE specific staples already insulated for this purpose but 1. mine are better and 2. I didn't have to buy a whole other set of staples and staple gun- I just used what I had here.  :)  I'm handy like that and stuff.  Heh. )Off the bat- the only thing I might change is the packaging- but for the price point... I guess you can't expect it to come in a cute little box with drawers or anything.  As it is, I store my staples, nails, screws, etc. by material/use and size/gauge in little recycled jars- mark the jar and the lid except for the nails for my nail guns which just stay in their boxes for obvious reasons.  I try to color code sharpie and mark the tool/bit kits and then the 'ammo' for said tool so anyone in the house can figure it out.Just like I've taught both my daughters to cook, use knives, boil water, etc. since they were old enough to handle it, I've been introducing them to power tools and how to be safe and effective with them (my dad is a contractor and taught me the same so I am proud to say my daughters are not afraid to use a circular saw or a nail gun nor am *I* afraid of them using tools in the appropriate circumstances).  Even if you are NOT tool savvy, though, a staple gun is super manageable and you can get alot of mileage out of it.  If you are artsy/craftsy, look up staple gun projects on Pinterest.  I got a used dining room set when I was in college that was cherry- Queen Anne style.  When my kids were little they destroyed the white fabric seats.  Staple gun to the rescue!!  I reupholstered those babies in an afternoon!!!  I found some beautiful RED brocade upholstery that was marked down and the set looked like new!  It's time to do it again since it has been ten years and I think I want to refinish the wood, as well, so that will be Staple Gun's next big job.  :)Have fun with your staples!  You deserve it!

Very easy to install/uninstall.  Does not appear to have water flow regulator and thus the four stars.  Also, at this juncture, our guest bathroom has a sprayer head that is quite nice that can also come down to be used for cleaning/washing the dog, etc. and so I think we will switch back to that but this rivals our high end shower head in one of our other bathrooms.  The 'glass' is acrylic and does have that bluish glow to it which I think is pretty in the light but it depends, of course, on your taste and design.  But it does come as it appears.  I cannot speak to durability as we have not had it installed long.

Same ingredients as other more expensive name brand but works as well for us and is far cheaper.We went through a terrifying experience last year where our Kitteh(yes, poor thing, that is her name) was subjected to the Kirkland Brand flea medication fiasco.  I was very, very, VERY skeptical to try anything but Frontline or Advantage on her after that.  One dose of the Kirkland stuff and she was scratching herself raw, licking and licking until, after bathing her twice gave her no relief, in the middle of the night I took her to the vet who was pretty much flummoxed, but gave her fluids, antihistamines, pain killers and kept her under observations.  I've heard other cats did not fare so well.I was very cautious with this and did a small test patch and waited a full day before adding the rest.  Sure, Kitteh gave me the "I'm pissed at you" look and stalked off, but no reaction.Despite the fact that she is kept diligently indoors, she likes to try and sneak out usually because some idiot solicitor decides to hold the door open and "Oh, I think yer cat wants out".  Ya think?  Ditto the pizza guy.  It's good to want things, especially when we live in a densely populated area with CREEPY neighbors down the street who got in trouble for catching cats in their backyard and putting them in a big cage in their garage.  I don't even wanna know...  but we also live on a busy road and I've had to be dragged out of oncoming traffic by my huband more than once sobbing hysterically over some poor soul that didn't quite make it all the way across.  Point is, try to keep Kitteh in as much as humanly possible but she escapes sometimes so I use flea control and then a flea comb on her when she does come back in.This stuff looks like it works well and I will add it to our rotation.

These work in a pinch to keep tack clean and conditioned.  They are no substitute for a good scrubbing with glycerin soap and conditioning with neatsfoot oil or so- but I'm old school about my riding equipment.  For the leather in my Lexus?  These do just fine but I prefer to wash down first then use the spray on lexol cleaner and then the lexol conditioner.  The whole 2-1 thing is sort of like shampooing and conditioning your hair at the same time (guys, I know you may not get it- but hopefully my girlfriends out there will).  Also, I feel like I go through these pads much faster than I would a bottle of cleaner and conditioner- and in the end, the pads cost more for less results.  Just my .02.

Excellent.  Not only do I use this for making mixed-media slide shows for my photography clients, my daughter also has the next earlier version that she uses to record private voice lessons(she is in the San Francisco Girls Chorus) and accompaniments.It is very easy to adjust the levels (very important when making digital recordings so as to not 'blow out' the sounds at either end).I can record onto different cards, into different folders and transfer them to my computer either via USB or with a card reader later to edit in Adobe software.My daughter simply hooks hers up to the computer and it is plug-and-play- she clicks on the file, just like she would if she had mounted a thumbdrive or whatnot and it transfers right into iTunes where she can put it straight onto her iPod to practice with or listen to later.I have conducted interviews and my daughter uses for directly recording the piano or vocals and we've never felt the need to purchase an aditional mic- although the options exist.  The mic head has multidirectional microphones that can be pointed in various direction.  I also find that I do not pick up alot of extraneous environmental noise- be it the humming from my recording lighting for my camera(a few off-camera 500W umbrella lights can make quite a racket which is why I prefer to use this to the mic on my Canon EOS 5D) or noise from moving the mic around.GREAT digital recorder for the price point.  I have purchased several over the years and tend to get a new one as they come out but I have ones that still work great from ages and ages ago and I am pretty tough on equipment since I shoot and record alot around horses and in environments like the beach, Ranch or *ahem* at WEDDINGS which can be way more dangerous than galloping over terrain in weather!

I really wanted to give this 5 STARS!  AWESOME!  WOO!  But, alas, one small problem, no matter what I add to it, in whatever proportions, it never fails to pretty much taste like A-*-*.  I'm sorry.  I have to plug my nose now to even get it down.  The kids won't go near it.I love the idea-  how can you not!  Vegan!  Woo!  Greens!  Woo!  Protein!  Woo!Taste.  Ugh.Not for me.  Not ever.The dog won't even eat the left overs(this is my uber-fat chiweenie who will literally eat first, think two days later).  It just sends him into fit upon fit of sneezing.I'm sorry.  The poor vegans of the world always get the shaft.  Of course, some may feel this is better tasting than I give it credit, that I am some ivory-tower rapunzel of protein-powders but let me assure you not.  I juice.  And I pretty much juice just about anything.  I'll drink onion, garlic and beet juice(just to torture my kids, but I actually kind of like it).  I have yet to meet a protein power I can't stomach... until now.

really, I do.  Bet my life on these.These have worked out great for what we need them for.  I work on a horse ranch that backs up to thousands of acres of trail systems and so far we've yet, in more than a couple months of testing, been able to put enough space between groups or 'home base' to be unable to communicate.  This is extremely important since we don't always get decent cell coverage and we do go out for significantly long periods of time.We've used other radios- primarily Motorola that have worked out decently and these are heads above those.I highly recommend.  I do recommend ALWAYS testing your units before heading out somewhere where safety might rely on any sort of technology.  Always take extra- whatever you need- batteries, solar charger, whatever could stand between putting out that life-saving call should you ever need it, especially when headed out someplace unfamiliar or where there are rattlesnakes or both, yeah.

If you look at my profile you might guess I'm not a big FPS game player BUT... omg, this was SO MUCH FUN!  It still is!  It has been well more than a month since it has come into our household and we're all still playing it.  The big kids (my husband and I) are the worst of the worst!I like that there are so many choices and options.  I have not played any other Far Cry versions so cannot speak with any knowledge as to the comparison of this version to prior versions.  This game is lush, though.  The graphics are gorgeous, the setting is beyond anything I've yet seen in a video game before, and the sound really ties it all together.  All my own opinion, but, I'm significantly impressed.  It is like some crazy choose-your-own-adventure book come to life in the heart of some bizarre paradise-that-is-not-a-paradise.  I love the animals. You do have to kill them sometimes but there is def. a right way and a wrong way to go about that.  And, don't be a putz, don't try to kill the elephants, not by yourself at least.  Der.So, go on a treasure hunt... or  a safari...  take a tour...  do a side mission or a few...  I think the game really shines in multiplayer mode where strategy and knowing the style of the team you are playing for can make you or break you really adds to the adrenaline factor.This game will absolutely immerse you... engulf you, so don't start unless your calendar is pretty light for the next couple months.  :)  Def. a good bang for your video game buying buck in terms of playing hours and entertainment.  I found this very satisfactory.Parents- caution: your kids'll be fighting over this one (well, at least the ones you let play 'M' video games)!Okay, gotta go get some vitamin D now...

Small form factor. Instant usability and great sound. What more can be said? This simple device takes your comp' s sound and filters it through either a better analog source or an optical out.I had my media PC hooked up in seconds and straight into my Sony receiver. Digital output with no fuss. Good job it comes with a carry case it's so small you might lose it.Worth every dime.

This awesomely large snow globe belies its quality. It's too easy to dismiss globes since you can pick up cheap ones at the big "marts" and given the slightly higher price point of Lenox's I was expecting quality and wasn't disappointed. It has weight to it but comes well packaged in a retail box so arrived in perfect condition.The paint and gold shine. Perfect execution and combination of craftsmanship and skill. I assume it was hand done, if so it's really good.The "snow" is exquisite and are tiny particles, much smaller than the usual bits of plastic. This aids the effect hugely and the 3d scene of packages inside is lovely.In all this is awesome - bigger than you might expect but has details and accents that make it special. Great Christmas gift ready to be mailed to a loved one this holiday season.

Very dainty lovely "twisted" silver heart piece that comes in a nice drawstring pouch and Hallmark box.The writing is nicely done although you may need glasses to read it - gaudy and big this is definitely not. The heart came in a baggy and the chain was in its own plastic bag. After I took the bags away I find out why they were there - the fine chain gets tangled incredibly easy and I would imagine it would not be hard to snap it when untangling if you're not careful.Of course none of that detracts from the beauty of this "moebius" heart and I'm sure it's one that would be well received by your loved one. Sometimes less is more and this small silver heart is a classic example of that.

I recently purchased a 2012 Layton Skyline. A huge forty foot trailer that weighs ten thousand pounds or so. Hauling it with my 2008 dodge would be a task on any given day but not being able to see around it added to the difficulty level. I toyed with those convex circular add on mirrors but thought that a band aid. If I'm trailing my home around the country for a while I need something safer and more effective.When DEDC contacted me about sending their extended heated powered mirrors in exchange for a review I jumped at it. They arrived in a plain brown cardboard box which was much bigger than I was expecting. I was also having some speakers delivered the same day and thought the box contained them!The mirrors themselves were completely intact thanks to the thick polystyrene packaging and getting them out ready for installation was easy.And these are big! I mean, once they're on the truck they look fairly normal but in the confines of my kitchen I was amazed at how heavy, sturdy and huge they are.They come with hardware and installing them was as simple as unbolting the factory mirrors and uncoupling the molex connector and putting the newer larger ones in the same way. The connectors means there's no wiring or splicing needed, no schematics to read - plug and play just like you were installing a hard drive in a PC.The bolts supplied fit perfectly and in ten minutes I had them on and they look factory installed. They function perfectly too, although do keep in mind that if your truck doesn't have powered mirrors originally then these won't have power either.My first ride out was perfect. Clear double vision set ideally so I can see the side of the camper and beyond. I cannot express how important these sorts of mirrors are when you're pulling a camper and am very happy I got them.

Oh dear. For the price I expect better. I've beaten the snot out of my regular ps4 and ps3 controllers and they still work perfectly.After just three days I noticed something felt unresponsive, I thought I was just having a bad day, but no, some of the buttons now only work intermittently. Such a shame as it looks so nice in the box, albeit a throwback from the Sega Genesis days. If only it was as durable as Sega's aging controller.Avoid. Unless you intend to buy it as a collectible - in its current QA state it won't help your gaming at all.

Get straight to the point - I'm being hard on this projector for one reason - audio out, or lack thereof.Sure it's got great vivid images, the slightly lower resolution not withstanding. And it's quiet and supremely easy to set up at least as far as HDMI goes. The remote works for basic stuff and you can be throwing your media at a screen in seconds.It's not overly heavy but is still a chunk of weight for a small projector. I had it placed fairly even with the wall and the picture from a movie was perfectly serviceable.Setting it up to work with the network was not so smooth and so do expect a bit of fiddling if you're intending to use a laptop wirelessly. Getting images from my ipad was easy enough though. If you're familiar with network lingo such as ad hoc etc and know your wifi details you should get there. It's just not as smooth as it could be.The price is inline with others. A tad high perhaps but given the image quality it's fair.So the audio then. Well as others have noted there's no audio out! I looked, checked then went online and read the reviews. No, I'm not going mad there's no audio out, not even a 3.5mm jack.Sure you could intercept the audio from the HDMI cable I suppose but that doesn't do anything for wireless.Even if Epson only intended this to be an office executive projector, one for presentations etc then I'd still expect audio out.Flabbergasted it isn't there and can't recommend this for home or office use without it. So disappointed.

Google chrome book reviewFive stars?A few years ago you may remember Web TV, a standalone internet "computer" for those folks unable or unwilling to learn what was then quite complicated computer systems. Ultimately Web TV was a failure even after being acquired by Microsoft and renamed MSN TV.So the idea of a fairly dumb terminal, a platform where computer use is crippled, the OS stripped down and only specific apps will run is nothing new.Obviously then this should shine a dim light on this Google Chromebook. I mean surely a proper laptop would be vastly preferable? Well yes and no.Let's look at the positives the first of which is the insanely low price that's so inexpensive even cheap lappies look pricey. Next the start up time. At four seconds no waiting around for Windows to boot and you can be surfing the web before a laptop's bios screen has disappeared.Now having said that, laptops can be left in sleep mode which speeds up their reboot time comparably - but that's only really useful if your laptop is plugged into power and not running off battery.Which brings us to battery life which on this little beauty is a claimed 8.5 hours and I'd say is fair.Of course, you can only run google chrome apps but there's so many useful programs out there that the limitation of such an environment is severely reduced and is getting better every day.This Chromebook is everything you could need in a mini notebook. The screen is crisp and clear with only the slightest off angle issues, the OS works simply and effectively and there's a huge amount of ready made cheap apps to keep you going.Do keep I mind that this is really an online tool, and functions are vastly reduced when not in a wifi hotspot but you can aim the same criticism against the much more expensive iPad.If this item was twice the price I would still give it five stars, and that's the highest recommendation I can give.

Before you even unwrap this you know the drill with amazon's line of jewelry. Small, black sturdy black coffin box with blue pull tag for easy removal or the jewels inside.As I have written in other jewelry reviews I pat amazon on the back for presenting the items perfectly allowing for long distance gifting online, knowing when it arrives it's set up and doesn't require cellophane or baggie removal.The hearts themselves are very pretty - understated coloring on the gems and nice metal work holding them in place. These don't scream money, but they look beautiful and if gorgeous hearts that will get attention without being gaudy are your thing then buy these with confidence.I'm constantly pleased with amazon's jewelry line and these are a beautiful addition to the collection.

Mom necklace reviewAs ever with amazon's fashion line of jewelry this nice little necklace piece comes in the same black coffin about three inches by two with a little blue pill tag for easy retrieval.It makes gifting this item a no brainer especially directly online to the recipient as it isn't wrapped in cellophane or dumped in a baggy requiring you to unwrap it before handing it over. It's good to go out of the box and looks great - albeit it very, very dainty. I wasn't expecting so little... precious... anything. It's like negative space. The heart is very thin but it does look lovely and polished and the cubic zirconias do their job shining and glistening.I could have lived without the MOM etching but it's so small it may be missed entirely. I don't like jewelry with names so much but if that's what you're looking for then you won't be disappointed.In all, a very pretty piece of jewelry, priced right and excellently presented. Whether you're buying for a loved one (presumably your mom!) or getting yourself a treat then I recommend this one wholeheartedly (arf!)

I agree with another reviewer that this was perfect for blending tan-less spots with tanned. In my case upper arms being pasty white but as a biker my lower arms have seen years of UV.As part of Vine I was also sent the mitt which I recommend for easier application. On my Caspar the ghost colored torso though I wasnt convinced this would pass as a real tan. It seemed rather orange and fake. But then every tanner has looked that way on me. Maybe I need to compliment it with real sun tanning or perhaps, and more likely, I'm just expecting too much given my Lilly white bits.I do recommend the product with the caveat that it's a fake tanner... So you can't really blame it for looking a tad fake. As a blender between sun tanned areas though it looks really good. If you just need a touch up, a refresh or want to hide bikini lines then this is the real deal.

The Amazon curated collection never fails to exceed expectations. Not only in terms of quality but also cost.These large Celtic tree of life earrings very much upholds that tradition and out the box you can't help but smile.They come in a presentation black "coffin" ready to gift to your loved one. Not in a Baggie or tied up so if you decide to ship it direct to its intended recipient you can do so with confidence that they look perfect from the outset.Each earring is exquisitely made and despite the description claiming oxidized, initially they look silver or chrome. I'm guessing they will gray within some time of wear.Regardless, if you desire a great bold set of Celtic work that isn't the usual Celtic knot then this is a great choice.

The last time I owned a remote control vehicle was around 1971 and the car was tethered to the remote. So not really remote at all!How far we have come. This great "rock crawler" is much bigger than you'd expect and can go over some fairly large pieces of gravel and pebbles which, if you think in terms of scale, would be huge rocks for the size of the car. Charging takes just over half and hour and you get a healthy one to two hours or more of playtime. The unit itself is rechargeable so no worries on batteries there and the remote takes AAs supplied. Given today's tech I would imagine the remote should last a good while before replacing them.Speaking of the remote. I'm not a massive fan of the gun shape controller with a wheel on the side. Guess I'm just not used to it. I vastly prefer the analogue levers in higher end RC units but then I'm a console gamer so that would make sense.But no matter - for the price this is a stunning fun bit of kit. Get your kids outdoors for a change and grab a couple of these and get racing. Totally recommended.

This Polyester muff is a versatile excellent choice with its multilayers and water resistant shell.It's able to be deconstructed in layers so it's not an oven if the temp is reasonable. And the snap on winter layer adds if it gets cold towards the end of the day.I really like the fact that dirty feet/shoes cable taken into account by removing the bottom.In all, despite what I consider a slightly high price point at the time of writing, this is a great item for keeping yer little ones warm.

When i received this bag in return for an unbiased review I was immediately going to make an Indiana Jones comment in my review... but I notice someone else has beaten me to it! But it's an accurate description in terms of old school looks. Combine that with modern conveniences and many pouches and storage choices and you have the ultimate retro camera bag.Of course since it's so versatile you don't need to be a photog to use it; anyone who is after a great bag, be it for school, work or play can use this and it is a great choice. The internal yellow compartments can be configured as desired or removed completely leaving you with room for whatever you need.Incredibly well constructed, this bag's price belies the quality here. Real cowhide leather, button buckles and you have a perfect gift for yourself or loved one.You really need a sturdy bag to protect your expensive electronics and with this you get it... And you also get. Dr. Jones styling to go with it. Recommended.

I was lucky enough to grab this during one of amazon's freebie sales but didn't know too much about it.I was very surprised by the quality of this one. Great atmosphere, interesting story and good combination of exploration, puzzle solving and hidden objects. I love the fact that this is a self contained game. No waiting for things to refill like Freenium rubbish or badgering your friends on Facebook. Nothing is insurmountable thanks to the in built hint system and I was never too stuck to the point of giving up.This is old school myst style gaming and it's a dying business model on cellphones and one I supported by buying the sequel. Great stuff.

I received three different colored cases on Amazon Vine for my Galaxy S6. Aside from color differences I can't discern any difference.Otterbox make some great cellphone cases. I remember when I first saw their tank defender or whatever it was called, a friend had it clad over his original iPhone 4. It turned it into a brick but it had a true Perspex screen overlay which still had touchscreen capability, was waterproof and he had even accidentally dropped it from his worksite over thirty feet - his phone was intact.However as phones got bigger but slimmer, people no longer wanted to clip their bulky phone to their belts, choosing instead for somewhat less protection in the shape of slimmer cases so they can still slip them in their pockets. Otterbox responded by making more streamlined cases at the expense of protection ultimately coming down to this case.And frankly I'm underwhelmed. Not because it doesn't do what is advertised - it has a nice softer case with sturdy skeleton, great honeycomb design and clearly has been well researched and constructed. I've no doubt that this is probably the best minimalist protection for your galaxy S6 currently available.No I'm underwhelmed because otterbox are asking a premium amount for a minimal product. I just can't justify the cost to the consumer versus the cost of manufacture.Sure it's got the name, it has the protection (as best you can get for a thin shroud)... it just feels cheap and I feel therefore it should be. At least less than the current price point. Keep that in mind when ordering.

I recently received a cover for my big green egg and loved it, so when I was offered one for my patio heater I jumped at it too.This StorageSaver system includes a sack for easy storage, useful since mostly I will have it on the unneeded heater during the unused summer months But as we approach October I will be placing it on and off quite a bit so it's nice to have a bag to store it in to protect *it* as it sits outside when unused.The weather-resistant fabric feels like thick tent material but the whole thing folds up to form a bundle not much bigger than a thick phone book and when in place it forms a shroud that protects whilst looking nice. The vents prevent moisture build up - essential you don't have that and the handles allow for quick removal. The vents also aid in wind just passing through and not turning this into a zeppelin during windy days.In all this is a highly recommended way of protecting your patio heater investment, one that's been well thought out and works and looks great.

Occasional gofer here but a very, very poor one. I have no real idea which club should be used despite years video game golf playing so any device that can aid my game is welcome.Out of the box this is much smaller than I was expecting. On my wrist it's positively tiny but that's not a complaint as it's practically weightless and unobtrusive - important for your swing not to be bothered by an electronic device.It recognized my course which with so many courses available wasn't surprising. Once on my way I set it to 'golf' and teed off. I did notice due to the landscape layout of the display I preferred wearing it upside down so I turned my hand up to read it. Ideally the display would need to be rotated 90 degrees to work best when worn as a traditional watch but I understand that might bulk it up to the point of being uncomfortable.Sadly I felt the user interface is what lets this device down. Lots of button presses and fiddling to glean the smallest amount of data. Why could the display itself be a button. Swipe interface to get the most pertinent info with least effort. Getting just the distance shot requires multiple presses and that's just not acceptable. Once a device takes more time to use than traditional methods then it's not serving its purpose in my opinion.Don't get me wrong. This does do what is claimed - front, centre, back to hole, pedometer, time played, distance etc all available and seemingly very accurate. Battery life is great and the display, although crude, is very clear despite some weird hieroglyphics that pop up requiring a visit to the manual from time to time. So I am giving it a reluctant four stars.  I just feel that with a cleaner e ink display and swipe touch interface this would be a worthy five star item and a hole in one. Recommended with caveats.

This Dell U2415 1920 x 1200 LED monitor with non-glare screen and very thin bezel is an excellent choice for nearly any use, Mac or Windows.The pixel density and size is the same as the discontinued Apple 24" LED Cinema display.  Compared to that display, and the 27" Apple LED Cinema that I have adjacent to the U2415, I actually prefer the Dell for these reasons (and granted that Apple has not updated their displays in about 3 years):1.  The color gamut feels equal.  Images and pages look better.2.  The non-glare coating is amazing.  It is not so dramatic that it detracts from crispness or affects colors.3.  There is less eye strain from the LED backlight.  I don't know if this is due to the technology in the Apple display vs the Dell, but the same image that strains my eyes from glare on the Apple LED display is relaxing at a matched brightness on the Dell.  Pretty much everything on the Dell is easier on my eyes.4.  The pixel density - pixels per inch - while the same as the discontinued 24" Apple LED Cinema display, is greater than that of the 27" Apple display.  For my over-60 eyes, I find the larger text on the Dell much easier to read.5.  USB 3.  Apple displays still have only USB 2 ports.  Ridiculous.  The Dell includes the device cable to enable these 5 ports.6.  DisplayPort and Mini DisplayPort.  Both connections are on the back of the U2415.  The included miniDP to DP cable can be used by Mac people by connecting the DP end to the U2415 and the miniDP to their Mac.  For PC people, the opposite may be required depending on your graphics adapter.7.  HDMI x 2 works for input for some PC's, and of course for video sources including mirroring iPads/iPhones (via Apple's lightning to HDMI adapter).  Because of the 1200 pixel height (16:10 screen vs 16:9 HD content), HD video content will have black bars at the top and bottom.Note that the Dell U2415 does NOT include speakers, a microphone, or a camera, three features present on Apple monitors.  There is a speaker-out jack for audio arriving via HDMI and mounting slots for the optional Dell soundbar.The steel gray finish on the plastic stand does not match aluminum, but is close enough to look decent with a Mac.The thin bezel makes the monitor almost disappear and makes it ideal for multi-monitor situations.I was looking at some cheap President's Day sale monitors and quickly moved up to this monitor for the features above, as well as my requirement that the monitor stand be fully adjustable with height, tilt and swivel to align it with my other monitor.  I don't need to view things in portrait mode - although the U2415 worked beautifully while reading the local newspaper at near real-life size - but it's nice that the stand also supports rotation if I ever find a regular need for portrait orientation.I should note that the monitor was fine, but too bright out-of-the-box with Brightness and Contrast both at 75%.  I used System Preferences > Displays > Color > Calibrate to adjust the monitor for my display adapter and environment, and currently have Brightness at 52% and Contrast at 90%.Finally, just to be sure I don't sound like an idiot, my comparison to the 27" Apple LED Cinema display is based on everything other than gross size and total pixels.  Of course that 27" monitor has vastly more real estate and isn't at all an apples to apples comparison like the 24" Apple LED Cinema.Highly recommended.

These easy to install replacement bulbs significantly improve night driving with our 2003 Chevy Suburban.  The stock bulbs provided a somewhat short, dim, yellowish view of the road ahead in our rural area where we typically drive without any streetlights or other illumination.  Brighter and whiter, these bulbs throw at least double the distance.  It does not match our newer vehicles, but is sufficiently better that we can drive knowing that we'll see animals entering the road and other night obstructions with adequate time to react.Our headlight lenses had previously been buffed/polished to increase transparency on their aged surfaces, which is also important for getting the best results if your vehicle is old like ours.My wife is delighted with the improved visibility.I'll update this review if the bulbs fail to last at least a year - as durability seems to be the primary weakness of these bulbs.

Avoid this OXO egg beater, as it does not last.  As others have reported, the white plastic clips that hold the beaters in place disintegrate with age.  After a year and a half, ours is going in the trash as it cannot be repaired and isn't recyclable.  The white plastic clips become brittle with age and just broke off without any pressure on our part. The washable parts have only been hand washed, even though the instructions say it is dishwasher-safe.  So, dishwasher heat and agitation has nothing to do with this material degradation.If you see one in person, you'll be tempted by the smooth and easy cranking and comfort in your hand.  Don't give in to the temptation to buy unless you're willing to accept a short lifetime of use.

Let me join the chorus of long-time customers who are absolutely furious with Intuit for downgrading the capabilities of TurboTax Deluxe so that it can no longer do what it has done for many years - including Schedules D  and C.  The product instead informs me that I require Home & Business (which I never needed before) and I must pay another $40.Look.  If you want to change product features, Intuit, that is your right.  But to give a lesser product the exact same name as a previous, more capable product is just Evil.  This is just clueless about the concept of serving your customers.If an airline rebranded their economy/coach seats as "Business Class", do you think people would complain if they bought what they thought was a larger, business class seat and found themselves in coach - and not even economy plus?If you ordered a pick-up truck and discovered that there was no truck bed because the manufacturer now considered that as non-standard equipment, would that feel right?Don't call this product "Deluxe" any longer.  It is "Simple".  The "Deluxe" brand has meant a particular set of features for more years than I can remember.Any other branded product includes MORE features as years go by.  I'm trying hard to think of another example of a product that, under the exact same name, has FEWER features.TT Deluxe 2014 uses the exact same graphics/interface ... including the photos of the same people who never seem to age. As far as can be seen, the only software development effort has been to cripple the product.I encourage everyone to seek out products from other manufacturers rather than reward Intuit for their deceitful and greedy behavior.  At this point, others have reported satisfactory results with H&R Block software which will import TT data.UPDATE 2/8/15:  Intuit CEO offers written and video apology and in-product free upgrades to Premier or Home & Business, whichever is required:https://ttlc.intuit.com/questions/2628346-intuit-ceo-announces-free-in-product-upgrades-for-previous-deluxe-users

The Diono Olympia looks like a good option for babies with a long life as it became a booster in older years.  It does not offer the extra infant cushions that the Rainier model comes with.  After working with this seat for hours in two vehicles, and having other parents compare it with their models, I cannot recommend this seat at all.The Olympia is heavy (27 pounds); consider it for semi-permanent use in a vehicle, not for moving between vehicles regularly.  It's no fun to carry even short distances.It's insanely complicated to perform the various attachment possibilities.  Adjustments are not well thought out at all in my opinion.  The harness buckle in the seat comes installed in the position for an older child.  Moving the buckle to another slot requires access through a path that does not work at all for larger hands.  Installing through the cover actually requires partially removing the cover to get the buckle through the slot in the foam which does not align with the fabric.My relatives who have had several children found the entire set-up overly complex compared with competing products, and found very little side cushioning and side impact protection compared to the products they had used.  Their children who are now  all under 7 years old and well below the 57" height and 120 pound max requirements for booster mode were unable to fit in the seat at all.  It is too narrow for the younger ones... and an older one who is only 51" tall could not fit because of the width of his shoulders.  Even in the product photos on Amazon, you can see the young girl has her shoulders curved forwards to fit.  Simply too narrow overall.In rear-facing position, the seat barely fit in our large SUV, a Suburban.  The top of the Rainier rested on the back of the driver's seat.  The angle of the Olympia was too step for a baby who has not yet developed head control, even on the essentially flat Suburban seat with the Olympia rear-facing base attached.  The seat would not fit at all in my Subaru Outback.  Just too tall for rear-facing mode.Finally, upon opening the box containing the Olympia, a strong chemical smell was noticed.  It off-gased within a day, but it made me look for any information on what materials were used in the construction of the product and I could find none.Our impression is that the seat is not suitable for either infants or young children and we cannot recommend it.

The Diono Rainier looks like a well-padded option for babies with a long life as it became a booster in older years.  That's why I requested one for review.  After working with this seat for hours in two vehicles, and having other parents compare it with their models, I cannot recommend this seat at all.The Ranier is heavy (27 pounds); consider it for semi-permanent use in a vehicle, not for moving between vehicles regularly.  It's no fun to carry even short distances.It's insanely complicated to perform the various attachment possibilities.  Adjustments are not well thought out at all in my opinion.  The harness buckle in the seat comes installed in the position for an older child.  Moving the buckle to another slot requires access through a path that does not work at all for larger hands.  Installing through the cover actually requires partially removing the cover to get the buckle through the slot in the foam which does not align with the fabric.  Completely missing from the instructions for the "toddler body support" cushion is that the buckle must be removed and re-inserted through the cushion.  Would have been simple for them to make the cushion slots wide enough to push over the buckle - so that it can be quickly removed and reinstalled for washing.** Note that the seat cannot be folded if the cushion is installed... requiring the challenging process of removing the buckle - removing the cushion (which then has to be carried separately), etc.  Very poorly designed.My relatives who have had several children found the entire set-up overly complex compared with competing products, and found very little side cushioning and side impact protection compared to the products they had used.  Their children who are now  all under 7 years old and well below the 57" height and 120 pound max requirements for booster mode were unable to fit in the seat at all.  It is too narrow for the younger ones... and an older one who is only 51" tall could not fit his shoulders between the non-removable headrest pads.In rear-facing position, the seat barely fit in our large SUV, a Suburban.  The top of the Rainier rested on the back of the driver's seat.  The angle of the Ranier was too step for a baby, even on the essentially flat Suburban seat with the Ranier rear-facing base attached.  The seat would not fit at all in my Subaru Outback.  Just too tall for rear-facing mode.Finally, upon opening the box containing the Ranier, a strong chemical smell was noticed.  It off-gased within a day, but it made me look for any information on what materials were used in the construction of the product and I could find none.Our impression is that the seat is not suitable for either infants or young children and we cannot recommend it.

These Westcott Titanium 8" scissors cut paper or fabric easily and cleanly, even at the tips.I'm a guy that wears XL gloves... due to the length of my fingers rather than their girth.  Whichever 3 fingers I use in the wider opening, the fit is a bit tight.  For a typical guy with genuinely large fingers, only two fingers would fit.The finger grips are beveled asymmetrically for a right-handed person.  This did not bother my left-handed wife who has a small hand.  When I try them in my left hand, they are distinctly uncomfortable in comparison to the fit on my right.  Lefties with larger hands will prefer one of the many scissors that have no bevel, and thus work for left or right handed people... or a pair designed for lefties.Recommended without reservation for righties with small to medium hands.

This A&D UA-651BLE battery-powered blood pressure monitor is compact, portable and seems accurate.It can be used stand-alone, so don't feel that you must have a smart phone or tablet to use this.  There is a 6V external power plug in the back, but an adapter is not included.
