I was provided this 18 x 12 Bar Service Mat by Shacke to review and am quite impressed with it. It is thicker and heavier than I thought it would be. It is made of a heavy duty rubber that stays in place on the bar top, counter, table, or anywhere else you place it.This can be used for a variety of ways besides a bar counter. It makes a good setting for a coffee carafe and cups too. Juices for the table, etc.It is made so if you spill some, it collects in the mat rather than running off. It holds quite a bit for those small spills while pouring and so on. You can have a number of them without liquid running over the sides of the mat onto your protected surface.It is easy to clean (wash when you get it to help with the new rubber smell). Very nice mat, I appreciate receiving to review.

We were provided a sample cutting board to review and find it to be a good addition to the kitchen. We have tried a number of silicone kitchen products and are impressed with the versatility of this material.Did not read the e-book, so can't comment on it.The first thing you notice about this board is the bright green color. While my wife likes a lot of red kitchen things, she liked this green too.One of the most unique things about this cutting board made from silicone as compared to our other wooden and other hard material made boards is that this one is flexible. This can make it easier pouring what you chop into a pan or bowl. It's also easy to clean, and seems like it will last quite some time.It comes with two silicone pastry brushes as a bonus. Not sure how much we'll use those, but the cutting board will get a lot of use.

I have a lot of flashlights from various price ranges, but admit that most are in the lower scale. This particular light, while expensive, is an outstanding light. While made for diving, it is an incredibly bright light that can serve many purposes. I received this Phantom Aquatics Impulse 1500 through the Vine Program to review, and it is quite impressive.It is a solid, well built, albeit heavy, flashlight. It is very sturdy, and as a diving light, obviously also water tight. The flashlight comes with a carrying case that will allow you to take this flashlight anywhere with you, or store away without worry that it or the accessories will be damaged. (As if you could damage this light, it is tough.) Inside the case, besides the light you have two lithium ion batteries, that are much larger than those that come with many of the smaller aluminum type flashlights. Charger for the batteries and cord also included. There is also a wrist strap to attach to the flashlight, and a nylon/Velcro strap holder that you can attack the light to the back of your hand. (Think a kind of wrist strap that gives your wrist support, but with a Velcro strap on top to secure the light. With it attached to the back of your hand you can essentially use both hands for other things under water.) There are also a couple of extra rubber O rings included, which may be necessary as the one difficulty I had was ensuring this ring stayed in place when I put it back together after inserting batteries.There is a magnetic push button switch on the side near the light lens that cycles through three different levels of light. The brightest is 1500 lumens and is bright. This is important for underwater, but also provides you an awesome bright light for other times when you need something bright.As a home security light, turning this on and shining it into an intruder's eyes will definitely stop him for a moment, if not blind him for quite a bit longer. It also lights everything up very well if you need light in an emergency. What you do have to be careful of is pointing it into a family member's eyes.I wanted this light for a super bright home emergency light rather than diving, but my daughter and I are also using it with our masks and snorkels, so it is cool for that too. It will also be with us on any trips.If you are looking for a diving flashlight, a bright flashlight for home emergencies, or extreme outdoor conditions, this Impulse 1500 from Phantom Aquatics is an awesome choice if you don't mind the higher price tag.

Having both a military and business background, this book really resonated with me. In fact, First Fast Fearless: How To Lead Like a Navy SEAL by Brian Iron Ed Hiner was one of the most enjoyable leadership books I've read in a long time. Enjoyable to read because of the interesting stories Hiner shared from his time as a SEAL, and enjoyable for the rich content and leadership advice he imparts to his readers.The book does an excellent job of taking military SEAL leadership concepts and adapting them to what Hiner even calls the real world or more accurately, the world of civilians. (I happen to agree that military life, while different, and during war  very different, is very real) Hiner is far from an academic in some ivory tower when it comes to leadership. He writes about what has worked for some of the most highly trained warriors in history, and even goes as far as pointing out what even the SEALs could do better in a a few situations. His voice and experiences should be listened to.First Fast Fearless, despite the title, is hardly a book of clich hoorah and kill em all and let God sort em out maxims. It's a true book of leadership principles that can and should be applied by anyone in a leadership position, regardless the setting. He describes what leadership truly is, the essence of brotherhood and why it's important to leadership, and the concept of battle rhythm and leading. These leadership principles are woven around the concept that leadership must be able to deal with VUCA (Volatility, Uncertainty, Chaos, and Ambiguity). This makes sense, because it is in times of stress and difficulty that leadership is most important.When I served, I had some outstanding leaders, and some that didn't quite measure up. I would have liked serving under Hiner, as he knows what it takes to lead effectively. He also knows what it takes to train and develop successful leaders, and if you follow his guidance as set forth in this book, you will join the ranks of those successful leaders. Regardless of the organization you belong to, or how many you lead, this book's advice on leadership will help you become the leader you desire to be.

I was provided this 6.5 foot USB Cable for my iPhone 6 plus to review by Amroke, and after using it, I can say it is a very good cable and the extra length makes it convenient for certain situations and places.It is a basic white cable that is Apple MFI certified. I have only used it for my iPhone, and for that is has worked just like it is supposed to.If you are looking for a long Lightning to USB cable for your Apple products, I can easily recommend this one. Works great.

I was sent one of these earbuds free to review from the seller. So far, it is working just fine and it is a nice little discreet earbud to listen to your bluetooth device.The sound is okay. Not as good as some earphones, but good enough. I'm not super picky with earbuds and earphones, and if you are, you may not like these.At first, I wasn't sure if they were working. When you hold the button to turn on, you hear it say powering on. Don't let up the button yet. You have to keep pressing the button until it says pairing and then select S530 on you device to connect. Once I held the button in long enough, it paired with my iPhone 6 plus with no problems.This is just ONE earbud, which for certain situations is better. I like that I can here in one ear, but my other is free to hear outside noises. For comfort it is okay. It stays in and feels fine. This bud is for listening only, not for talking too.The earbud is made in China, and the directions are not in the best English, but good enough to figure it out. For the price it is a decent little bluetooth earbud.

I was provided a black YAKAON case for my iPhone 6 plus for review. It's on my phone right now, and it is a nice case. The phone fits snugly and all of the cutouts are correct so everything functions. It is a good looking basic case of the type that the front of the phone is open, as opposed to the cases that close over the front too. (Portfolio type or wallet cases)The case seems solid and should protect the phone against drops. I don't know if it is tested to Military Specifics like my UAG case, but it does seem pretty solid. One thing I really like about this case is the flip out kickstand on the back. Using this kickstand you can set your phone both vertically or horizontally on the desk for easy viewing.Nice case for the iPhone 6 plus, especially at the price.

I was provided this sensor soap dispenser from Ohuhu for a review, and we find it a nice little dispenser, but I still can't get over feeling I'm at a public restroom when using it. There is also the fact that you have to use batteries (4 AA batteries which are not included), when the old pump style works just fine. I also found it funny in the description that it says you don't have to worry about your hands coming in contact with anything harmful. In a public bathroom, yes. In our house, I sure hope not.Despite that, this is a nice little unit that is attractive and that will go with many kitchens or bathrooms. You can load it with any kind of liquid soap, and and it dispenses it just as it is supposed to.Here is one thing you must be careful of, especially if you have kids. This is used around the sinks, and it can't be submerged. Remember, it has batteries and electronics in it. The directions say to not wash this with water, but to wipe clean with a damp cloth. So it might not be the best item near a sink if you have young kids.Bottom line: Nice electronic soap dispenser that works as it should.

As you can see from the pictures, this isn't really a vest. It is, rather, a set of suspenders made from the same bright yellow with reflective strips that road vests are made from. I was provided a free one to review, and for a simple set of suspenders that reflect, it would be good to wear while riding or running in the dark.It is not the same as the safety vests I wear when working security and traffic details, and it would not suffice for those positions. Those have much greater visibility as they are full vests, not just a set of suspenders.With that said, this little reflective suspender set from Ohuhu is a good option if you just want something easy to wear that has a good reflective surface for casual wear when running or biking at night. (You should also have a light and reflectors on your bike, so this is just a little extra for added visibility.)Not bad for added visibility in daylight or in the dark.

I was provided a coupon code to get one of these for review, and I find it to be a nice little protective covering for a GoPro camera. While the case on the GoPro is tough and protects the actual camera, this is a nice little case to wrap around the entire thing and then toss into any bag you might have.It is sort of different than most cases in that you have to wrap it around your camera, rather than a normal case that you slip the camera into and then close a flap.  This is a little more work as you have to fold over each side. I think I prefer regular cases that you just slip your item into.The case comes with a wrist strap and works well for wrapping up your GoPro to take along without any of the other accessories. (Of if you have the accessories in a different case or container.)Good if you want a swaddle case for your GoPro camera.

My wife and I take CoQ10 supplements regularly and feel they are an important part of our supplements and diet. We were provided these from PaccificCoast NitriLabs to review, and find them to be a quality, easy to take, CoQ10 supplement.The are a soft gel like many CoQ10 supplements, and contain 100mg coenzyme ubiquinone per 1 capsule.It is actually pretty difficult to evaluate many supplements as they don't really make you feel different, etc. However, they are helping you inside. And that is why we take CoQ10 supplements, and have no problem recommending this brand from PCNL.

My wife and I take Fish Oil supplements regularly and feel they are an important part of our supplements and diet. We were provided these from PaccificCoast NitriLabs to review, and find them to be a quality, easy to take, fish oil supplement.The are a soft gel like most fish oil supplements, and contain 2000mg fish oil per 2 capsules.It is actually pretty difficult to evaluate many supplements as they don't really make you feel different, etc. However, they are helping you inside. And that is why we take fish oil supplements, and have no problem recommending this brand of Fish Oil from PCNL.

I was provided this Sports Armband by URPOWER to review and find it to be a nice little arm bag, but it doesn't fit larger arms that well. If I put it on my upper arm, it is hard to get it on, and is a bit tight. For people with smaller arms, you could wear it more easily.With that out of the way, the rest of this product is very nice. There are two compartments that both zip closed, and they hold a fair amount of smaller items. Small camera, phone, keys, wallet, money, etc.If I was going to wear it, I'd have to wear it on my forearm or wrist, but my wife or daughter could wear in on their upper arm. However, you could also fix this to something else. You could attach it to a back pack, to a bike, a stroller, etc.It's a good little zippered bag for wearing on your arm or attaching someplace else. But if you have a larger arm, it's not going to fit like in the pictures.

This is a very simple strap to wear around the leg under the knee cap to provide support to the knee. It is secured by Velcro that holds well. I was provided a strap for review by the manufacturer and find it to be a good strap for what it is. It doesn't provide the support that a more full complete knee wrap provides (You have seen those sleeves with the hole at the knee cap), and it definitely isn't for those who need a knee brace. (You have see those too, with the metal or plastic bars down the side).This is a simple little strap that is comfortable and provides just a little support under the kneecap. It isn't very wide and the Velcro is strong, so it can be worn pretty easily. My wife is actually using this right now on her morning walks as one of her knees was bothering her a bit. This seems to help, as she didn't need the larger sleeve or brace.If you need support right under the knee cap, this strap fits the bill nicely. If you need additional or different support, you will need to try another type of product.This is very good for the kind of strap it is.

I was provided this wrist wrap by the manufacturer for a review and find it to be a nice simple wrap to support the wrist. It is a Neoprene wrap that has a loop for the thumb and Velcro to secure it to your wrist.The Velcro holds well and allows you to make it as tight as you prefer. It provides decent support for this kind of wrap, and is useful for any activities where you need extra support for your wrist without the ridged immobilizing support of larger wrist braces.You can still do anything you want to do with this support on, and it can be worn on either hand.Nice simple wrist support.

We were sent a set of these travel bottles to review from Home Inspira and find them to be a nice set of convenient bottles for traveling with your shampoo/conditioner/bodywash/lotion or similar items.They are 1.25 oz each, so you can take them aboard an aircraft in your carry on. They are made from silicone, so the are soft and pliable, and they don't leak. The big top comes off to fill them, and then the cap flips open so you can squeeze an amount out. As an added feature, the bottles have a little suction cup on them so you can hang them on the shower wall. (yes, they hang on tile and other smooth shower walls just fine.) They also come in three different colors to help you keep track of which is which.Bottom line: Good little set of travel bottles for your toiletries.

This little mini Bluetooth speaker and selfie camera control by Mengo is a nice little addition for your cell phone or other Bluetooth device. I was provided one for review by Mego and it works just like is is supposed to. It connected to my iPhone without any trouble at all. (It announces when it connects and disconnects.) It also has a ring to attach it to a key chain, hang it, etc. (USB charging cable also included.)It is very small, as you can see from the speaker, and as such, it is not loud. It is loud enough, and I am quite pleased with it when sitting beside me on the desk. But my iPhone 6 plus is louder than this speaker. The nice thing is you can place it in a different area.The selfie button works well too. This allows you to use this little device as a remote control for your camera. Pretty simple, just activate it and press the bottom to snap pictures.This is a nice little Bluetooth speaker and camera remote.

Jumping rope is not only good for you, but can be a lot of fun too. My daughter enjoys to jump, and does the Jump Rope For Heart fundraiser each year. I was provided this jump rope for review, and like it. As I have other jump ropes for me, this one went to my daughter. She likes it too.It is a long rope that you can easily adjust, and it also has a counter in the handle that counts your rotations. It is made of a type of rubber foam and is very comfortable to jump with. We were also provided a similar rope to review that doesn't have a counter in the handle. Both ropes are very nice, and the only deciding factor between them is if you want a counter or not.Personally, I prefer my black heavier ropes for my jumping, but for my daughter, this is a great rope and she really likes it. I think she likes the one with the counter more than the one without as she likes to see how many times she jumped. Recommended for anyone wanting a jump rope for their kids.

Jumping rope is not only good for you, but can be a lot of fun too. My daughter enjoys to jump, and does the Jump Rope For Heart fundraiser each year. I was provided this jump rope for review, and like it. As I have other jump ropes for me, this one went to my daughter. She likes it too.It is a very long rope, and you have to adjust it. Once you do this, which is not that hard, the rope works well and is a good rope with comfortable handles. It is made of a type of rubber foam. We were also provided a similar rope to review that has a counter in the handle. Both ropes are very nice, and the only deciding factor between them is if you want a counter or not.Personally, I prefer my black heavier ropes for my jumping, but for my daughter, this is a great rope and she really likes it.

The Pomarks Datafortress USB High Speed Flash Drive is a great way to store or transfer your data. The 3.0 USB makes transfers fast, and the small size makes it a convenient way to store data and take it with you.I had some large video files to share with friends of our daughters' play, and this was an easy way to take the files to their home and let them transfer to their computer to watch the video.There are a lot of cloud storage options, but sometimes it is nice to have it with you, especially for larger files. This High Speed flash drive makes it very easy to store and transfer data which could be video, pictures, music, documents or anything else saved electronically.I was provided a 32 GB drive to review and found it to be a great flash drive Highly recommended!

I liked the advertising copy saying, life is too short to wear cheap underwear. It made me chuckle. So when asked to review these, I said sure. I was sent a black and gray pair, and after wearing them, I can definitely say they are very comfortable and receive top scores for quality, style and comfort.There really isn't a lot to say. They are very comfortable. My wife's comments were they looked good and she liked them better than some of the others I'd been wearing.So, comfort and style, what more could you ask for in a pair of trunks.Bottom line: Great pair of underwear. Highly recommended!

Scaling Force: dynamic decision-making under threat of violence with Rory Miller and Lawrence Kane is an excellent DVD to include in a self-defense library as it covers an area that is often neglected when people focus solely on physical techniques. This program explains and demonstrates options to violence and complements the authors' book of the same title.The video starts out with Miller explaining a situation in a bar setting, and then going right into the introduction of the programIn the Introduction, Miller discusses his three golden rules which the most important is going home at the end of the day. He also mentions that Kane couldn't make it to the filming and that his segments would be cut in later. It is noticeable that Kane's segments were filmed separately, but his contributions do add substance to the program, even though not as professionally filmed. He shares stories and concepts that allow you to learn from his experiences to apply to your own.The next thing discussed is Risk Assessment. In this section, Miller discusses threat assessment and how to trust instincts. He shares some things to look for that can  telegraph violence. A key here is that the higher the danger, the more force needed. This section then goes into a  section about Adrenaline, and gross motor movements.The DVD then discusses the six levels which are: Level 1. Presence; Level 2. Voice; Level 3. Touch; Level 4. Empty-hand Restraint; Level 5. Less-lethal Force; and Level 6. Lethal Force.After the six levels, some practical advice on fighting out of a crowd is presented, and then the concept of articulation and being able to tell what happened and why you did what you did to the police are discussed. I like that it is pointed out that you should practice these too.Miller points out near the beginning that he and those helping are not professional actors, and he is not a super polished speaker on DVD. However, there is a lot of great information presented in this program, and one should not dismiss it because it isn't presented in a sexy manner and because the program isn't full of fancy martial art techniques. (The program isn't about techniques at all.) Spliced in among Miller's teaching in the bar setting are Kane's segments.This isn't an exciting video, but it is an important one. When faced with violence, it is important to know the scale of force, and to enter the scale at the right level and then be able to articulate why what you did was appropriate. If you are studying self-defense skills, you need to include the information presented in this DVD with your physical training. Not knowing this information could leave you hanging in the wind when law enforcement, attorneys, judges, and jury members are determining your fate later. I personally know of a case here in Montana where the individual now serving time would have benefited from knowing and heeding the material Miller and Kane present here.Bottom line: Add this DVD to your self-defense library, study it, and know how to make better decisions under the threat of violence.

This Mulbess iPhone 6 plus case is a nice little brown PU leather wallet or portfolio type case. It is an attractive coffee brown classic looking case. Very plain really, which is classy.I was provided a case for review and find that the phone fits just right and everything is accessible. You do have to flip the cover open to use the phone, and I like the extra protection the cover provides. The cover flap has slots for three credit cards, and a thin pocket that will hold paper money.While this does protect the phone, and looks nice, it is not as heavy duty as some of the other cases I have. If you are doing something where there is an opportunity for your phone to get banged around or dropped, you may want a different case for those activities and use this one for when you want an attractive simple case without the military spec drop protection.Overall, this is a really nice simple portfolio type case for your phone.

This is a very well made running belt to hold your phone, keys, money and any other small items while you run or exercise. I was provided one to review and am impressed with the quality and utility of the belt.As you can see from the pictures, there are three pockets. The two side pockets are smaller and suitable for keys, money, or anything else small. They both zip closed, and one side has a clip to hook your keys for extra security.The larger middle pocket unzips, and then there is a velcro flap inside to put your phone in the outside compartment so you can see and use the phone through the plastic pocket. You could then place something else that is thin in the compartment behind the phone if you wanted. The phone pocket is big enough for my iPhone 6 plus with a smaller case on it.There is a sweat proof lining inside the pockets to keep your items dry, and the entire belt is hand washable. It has an adjustable belt size that will fit waists from 27 to 47. The belt is elastic type material so you get a good snug fit so it doesn't move around when you are running or active.Overall, it is a very well made belt and fits the bill for anyone needing a belt to hold a phone and small items while running or doing any other activities.A bonus pair of lock laces came with the belt, but I have not tried these and can't comment on them. For those who need a pair of these, it is a nice bonus. As for the free running guide PDF ebook, it could use a lot of editing. I won't comment much more on it. I think the belt is worth 5 stars and does what it is designed to do, but not the e-book.Recommended for anyone looking for a running belt for their phone and small items.

There is not a lot to say about this set of DVD Storage Bags other than they are very handy, and a great way to store or transport your DVD collection. Each bags holds up to 40 DVDs (depending on the kind of case, sets, etc.) and zips shut to protect them. You can tuck them away in a closet, under a bed, or take them with you. They have a carrying handles that makes it very easy to take them with you. The clear vinyl allows you to see what DVDs are in the bag.Obviously, you could use these clear bags for other things, but they are just the right size for DVDs, and that makes them especially handy to keep your movie collection. I was provided a set of these DVD Storage Bags to review and find them to be very nice and useful. Recommended for anyone wanting to organize, store, or transport their DVDs.

I have always been into knives more than tomahawks, even though I did use my hatchet when camping as a boy quite a bit. I realize the usefulness of a tomahawk, both as a potential weapon, and a tool, so when offered this by Vine I eagerly accepted. I'm not disappointed in this Voodoo Hawk Mini by SOG at all. It is a nice addition to my arsenal and is small and versatile enough to be useful in different ways, including camping and the potential zombie apocalypse that The Walking Dead foreshadows.This SOG Voodoo Hawk Mini is a combination of SOG's tactical Tomahawk and FastHawk. It is smaller and lighter version made for backpackers, hikers, hunters and paddlers. It has a glass-reinfored nylon handle, extended cutting head, spike for piercing, and a metal pommel cap. It comes with a top loading synthetic nylon sheath for belt carry.I like SOG products for being durable at affordable prices, and I find this tomahawk fitting that description. Yes, it is made in China, but it is a decent tool at a reasonable price. It is small, and lightweight, so it is more suitable for smaller tasks. Great for getting kindling, but not as good if you needed to split larger wood or heavy duty chopping. It is a small tomahawk after all, not an ax. The metal pommel would be okay for pounding in tent stakes or similar tasks, but it isn't going to do what a good hammer would.The back spike has limited uses as well, but seems pretty strong for what it is. I think it would definitely sink into a zombie's brain if you were forced to fight them off with just this.I also like that SOG has a Lifetime Warranty. I'm not sure just what all this covers, but it is listed prominently on the packaging.The last thing I'll mention is that this tactical tool from the SOG line looks cool. I'm guessing some people will want one for that very reason, and that's okay. Because even though it is a tool, and not a toy, there is nothing wrong with a tool looking cool and tough, and this Voodoo Mini Hawk does look cool and tough. I like it, and it makes a good addition to my other bladed weapons.

I've always been one that liked to keep a hold of my weapons rather than throw them. With that said, I've enjoyed practicing throwing since I was young. I used to stick sharpened throwing stars in all sorts of things when younger, and I've practiced off and on with throwing knives throughout the years. While I'm nowhere near as good as some of those I've taken classes from, I find it an enjoyable thing to do with my other martial art training.I haven't thrown tomahawks, but have wanted to. Now, with this set of three throwing hawks from SOG, I'm learning and practicing a bit. SOG is a known company for affordable and durable tools, which includes many bladed items. I've liked the products I've purchased from them in the past, and I like this set of throwing hawks.The are solid steel with a paracord wrapped handle. One side has an ax head and the other a point. They are balanced for throwing, but that doesn't mean you don't have to practice to get it down. Besides throwing, it is a handy little tool for the woods. They are small and lightweight, but tough enough to do small tasks like getting kindling ready for a fire. They are a solid little hawk. They come with a bottom loading synthetic nylon sheath that holds all three for an upside down carry.I also like that SOG has a Lifetime Warranty. I'm not sure just what all this covers, but it is listed prominently on the packaging.I'm looking forward to practicing more with these because it is fun. I'll get out my copy of Michael Janich's Making It Stick and continue to practice. Recommend for anyone wanting to do the same.

I'm very impressed with the Zookki GoPro Accessory Kit. I was provided a kit to review and found these aftermarket accessories to be well made and great additions to your GoPro kit, allowing you to do more with your action camera.As you can see from reading the description, you get a lot of stuff in this package of accessories. The items that most people will most likely get this kit for are the chest strap, head strap, and suction cup mount. All of these work well with my camera the wearable ones are comfortable enough to wear. One thing you might notice is there is a slight odor to the straps and the pouch. I can't quite place the smell, but it is not that pleasant, so you will want to air out these items.The extendable monopod is one of the cheaper aluminum extension types, and I don't like these for my GoPro as much as the sturdier more solid poles with the clips on the sections. These poles are more expensive and I wouldn't expect them in a kit such as this at this price. This pole will definitely hold your GoPro or other small camera, but I wouldn't use it for any action or where you are moving a lot. I'd opt for a sturdier pole. For not moving around, this pole works fine.The other items in the kit are nice to have extras of. The mounts, screws, and adhesive pads are good to have. There is also a floating handle grip that will be useful when using in or around water. There is also a bike mount to attach to handle bars.Over all, you get an awful lot with this kit, so if you are looking for some well made affordable GoPro accessories, this kit is a good way to start. Recommended!

I was provided one of these alarm clocks to review and it is a very nice USB charged alarm clock. The one I received isn't square like the photo, but rather a longer rectangle shape.  Using the instruction book and the buttons on the back, it was pretty easy to set the time, date, and alarm.One thing I like is the top is touch rather than a button. So when you touch the top the light comes on so you can read it in the dark. (Note, there is a dimmer light that comes on when in total darkness to help you read it in the dark without turning on the light.) Touching the top is much easier than finding a button. This same feature activates the snooze. So you don't have to click a button off, but rather just touch the top of the clock to get the alarm to stop.It is battery powered that is charged with a USB cable. I'm not sure how many days it will go between charging, but it has a light that comes on to let you know to charge it. Using it at home, I can easily plug it into one of our computers, or a USB wall charger. On the go, you could charge it the same way or with a portable power bank.As an added feature, it is also a thermometer. Besides the date and time, it tells you the temperature of the room.For a basic alarm clock that is powered with a USB charging cable, this is a nice little clock.

I was sent a blue fan to review, and it is a nice little fan. At first, I was a bit worried as it didn't come on when I first plugged it into my laptop and turned it on. But then it did, and is working fine now.It is very quiet for a fan of this type, which I like, and for its size, it puts out a good little bit of air. There is only one speed, so it is on or off. You can't select a lessor or greater speed. It is powered by a USB cord, so you can plug it into your laptop as I have it plugged in right now, your computer, or any other USB charging device. This includes different power banks. I hooked it up to one of the power banks I have and it ran just fine. This means you can use this fan anywhere. (Yes, I know that there are small battery powered fans, but this is a bit nicer and the USB feature allows you more options and longer use than batteries.)Bottom line: This is a nice little USB powered fan.

How To Sell Books By The Truckload On Amazon by Penny C. Sansevieri is actually two short books by Sansevieri combined into one volume. This book contains How to Sell Books by the Truckload and How to Get More Reviews on Amazon. Both contain useful information for authors, and even combined the book isn't so big to make it daunting. Keeping the entire manual short and to the point allows it to be very user friendly.What I liked most about this book is that it isn't one of those work the system to almost scamming type programs you see floating around. Someone wants to show you how to make a lot of money by doing things that aren't quite honest. Sansevieri isn't like that. She shares honest, workable strategies to sell more books and get more reviews, but they do take work.If you are new to amazon, or just want to understand how amazon works a bit better this is a good introductory book. It explains easily what you can do to sell more on this giant website. It then goes into detail on how you can ethically get reviews for your book. This takes some work too, but will be worth it.As an author myself, I plan to use this guide to help me with what I'm doing on amazon. It's a book I'd recommend to anyone wanting to do the same, especially beginners.

I don't really try to compare Greaney with Clancy. They worked together, and now Greaney is carrying on the series and writing excellent novels with characters I've enjoyed for years. Sure, they are not the same as Clancy's earlier works, and it is hard to say how much Clancy did on the collaborations before he died. But I still greatly enjoy these stories, and I like the writing style of Greaney too. With this newest novel, Full Force And Effect, I thoroughly enjoyed it and could have gone on for another 600 pages. There were plot twists, suspenseful action, and a tense assassination attempt that had me on the edge of my seat as I turned pages.The plot of this novel involves a lot regarding North Korea, and as I've lived in South Korea, this aspect of the story really interested me. As with most of this series, the action takes place globally and there is a lot going on, all interconnected and done in a way to keep you turning pages.President Jack Ryan, along with campus members Jack Jr., Sam, Dom, John Clark and Chavez are present and featured doing what they do best. It was a fun read that I enjoyed a lot. Looking forward to the next one.

I was sent this Ambielly Universal Waterproof Pouch to provide a review and I find it to be a nice waterproof bag for your phone or other small valuables. Note, this is a waterproof bag, not really a protective case. The good thing is that it is large enough to put your phone with a protective case on it inside. It is orange, which my daughter really likes, so this one will be used by her.I did do what the instructions recommended and put in a piece of paper and submerged the case in a sink of water for a while. The paper was completely dry when I took it out, so it passed the waterproof test. As long as I have one of my slimmer iPhone 6 plus cases on the phone, it slips into this case very easily. I liked that you didn't have to force it in or out. And I liked that it would hold the phone and a case for added protection.You can still use the features of the phone when it is in the case.It comes with a lanyard that attaches to the top that I like. You can wear it around your neck if you want, which is an easy way to keep it when using this case.The pouch can be punctured, so be careful and don't put anything sharp in it, and I'd add to keep it away from sharp objects or it could be easily punctured by those as well. You also can't use it in hot springs or it could melt.This is a handy little waterproof bag for phones or small items.

I was sent one of these to review and it turns out to be a cool little recording device. It looks like, and is the size of a flash drive. When you take off the cap, it goes into the computer just like any other flash drive. It holds 8GB.The unique thing about this is besides being a flash drive, it is also a voice recorder. There is a small button on the side that you switch on. When you do this, a red light comes on for a couple of seconds, and then blinks three times and goes off. When it goes off after blinking, the device is recording. It will record until you switch it off, and the red light will flash before going off.When you plug the device in, there will be a folder named record. Your audio file will be in this folder and just play it with any audio file player. Worked just like it was supposed to do. It picked up my voice fine sitting by the computer in front of me, and holding it out at arms length while talking. It also picked up the television set across the room.The little instruction sheet says it can record for up to 13 hours on a full charge. I have not timed to see what kind of batter life you can get, or how long it will record to fill the 8GB.After the three red flashes, there is no indicator that it is recording, thus the spy feature in the description. While the descriptions suggest that this is a way to record when someone doesn't want to be recorded, I would caution people that this could get you in trouble. So be careful what you record with this discreet little recorder.The device works like it is supposed to, and I am impressed with it.

Many crimes are crimes of opportunity, and this is especially true with theft. It's not that a small lock like this can't be broken into, it's that this little lock makes is more difficult to quickly get into a bag or a locker, and thus it takes away the easy opportunity. A thief will most often look for something easier, as in not locked and out in the open. So having a lock such as this on your bag, or on your locker at the gym, is a good idea and can prevent your belongings from being stolen. Again, it is not that this lock can't be defeated if someone really wants in, but by making your item a harder target than something with no lock, thieves looking for targets of opportunity may just pass it by.This is a TSA lock, which means there is a key hole on the bottom that the TSA can quickly open it up and check inside your bag if they wish. The alternative is have them cut it off or delay you in getting your bag.It is a simple 3 number combination lock that you can change the combination easily and whenever you want. I was provided this lock free for review purposes and I find that it is just as advertised. For a luggage, or locker, combination padlock, this is a nice little lock. It does exactly what it is supposed to do.

We were sent a set of these travel bottles to review and find them to be a nice set of convenient bottles for traveling with your shampoo/conditioner/bodywash/lotion or similar items.They are 1.25 oz each, so you can take them aboard an aircraft in your carry on. They are made from silicone, so the are soft and pliable, and they don't leak. The big top comes off to fill them, and then the cap flips open so you can squeeze an amount out. As an added feature, the bottles have a little suction cup on them so you can hang them on the shower wall. (yes, they hang on tile and other smooth shower walls just fine.) They also come in three different colors to help you keep track of which is which.Bottom line: Good little set of travel bottles for your toiletries.

There are many variations of selfie sticks or monopods on the market these days. I was sent this stick by Mudder to review and find it to fit with the standard aluminum collapsible sticks. I prefer the black sticks made of different material with the clips that secure. These are usually bigger and sturdier, but also cost more. Those are also better for GoPro type cameras as well as cell phones.For a cell phone and casual use of taking selfies, this is a nice stick. It is light weight and definitely sturdy enough at full extension to take selfies. (Note, it is a bit wobbly at full extension, so this isn't a stick to be rough with. But with normal use, it works. Just don't be rough with it.) Many have a bluetooth feature, but this one actually has a cable to put into the earphone jack of your phone that is attached to the button on the handle.  The nice thing about this is that you don't have to charge the bluetooth and worry about it connecting. This connected to my iPhone and worked just like it was supposed to.This stick comes with a cell phone holder, but you can also use any of the others on the market. You can also attach any small, and I mean small, camera with the standard sized screw on the end.This is a good little selfie stick of this type.

We were sent this Vintage PU Leather Backpack to review and are impressed. It is a very nice backpack for use around town or college. It's not a hiking backpack or one for the woods, but rather an attractive pack that my wife likes for taking things to work.As you can see from the pictures, it has a nice shiny black leather look with no outside markings. There are two larger compartments, and one pocket on the front. All zip closed. The largest compartment has a sleeve that will hold a laptop as well as a couple of small pockets. (one that zips closed) This pack doesn't have the padding that some computer backpacks have, but for going to and from work or class, it would be fine.There is a top handle, as well as shoulder straps that are comfortable for short trips of wearing. That pack is spacious and holds quite a bit.If you are looking for an attractive black leather backpack, look no longer. This is a very nice pack.

This is a very nice Waist Money Belt that will hold a passport and similar items in the larger zippered pocket, and cash, tickets, or credit cards in the smaller zippered pocket. The larger pocket even holds my iPhone 6 plus.I was provided one of these for a review and I really like it. It is a lightweight nylon, with zippers that function fine. It is comfortable to wear and allows you to keep valuables hidden under your shirt or waist band of pants. The strap is adjustable and fits securely and the pouch is soft on the inside and doesn't bother you when worn against the skin.Bottom line: This is a great money belt to keep your passport and valuable secure.

I was provided a Sports Waist Pack by URPOWER for a review, and I find it to be a nice waist pack for those wishing to wear something around their waist to carry small items while exercising, hiking, etc. Please Note, if you have an iPhone 6 plus or other similar sized phone, it will not fit in this pouch. It will hold a small phone, and there is a hole that your earbuds can come out of to listen to it, but it will not hold larger phones.The two water bottle holders, are also small. While the picture has two small bottles in them for illustration purposes, I don't have any small bottles that will fit, so have not really used these. I'm wondering if those tubes of energy gel would fit in the water bottle holders. If so, that would be good for exercising.The construction is fine, and it seems like it will hold up well. It is comfortable to wear. It is a good waist pack if you have a smaller phone, but if you have a larger one, it won't work.

Want to decorate windows or advertise daily specials? These Chalk Markers by Colore are great for writing on windows, erasable boards, and many other surfaces. My daughter loves them for our windows and we like that they are easily cleaned off.We were provided a set of these for review and find them to be an excellent set of chalk markers. Your creativity and artistic ability are the only limitations for these markers.Excellent chalk markers!

Want to decorate windows or advertise daily specials? These Chalk Markers by Colore are great for writing on windows, erasable boards, and many other surfaces. My daughter loves them for our windows and we like that they are easily cleaned off.We were provided a set of these for review and find them to be an excellent set of chalk markers. They are colorful and easy to use. Your creativity and artistic ability are the only limitations for these markers.A neon green silicone holder came with the set and this holds the markers on the counter or desk just great. My daughter loves them.

I grabbed these at Petco's website on a 50% off sale, so at $2.49 they were a very good deal (got free shipping because my order was over a certain amount).  Even at $4.99 each I think they would be a good purchase for my hammies.  I have two of these, one for each roborovski dwarf hamster I have.  They immediately took to them - they climb over them and run under them... Sometimes they just sit under them while they eat a snack.  It's been 3 or 4 months now and the hams still find these bridges interesting.They don't chew on them much, they've just nibbled it to test it, but they have Paragon Whimzees small dog chews that they love.  My hams just aren't big wood chewers.I didn't find these bridges flimsy at all, I think they're sturdy for my hams - but my robo dwarf hamsters are small, they each only weigh an ounce.  The bridges don't even wobble as the hams are clambering over them.  So if you have mice or dwarf hamsters, I give this toy a thumbs up.  If you have a Syrian hamster, I think they might be too big & will topple this toy over.

My two robo dwarf hamsters love this sand, it's soft and fine and easy on their paws, with no dustiness. I've been using this sand for them for 6 months, no problems (I'll update this review if there ever are any problems).  I have it in containers so they can dig & roll to their heart's content, and I also have this sand in jars that are tilted on their side which they use as their bathroom. As someone else said, this sand clumps hamster urine quite well - "potty training" my robos has made it much easier to keep the cage clean. Very happy with the price of this sand too.  Buying it in the 25 lb box, I take it out to the garage and separate it into gallon size Ziploc bags (it fills like 2.5 bags) because it's easier to carry and use.If anyone is wondering, "Desert White" isn't really white, it's a tan color.

I've been using these clips every day in the shower for 2 months, to hold the fabric shower curtain against the wall so water doesn't escape the shower/tub enclosure.  Works great for this - after showering I remove the clips from the shower wall, shake them off then toss them on a towel to dry.  No sign of rust even after 2 months.  Very happy with these for this purpose.The suction cups are only a little over 1" in diameter so they're not made to hold a lot of weight, FYI.UPDATE:  Now it's been 6 months and they're still working & looking great.

While I didn't like these cornbread croutons (but I am a *very* picky eater so these being just "different" - slightly different texture, flavor - than regular croutons was what turned me off), my husband loved them with chili.  I kept a couple bags for him but gave the rest to my parents who had them at our family dinner gatherings, and they were a hit.My family had them with salads, with soup... The croutons were gone in less than a month.  Everybody liked them because they were "different" from regular croutons (someday, oh someday I will outgrow my picky eater ways and be able to enjoy these croutons).  I'm fairly confident that if you like new foods, you'll like these croutons, since everybody else in my family was reaching for more of these and asking where I'd found them.  They have a rich buttery flavor to them.  My sister, who loves cornbread with chili, bought more of these to go in chili-themed gift baskets she put together (these croutons, chili soup mixes, bottle of hot sauce).If you want to just try one bag, you can check Fresh Gourmet's website, they have a handy product locator that tells you if a store has a specific flavor you're looking for.

Whiskers the roborovski dwarf hamster would give this wheel 5 stars, she loved it and ran like mad on it - she also has a 6.5" Silent Spinner, a medium Flying Saucer, and a Wodent Wheel Jr., so of course this cheap & noisy Comfort Wheel would be her favorite.  It's just big enough for her that her back remained straight while running on it... I think any hamster bigger than a robo dwarf might be a touch too big for this 5.5" wheel.I knocked 2 stars off because it doesn't last long, at least not with Whiskers running marathons on it all night long.  I would take the wheel off its axle for cleanings and plastic shavings would fall off the axle - it's just plastic grinding on plastic as it spins.  I tried the "wrapping tape around axle then putting vegetable oil on it" YouTube tip but it didn't make the wheel any quieter, and it still ground on itself near the tip of the axle, if that makes sense.  As the plastic ground down on itself the wheel got wobblier, and after a month of use I had to throw the wheel away as the wheel was dangerously loose on the axle.  (I got her another 5.5" Comfort Wheel as a replacement and it has the same problems, so I don't think the 1st wheel was simply defective.)Also, this wheel sounds like a rattling plate when it's being used.  It didn't bother us as the hamsters' room is on the other side of the house from our bedroom..  But I know a lot of people have their hamster in their bedroom, and this wheel isn't the best for that situation unless you're a heavy sleeper or you have some sort of white noise machine to drown out the rattling of the wheel.For a few dollars more, I recommend going with the Kaytee Silent Spinner instead - it's 6.5" size is better suited for all dwarf hamsters, it's quieter, and our Silent Spinners (our other robo dwarf hamster runs hard on her Silent Spinner every night) have lasted 5 months just fine so in the long run the Silent Spinners are actually a better value.

I love this sucralose powder and highly recommend it.  I first ordered the 50 grams to try it out, and now I buy the 250 gram size package, which will last me a long time.I make sweet tea in quart size jars and use 12 packets of Splenda in a jar (yes, I have a sweet tooth) and it was a bit bothersome counting out packets and tearing each one open.  With this BulkSupplements sucralose powder, I use 1/16 teaspoon in each jar of tea and to me it seems to be the same sweetness as 12 packets Splenda.Love it love it love it, and much cheaper than buying Splenda packets.  Also, each Splenda packet actually has 4 calories and when I'm using 12 at a time (48 calories!) it adds up.  This sucralose powder is truly calorie-free because it doesn't have the filler that Splenda has.

What gets this a 1-star rating is the fluffy stuff in the middle - I don't know what it is, but if it is what it looks like (fluffy cotton or polyester fiber?) then it's very hazardous for hamsters.  If they pouch it, it can stick to the lining of their cheeks and they can't get it out, leading to a cheek impaction (deadly if not treated).  Or it can get caught in their digestive systems, also deadly.  It's why fabric or thread or yarn shouldn't be used around hamsters at all.  I have 2 roborovski dwarf hamsters and I knew the fluffy yellow stuff in the middle of this toy was a no-no, so I removed every last wisp of the fluff from the wood part of the toy.Just the wood alone is 5 stars, my hams love it.  They only chew it a little (they have Paragon Whimzees alligator dental dog treats to chew on), but they really like scrambling over the wood block, and will go out of their way just to pass through the middle of the wood block as they go from one place to another.  They find it interesting, so that's a thumbs up for me.Still, I think it's irresponsible for Multipet to put that fluffy fiber in the middle of the toy so my 1 star rating stands - if someone doesn't know better then they'll give it to their hamster which will cause a lot of suffering.

My roborovski dwarf hamsters love these little sand baths, I have one for each ham.  It's been several weeks but they don't use them as potties (for going pee, they seem to prefer small glass jars tilted on their side with some sand in them), but they took to them right away with no hesitation, using them as sand baths & rolling around with joy.  Sometimes they just sit in there because they like to.  Highly recommend these, my hamsters use them every day & it's quite fun for them.  Also it's a bonus that the lid on these keeps sand from being flung around the cage when they roll around or get into a digging mood.I'm not sure I would recommend these for a Syrian hamster as I think these sand baths are too small for that species of hamster (I've never had Syrians, but I understand they're about 4 times the size of my little robo dwarfs).  But for robos like mine, or other dwarf hamster species, these sand baths are the perfect size.I ordered these from "uxcell" directly (not the Fulfilled By Amazon option) and my order took 2 weeks to arrive from overseas, which is fine as I wanted to save a couple bucks per sand bath.  Also, they came in a plastic shipping bag with no bubble wrap protection, yet these plastic sand baths didn't have a single crack or scratch on them... these little sand baths are surprisingly sturdy and well made.

We get mice in the cupboard space under our master bathroom jet tub (not in the kitchen, but in the bathroom... it seems odd).  I usually use the Rat Zapper Ultra which I really like for a lot of reasons, but its big downside is that it should be meticulously cleaned after each mouse kill, otherwise we eventually get "misfires" as the trigger plate corrodes and the Rat Zapper can no longer be used.I liked these Victor Clean Kill traps because of their low cost and they're easy to reset, no careful cleaning needed between kills.  I hadn't used traps in several months so the mice had moved back in and were getting comfortable.  I used peanut butter as my bait, and had my first mouse kill the 2nd night after setting it under the master bath tub area.  I caught mouse #2 the night after that.  Then, no more.  That's typical, we catch 2-3 mice then nothing for months, no sign of mice.So for me, these Victor Clean Kill traps worked as they should, and when they start getting gross they're inexpensive enough to toss and by more.  Recommended.

We've been using this for 6 weeks now.  It's a nice unit and I think it's pretty easy to use, but I'm fairly good with computers and tablets.  This isn't something I would get for someone like my mom, who doesn't adapt well to new technology (she still needs my help to adjust the ringer volume on her smartphone, bless her heart) - for tablets and computers she seems to do better with Apple products.  But for people like me who can figure things out, or know how to use Google for help, this 2-in-1 is great.  I'm unfamiliar with Windows, but still I got the hang of this interface quickly.My husband and I just use this for web browsing, emailing, streaming TV shows on Netflix, and playing basic games, like card games, Angry Birds, that sort of thing.  For these things, it's great and that's what I recommend it for.  Seems to be getting an average of 7-8 hours before we need to charge it.

This is a cute Santa hat with beard and mustache. My son actually loves it and has been wearing it ever since it arrived in the mail. The beard has a nice elastic on the back to easily fit around your head to hold it in place. Which does fit adults and children. The hat is also very soft and able to be worn by both adults and children. The beard is pretty thin so you aren't sweating while wearing it. I think this would be great for wearing during the holidays or even for kids dress up time. It's well made and a great price! This is a great collection of fossils. I home school my kids and seeing and being able to touch is the best way to learn and retain what you are learning. In this mounted specimen kit you get 10 different specimens. Which include shark's tooth, dinosaur bone, turritella, ammonite, crinoid stem, trilobite, orthoceras, pelecypod, brachiopod, and pertrified wood. What I did was go on the internet and pull up a lesson about each of them so it turned this one little kit into 10 lessons and the kids had tons of fun and actually like having this displayed in their room. I would highly recommend this kit to others. I received this for free in exchange for my review, good or bad. I was not paid or sponsored for my opinions all thoughts reflected in this review are my own.

If you are looking for great quality pretty marbles this is the set for you. You get 50 count inside of a resealable plastic container. 1:07 MinsThis little worm is super cute. It is full of bright colors, lights and sounds. It comes with batteries already installed so you can play right out of the package. You press the ear to turn the sound on which plays out of the other ear and I am pleasantly surprised that it isn't overly loud it's a nice comfortable volume. However after you turn it on you can shut it off by pressing the button again. The head can move from side to side. You can also roll the worm on your own or if you press the middle of the worm down he will roll on his own which is also a lot of fun, since he goes super fast. The beads and swirls in the wheels are also very fascinating for kids to look at. I find this to be a great sensory toy for younger kids. It's a simple yet fulfilling toy. As a mother myself I would highly recommend this toy. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

These Lavender flowers are perfect for inside my heat packs. I like to make my own heat packs with corn and I find essential oil scent seems to fade to quickly so I wanted to go with the real thing and I am very pleased with this pack. It comes in a silver foil resealable bag which is great when not using a lot at a time. I added about 2 cups into my heat pack and it gives a nice lavender scent that isn't overpowering but very relaxing. The flowers are not as purple as the picture shows but in my case color doesn't really matter it's all about the scent. I have heated mine up numerous times since I have gotten my order and it still smells just as fresh. I will for sure be purchasing this again. It would be great for making homemade scented gifts for others this holiday season.To make the heat pack as I do I just take a flannel cloth and sew it shut in a rectangle shape then add corn feed and mix the lavender in then heat for 2 minutes. Heating time varies depending on person need and microwave.

I bought this organic corn to use in heat packs that I make. I suffer from back pain often and heat is the only relief I can get so I bought this to make my own as I was spending so much money buying pre-made ones and I am very satisfied with the quality. I have it in a flannel cloth that I sewed shut along with lavender flowers. I love that the corn doesn't pop or give off a bad smell. I love the corn so much that I made one with just the corn. It is a great sensory item for my daughter who is slightly autistic. I will definitely be buying this bag again when it comes time for me to make more!

2:14 MinsI am loving how cute this fire truck toy is. Is is small, bright, colorful and full of lights and sounds. One thing I really like is this has an easy to switch English or Spanish setting. It also has a no sound setting so you don't even need it to talk but it won't be completely off. On the bottom of the truck there is an off button that can switch to go which makes the center wheel pop up which allows movement. The firetruck will move in all directions and if it bumps anything it will back up and move a different way. It takes 3 AA batteries which is secure underneath the fire truck with a small screw so only an adult will be able to open the battery area. This is a really neat and fun toy that will have your child entertained for hours. As a mother myself I would highly recommend this toy as it's educational and safe. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Easy solution to keeping your plumbing clear every month. This is every easy to use. You use the included scoop to add a double dose of PlumbClear into a cup of warm NOT hot water and let it sit for 2-4 hours this is how the enzymes activate before you pour them into the drain. After the enzymes have activated you just simply pour into your toilet or down the drain. One week after your first treatment you do the same process again. Then you do it once a month after that. So only your very first month do you have to do it more then once but again it's super easy and safe for your plumbing. I of course don't know what is going on inside the pipes but I can say we haven't had any issues since using it. I will continue to use this every month and I feel comfortable enough to recommend to others. I received this for a discounted price in exchange for my review, good or bad. I was not paid or sponsored for my opinions all thoughts reflected in this review are my own.

2:35 MinsThis is beyond super cool! It's not only interesting to learn about it's amazing to watch! The slime comes in a nice tin to keep it in. When you get it the magnet is on top of a closed packet of the slime. The slime is a bit moist when you first take it out of the package but after you play with it for a little bit it goes away. Now the fun part is watching how the slime will either attract the magnet or it will pull itself towards the magnet which will result in it devouring the magnet which is pretty neat to watch. Even though the magnet pulls the slime towards it, it takes a little bit of time before it is fully around the entire magnet, which you can see in my video. My kids were just as amazed as I was with the results.  We have been having tons of fun and would highly recommend this product to others. I use a heat pack just about daily for back and neck pain. I must say I really like this one due to it's size. It's long which is perfect for covering my entire lower back and it's great for getting around my entire neck. The material this is made out of is a thick fleece that provides a nice barrier between the rice on the inside so you get just enough of the heat through without burning yourself. I also like the bright colors. I got the canyon turquoise style and the turquoise, red, yellow, white, brown and black all go together great with a nice design. The rice delivers a nice even heat and surprisingly it stays hot for a decent amount of time. This heat wrap also stays in place so you don't need to worry about holding it in the right position. I have used other heat packs in the past and I must say I am very pleased with this one as it doesn't have a smell to it before or after cooking. It also doesn't take a long time to get the desired heat needed to relax your muscles. I personally heat it for 2 minutes then shake the rice around and heat for an additional 30 seconds and it's good to go. I am very satisfied with this product and I would highly recommend this to others who have daily pain or even to have on hand for the occasional pain. I got Xoom cubes not so much for the game aspect of it but as a way to help my dyslexic daughter. She is 8 and I home school her and anything that has to do with letters gets her frazzled. Trying to find unique fun ways to help her and not confuse her brain so much I decided to give these a shot I figured she can see the letters and not be overwhelmed. We start by using them for spelling words and it really helps her to have the cubes in front of her so she can focus one letter at a time. Her brain doesn't work like ours does so when she sees a bunch of letters together it starts mixing them up which can drive anyone crazy. I am finding teaching her this way is helping her a lot and she isn't getting headaches and is actually learning. I am very impressed and absolutely love this concept. Once she is more confidant in herself we will use this in the traditional way but it is a step in the right direction for now. I received this for a discounted price in exchange for my review, good or bad. I was not paid or sponsored for my opinions all thoughts reflected in this review are my own.

0:36 MinsAs a home schooling Mom I am always looking for hands on projects to do with my kids. This was perfect for that. Uncle Beaudreaux's owl pellet kit comes with gloves, tweezers, wooden picking stick, and 2 owl pellets. I like that it came with 2 owl pellets as each one of my kids were able to dig into their own pellet. You also get a brief history lesson on owls and these pellets. Before reading my daughter who is 8 stopped me in my tracks and said "is this poop? Gross, I'm out" however once we read we learned that owl pellets in fact are NOT poop they are regurgitated so they consist of bones and feathers that an owl can not digest. Very similar to a cat hair ball. The kids had fun digging through sorting everything they found and comparing one pellet to the other. This is one project that they won't forget. I am very happy with how great this science lesson worked out for them. They got to learn and have first hand knowledge of what an owl pellet is. I would highly recommend this educational kit as it's an excellent learning experience for kids of all ages. I received this for free in exchange for my honest review. I was not paid or sponsored for my opinions all thoughts reflected in this review are my own.
