This is an awesome little salt/pepper grinder!!  Unfortunately this didn't come with any directions, but it wasn't too hard to figure out.It came in a white box and after opening, the top silver part pulls off to expose where you put the batteries.  It takes 6 AAA batteries around the top.  You then remove the black part the batteries are on to fill the bottom.  I actually used ~70% salt and 30% black pepper which I though was a great combo since I have simple salt shakers and pepper shakers, but rather than having two grinders when I usually add somewhere around that ratio while cooking I thought it was an easy way to kill two birds with one stone.Anyway, when putting it back together make sure the little metal prongs on the top black part meet the little metal plates on the bottom piece so the power from the batteries can power the grinder in the base.  After the black part is attached to the base, then you can slip the top silver part back on and lock it so it's secure.Now on to grinding!  There is a convenient little light on the bottom of the grinder to help better see the amount that is being ground onto your food.  Although it's not the brightest light, it is there to help.  The first time I used it I thought it was grinding somewhat slowly, but then I realized if I'm using this on a meal I don't want it to grind a lot of salt/pepper really fast.  I would rather put on less salt/pepper than have it grind fast and put too much on.  So when using this while cooking recipes, it's great because I'm not trying to add a tablespoon of salt or pepper and when I am cooking a recipe that calls for more thats when I get a measuring spoon and measure table salt.The grinder has two labels, twist one direction to get a more coarse grind and the other direction for a finer grind.  Personally I didn't see much of a difference between the fine and coarse grind (see last pic).  Either way this grinder grinds more finely than most restaurant black pepper grinders and I like that about it.Overall I really like this grinder, it's simple and easy to use.  I think it would be especially easy to use for anyone with pain or arthritis in their hands and wrists and would make it easier than twisting a traditional salt/pepper grinder.  Very pleased.________________Made by: iNeiboMade in: ChinaASIN: B0142IQB26Product provided for review by:  iNeiboShipped by: iNeibo

My phone is not ALWAYS with me, and when I travel, particularly out of the country, I cant use the app from my computer, and I cant log into a website to view the feed either.  That being said, I would feel like my information is more secure if I didn't have to download a foreign app to view my feed, and I'd like this camera more if the app was even compatible with my iPad, unfortunately it is not.I have ordered other SkyGenius products and been very happy with them and the quality of their products. I LOVE this little speaker!  It is TINY.  It's about the size of a small shot glass.PROS:-  It has super crisp clear sound.  It doesn't have heavy base but the audio is very clear.- No white-noise when audio is not playing.  I have a larger bluetooth speaker that was more expensive and whenever music is not playing it has an annoying white noise sound coming from the speaker, and another bluetooth speaker I had also had the same problem.  But this one does not give off any sound of white noise or static when music is not playing, which is really nice.- It gets surprisingly loud for a little speaker.  It's not enough to play music in a whole house but you can definitely hear it a few rooms away if it's on the loudest volume.- Very easy to use - one button on the bottom to power it on and off.- Very sleek/simple design.- Very easy to take with you or bring around the house since it's so small.CONS:- Bluetooth range starts to get choppy if you take your phone (or whatever is the audio/music source) more than 15-20 feet from the speaker or in another room.- You can't turn the volume up/down on the speaker itself, only from the volume button on what it's connected to.- The power button is not a simple 1-click ON/OFF, you have to hold it for 3-4 seconds to turn it on and to turn it off.- Rather than a simple tone/beep when the device is turned on and when it is connected.  When you turn it on there is some brief music and then there is a ladies voice that says that the device is turned on and ready to be paired and then she speaks again to say that the bluetooth device is connected.  I'd rather not have to listen to music and a persons voice every time I turn it on and pair it.Overall, for the price, this is an AWESOME little speaker.  It's definitely a better quality than I expected for the price.  Very pleased._______________Made by: TonbuxMade in: ChinaColor: SilverASIN: B0144M9YYCItem model number: MB1Product provided for review by: Cachary56789Shipped by: Amazon LLCDelivered: 3 days after order date.

This is a nice resistance band and it's definitely long enough to do a whole slew of workouts.  The bands are listed as lbs. of tension per band, which can be a little confusing. Basically, the bigger bands will pull you up to the bar more easily, or with less effort -- so if you weigh a lot and need just a little help, or if you don't weigh much and need a lot of help, you'd use the same band.If you're looking for something just to help with pull ups then generally the bigger bands are where you might want to start out and work your way down to the smaller ones. If you mainly want these for other resistance training, then you'll probably want to start with the smaller ones because they provide less resistance -- but you can always double it back on itself because they are so long, to get more resistance with the same band.  This is definitely a high quality band and it's been helping me out, working great._____________________Made by: KYLIN SPORTColor: Purple - 35 to 85 Pounds (1.25" x 41")ASIN: B00VFVIW08Provided for review by: KYLIN SPORTShipped by: Amazon LLC

I determined that must have been a faulty string, so I shipped them back and got a replacement and that replacement works great, lights up as it should and blinks as it should in each of the modes. These lights are so easy and convenient to use!  I love that they don't have to be plugged in to an outlet so I can put them far out in my front yard or even around my mailbox and not need an extension cord to power them.  They work well and charge quickly.  They actually were able to blink right out of the box, although I turned them off and let them charge before testing all the blinking settings.  These work inside if you can keep the solar panel in a window that gets a decent amount of sunlight, or even easier outside.  The solar panel can twist to almost any angle, so you can either keep it facing the sun where the sun rises or just keep it facing straight up so it gets sun throughout the day.  The only downside to these is they wouldn't be great to use outdoors in a place that snows a lot, [obviously] because if the solar panel can't get enough sun then these won't stay on.  But also because these are LED lights and like regular outdoor holiday lights, these don't get nearly as warm/hot as regular bulbs.  So where regular holiday light strings may be able to melt a little of the snow so they can show through, these will likely not melt the snow as easily or show through as much.  But we don't live in a very snowy area so I'm excited to take these from our back porch out to the front yard this winter. I was kindly supplied this item free of charge to test and evaluate. In exchange, I agreed to provide an honest review detailing my thoughts. This is my review.This blood pressure (BP) monitor was east to open, set up and use.  It is compact and works well.  To explain what I mean by "well" I took my mothers BP monitor that is a larger and more expensive machine and took my blood pressure and her blood pressure 4 times with her machine and 4 times with this Forestfish monitor.  Our blood pressures were taken while sitting in the upright position, feet flat on the floor, and taken on the same arm for each of the two devices (not one cuff on both arms at once). Results were as follows : (Monitor 1 = my mothers BP monitor,  Patient 1 = Me,  Patient 2 = My mother)PATIENT 1: BP (systolic/diastolic) & PulseMonitor 1:128/84  79134/90  80122/85  79129/89  72Average: 128.25/87  77.5Forestfish Monitor:128/87  79128/88  74126/86  78124/79  76Average: 126.5/85  76.75____________________PATIENT 2:  BP & PulseMonitor 1:106/72  65106/72  62102/73  63 97/76  68Average: 102.75/73.25  64.5Forestfish Monitor:112/66  6691/54  6793/65  6994/61  67Average: 97.5/61.5  67.25So my values only differed by 2 mmHg or less in the systolic and diastolic blood pressures, and my average pulses differed by not even one heart beat.  My mothers systolic (top/first number in the fraction) differed by ~5 mmHg, but her diastolic (bottom/second number) differed by 11.75 mmHg, which is a lot, but when measuring blood pressure systolic blood pressure being high tends to be the more worrisome one in most people.  Also without using a sphygmomanometer (non-electronic BP cuff & dial) and a stethoscope to take our blood pressure, there is no way to tell which of the two monitors may be off.  But seeing how the averages were so close among my (Patient 1) values, I trust that this monitor is as good as the next monitor.  I will update this review and compare the Forestfish monitor to a sphygmomanometer when I am able to get my hands on one.  But until then I think this is a pretty good BP monitor, just make sure if you're not in the medical field to read the directions on when and how to take your BP -- rest for at least 5 minutes before blood pressure is taken, sit upright, feet flat on the floor, legs uncrossed, arm supported and cuff mid-arm at heart level, 3cm from the fold of elbow, back supported, tube coming out towards your hand, in line with your artery etc.  All of this will help get a more accurate reading no matter what person or machine is taking your BP :)___________________Made by: ForestfishMade in: ChinaColor: Type2ASIN: B014T1B59AUPC: 710373501799Product provided for review by: ForestfishShipped by: Forestfish

I am a big fan of warranties because it shows that a brand is willing to stand behind their product, and so I like that this comes with a 12-month warranty.I like that it easily compacts and folds up, the handles aren't ridged so it can fold up pretty small -- so it's easy to keep next to the couch or between the couch cushions and just pull it out and do some stretches and resistance training while watching TV!
